data.footnotes: [1232]- Literally, "Opener," i.e., He who decides and lays open all matters in truth and justice and who opens the way to victory, success, relief, knowledge and understanding.

data.price: (27) Say, "Show me those whom you have attached to Him as partners. No! Rather, He [alone] is Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Wise."
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرُونِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَلۡحَقۡتُم بِهِۦ شُرَكَآءَۖ كَلَّاۚ بَلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ

data.price: (28) And We have not sent you except comprehensively[1233] to mankind as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. But most of the people do not know.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ إِلَّا كَآفَّةٗ لِّلنَّاسِ بَشِيرٗا وَنَذِيرٗا وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1233]- Literally, "inclusively, without exception."

data.price: (29) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (30) Say, "For you is the appointment of a Day [when] you will not remain thereafter an hour, nor will you precede [it]."
data.arabic: قُل لَّكُم مِّيعَادُ يَوۡمٖ لَّا تَسۡتَـٔۡخِرُونَ عَنۡهُ سَاعَةٗ وَلَا تَسۡتَقۡدِمُونَ

data.price: (31) And those who disbelieve say, "We will never believe in this Qur’ān nor in that before it." But if you could see when the wrongdoers are made to stand before their Lord, refuting each others' words...[1234] Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "If not for you, we would have been believers."
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَن نُّؤۡمِنَ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ وَلَا بِٱلَّذِي بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡهِۗ وَلَوۡ تَرَىٰٓ إِذِ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ مَوۡقُوفُونَ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ يَرۡجِعُ بَعۡضُهُمۡ إِلَىٰ بَعۡضٍ ٱلۡقَوۡلَ يَقُولُ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتُضۡعِفُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ لَوۡلَآ أَنتُمۡ لَكُنَّا مُؤۡمِنِينَ
data.footnotes: [1234]- Having been left to the imagination, the conclusion of this sentence is estimated to be "...you would see a dreadful sight."

data.price: (32) Those who were arrogant will say to those who were oppressed, "Did we avert you from guidance after it had come to you? Rather, you were criminals."
data.arabic: قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتُضۡعِفُوٓاْ أَنَحۡنُ صَدَدۡنَٰكُمۡ عَنِ ٱلۡهُدَىٰ بَعۡدَ إِذۡ جَآءَكُمۖ بَلۡ كُنتُم مُّجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: (33) Those who were oppressed will say to those who were arrogant, "Rather, [it was your] conspiracy of night and day when you were ordering us to disbelieve in Allāh and attribute to Him equals." But they will [all] confide regret when they see the punishment; and We will put shackles on the necks of those who disbelieved. Will they be recompensed except for what they used to do?
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتُضۡعِفُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ٱسۡتَكۡبَرُواْ بَلۡ مَكۡرُ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذۡ تَأۡمُرُونَنَآ أَن نَّكۡفُرَ بِٱللَّهِ وَنَجۡعَلَ لَهُۥٓ أَندَادٗاۚ وَأَسَرُّواْ ٱلنَّدَامَةَ لَمَّا رَأَوُاْ ٱلۡعَذَابَۚ وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلۡأَغۡلَٰلَ فِيٓ أَعۡنَاقِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۖ هَلۡ يُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (34) And We did not send into a city any warner except that its affluent said, "Indeed we, in that with which you were sent, are disbelievers."
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا فِي قَرۡيَةٖ مِّن نَّذِيرٍ إِلَّا قَالَ مُتۡرَفُوهَآ إِنَّا بِمَآ أُرۡسِلۡتُم بِهِۦ كَٰفِرُونَ

data.price: (35) And they[1235] said, "We are more [than the believers] in wealth and children, and we are not to be punished."
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ نَحۡنُ أَكۡثَرُ أَمۡوَٰلٗا وَأَوۡلَٰدٗا وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ
data.footnotes: [1235]- The affluent ones in general or the people of Makkah specifically.

data.price: (36) Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills and restricts [it], but most of the people do not know."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَبۡسُطُ ٱلرِّزۡقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَقۡدِرُ وَلَٰكِنَّ أَكۡثَرَ ٱلنَّاسِ لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (37) And it is not your wealth or your children that bring you nearer to Us in position, but it is [by being] one who has believed and done righteousness. For them there will be the double reward for what they did, and they will be in the upper chambers [of Paradise], safe [and secure].
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَمۡوَٰلُكُمۡ وَلَآ أَوۡلَٰدُكُم بِٱلَّتِي تُقَرِّبُكُمۡ عِندَنَا زُلۡفَىٰٓ إِلَّا مَنۡ ءَامَنَ وَعَمِلَ صَٰلِحٗا فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمۡ جَزَآءُ ٱلضِّعۡفِ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡغُرُفَٰتِ ءَامِنُونَ

data.price: (38) And the ones who strive against Our verses to cause [them] failure[1236] - those will be brought into the punishment [to remain].
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يَسۡعَوۡنَ فِيٓ ءَايَٰتِنَا مُعَٰجِزِينَ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ فِي ٱلۡعَذَابِ مُحۡضَرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1236]- See footnote to 34:5.

data.price: (39) Say, "Indeed, my Lord extends provision for whom He wills of His servants and restricts [it] for him. But whatever thing you spend [in His cause] - He will compensate it; and He is the best of providers."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَبۡسُطُ ٱلرِّزۡقَ لِمَن يَشَآءُ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِۦ وَيَقۡدِرُ لَهُۥۚ وَمَآ أَنفَقۡتُم مِّن شَيۡءٖ فَهُوَ يُخۡلِفُهُۥۖ وَهُوَ خَيۡرُ ٱلرَّٰزِقِينَ

data.price: (40) And [mention] the Day when He will gather them all and then say to the angels, "Did these [people] used to worship you?"
data.arabic: وَيَوۡمَ يَحۡشُرُهُمۡ جَمِيعٗا ثُمَّ يَقُولُ لِلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ أَهَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِيَّاكُمۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (41) They will say, "Exalted are You! You, [O Allāh], are our benefactor excluding [i.e., not] them. Rather, they used to worship the jinn; most of them were believers in them."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ سُبۡحَٰنَكَ أَنتَ وَلِيُّنَا مِن دُونِهِمۖ بَلۡ كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ ٱلۡجِنَّۖ أَكۡثَرُهُم بِهِم مُّؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (42) But today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] you do not hold for one another [the power of] benefit or harm, and We will say to those who wronged, "Taste the punishment of the Fire, which you used to deny."
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا يَمۡلِكُ بَعۡضُكُمۡ لِبَعۡضٖ نَّفۡعٗا وَلَا ضَرّٗا وَنَقُولُ لِلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ ذُوقُواْ عَذَابَ ٱلنَّارِ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُم بِهَا تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (43) And when Our verses are recited to them as clear evidences, they say, "This is not but a man who wishes to avert you from that which your fathers were worshipping." And they say, "This is not except a lie invented." And those who disbelieve say of the truth when it has come to them, "This is not but obvious magic."
data.arabic: وَإِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ءَايَٰتُنَا بَيِّنَٰتٖ قَالُواْ مَا هَٰذَآ إِلَّا رَجُلٞ يُرِيدُ أَن يَصُدَّكُمۡ عَمَّا كَانَ يَعۡبُدُ ءَابَآؤُكُمۡ وَقَالُواْ مَا هَٰذَآ إِلَّآ إِفۡكٞ مُّفۡتَرٗىۚ وَقَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِلۡحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمۡ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: (44) And We had not given them any scriptures which they could study, and We had not sent to them before you, [O Muḥammad], any warner.
data.arabic: وَمَآ ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُم مِّن كُتُبٖ يَدۡرُسُونَهَاۖ وَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِمۡ قَبۡلَكَ مِن نَّذِيرٖ

data.price: (45) And those before them denied, and they [i.e., the people of Makkah] have not attained a tenth of what We had given them. But they [i.e., the former peoples] denied My messengers, so how [terrible] was My reproach.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ وَمَا بَلَغُواْ مِعۡشَارَ مَآ ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمۡ فَكَذَّبُواْ رُسُلِيۖ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

data.price: (46) Say, "I only advise you of one [thing] - that you stand for Allāh, [seeking truth] in pairs and individually, and then give thought." There is not in your companion any madness. He is only a warner to you before a severe punishment.
data.arabic: ۞ قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَعِظُكُم بِوَٰحِدَةٍۖ أَن تَقُومُواْ لِلَّهِ مَثۡنَىٰ وَفُرَٰدَىٰ ثُمَّ تَتَفَكَّرُواْۚ مَا بِصَاحِبِكُم مِّن جِنَّةٍۚ إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٞ لَّكُم بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡ عَذَابٖ شَدِيدٖ

data.price: (47) Say, "Whatever payment I might have asked of you - it is yours. My payment is only from Allāh, and He is, over all things, Witness."
data.arabic: قُلۡ مَا سَأَلۡتُكُم مِّنۡ أَجۡرٖ فَهُوَ لَكُمۡۖ إِنۡ أَجۡرِيَ إِلَّا عَلَى ٱللَّهِۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٞ

data.price: (48) Say, "Indeed, my Lord projects the truth, Knower of the unseen."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ رَبِّي يَقۡذِفُ بِٱلۡحَقِّ عَلَّٰمُ ٱلۡغُيُوبِ

data.price: (49) Say, "The truth has come, and falsehood can neither begin [anything] nor repeat [it]."[1237]
data.arabic: قُلۡ جَآءَ ٱلۡحَقُّ وَمَا يُبۡدِئُ ٱلۡبَٰطِلُ وَمَا يُعِيدُ
data.footnotes: [1237]- This expression alludes to complete inability, meaning that falsehood was abolished.

data.price: (50) Say, "If I should err, I would only err against myself. But if I am guided, it is by what my Lord reveals to me. Indeed, He is Hearing and near."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِن ضَلَلۡتُ فَإِنَّمَآ أَضِلُّ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِيۖ وَإِنِ ٱهۡتَدَيۡتُ فَبِمَا يُوحِيٓ إِلَيَّ رَبِّيٓۚ إِنَّهُۥ سَمِيعٞ قَرِيبٞ

data.price: (51) And if you could see[1238] when they are terrified but there is no escape, and they will be seized from a place nearby.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ تَرَىٰٓ إِذۡ فَزِعُواْ فَلَا فَوۡتَ وَأُخِذُواْ مِن مَّكَانٖ قَرِيبٖ
data.footnotes: [1238]- i.e., have a glimpse of the Hereafter.

data.price: (52) And they will [then] say, "We believe in it!" But how for them will be the taking[1239] [of faith] from a place far away?[1240]
data.arabic: وَقَالُوٓاْ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُمُ ٱلتَّنَاوُشُ مِن مَّكَانِۭ بَعِيدٖ
data.footnotes:
[1239]- Literally, "taking of something within easy reach," in other words, "How can they expect to obtain faith at this point?"
[1240]- i.e., their former life on earth, wherein they had every opportunity but which is now gone, never to return.

data.price: (53) And they had already disbelieved in it before and would assault[1241] the unseen from a place far away.[1242]
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ كَفَرُواْ بِهِۦ مِن قَبۡلُۖ وَيَقۡذِفُونَ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ مِن مَّكَانِۭ بَعِيدٖ
data.footnotes:
[1241]- Verbally, by conjecture and denial.
[1242]- i.e., a position far from truth.

data.price: (54) And prevention will be placed between them and what they desire,[1243] as was done with their kind before. Indeed, they were in disquieting doubt [i.e., denial].
data.arabic: وَحِيلَ بَيۡنَهُمۡ وَبَيۡنَ مَا يَشۡتَهُونَ كَمَا فُعِلَ بِأَشۡيَاعِهِم مِّن قَبۡلُۚ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ فِي شَكّٖ مُّرِيبِۭ
data.footnotes: [1243]- Meaning the attainment of faith and its benefits or entrance into Paradise.

data.price: (1) [All] praise is [due] to Allāh, Creator of the heavens and the earth, [who] made the angels messengers having wings, two or three or four. He increases in creation what He wills. Indeed, Allāh is over all things competent.
data.arabic: ٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ فَاطِرِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ جَاعِلِ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةِ رُسُلًا أُوْلِيٓ أَجۡنِحَةٖ مَّثۡنَىٰ وَثُلَٰثَ وَرُبَٰعَۚ يَزِيدُ فِي ٱلۡخَلۡقِ مَا يَشَآءُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ

data.price: (2) Whatever Allāh grants to people of mercy - none can withhold it; and whatever He withholds - none can release it thereafter. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
data.arabic: مَّا يَفۡتَحِ ٱللَّهُ لِلنَّاسِ مِن رَّحۡمَةٖ فَلَا مُمۡسِكَ لَهَاۖ وَمَا يُمۡسِكۡ فَلَا مُرۡسِلَ لَهُۥ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦۚ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ

data.price: (3) O mankind, remember the favor of Allāh upon you. Is there any creator other than Allāh who provides for you from the heaven and earth? There is no deity except Him, so how are you deluded?
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱذۡكُرُواْ نِعۡمَتَ ٱللَّهِ عَلَيۡكُمۡۚ هَلۡ مِنۡ خَٰلِقٍ غَيۡرُ ٱللَّهِ يَرۡزُقُكُم مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَۖ فَأَنَّىٰ تُؤۡفَكُونَ

data.price: (4) And if they deny you, [O Muḥammad] - already were messengers denied before you. And to Allāh are returned [all] matters.
data.arabic: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدۡ كُذِّبَتۡ رُسُلٞ مِّن قَبۡلِكَۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرۡجَعُ ٱلۡأُمُورُ

data.price: (5) O mankind, indeed the promise of Allāh is truth, so let not the worldly life delude you and be not deceived about Allāh by the Deceiver [i.e., Satan].
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ إِنَّ وَعۡدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقّٞۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡغَرُورُ

data.price: (6) Indeed, Satan is an enemy to you; so take him as an enemy. He only invites his party to be among the companions of the Blaze.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَ لَكُمۡ عَدُوّٞ فَٱتَّخِذُوهُ عَدُوًّاۚ إِنَّمَا يَدۡعُواْ حِزۡبَهُۥ لِيَكُونُواْ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ

data.price: (7) Those who disbelieve will have a severe punishment, and those who believe and do righteous deeds will have forgiveness and great reward.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُم مَّغۡفِرَةٞ وَأَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٌ

data.price: (8) Then is one to whom the evil of his deed has been made attractive so he considers it good [like one rightly guided]? For indeed, Allāh sends astray whom He wills and guides whom He wills. So do not let yourself perish over them in regret. Indeed, Allāh is Knowing of what they do.
data.arabic: أَفَمَن زُيِّنَ لَهُۥ سُوٓءُ عَمَلِهِۦ فَرَءَاهُ حَسَنٗاۖ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُضِلُّ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۖ فَلَا تَذۡهَبۡ نَفۡسُكَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَسَرَٰتٍۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمُۢ بِمَا يَصۡنَعُونَ

data.price: (9) And it is Allāh who sends the winds, and they stir the clouds, and We drive them to a dead land and give life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness. Thus is the resurrection.
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَرۡسَلَ ٱلرِّيَٰحَ فَتُثِيرُ سَحَابٗا فَسُقۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ بَلَدٖ مَّيِّتٖ فَأَحۡيَيۡنَا بِهِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ مَوۡتِهَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ ٱلنُّشُورُ

data.price: (10) Whoever desires honor [through power] - then to Allāh belongs all honor.[1245] To Him ascends good speech, and righteous work raises it.[1246] But they who plot evil deeds will have a severe punishment, and the plotting of those - it will perish.
data.arabic: مَن كَانَ يُرِيدُ ٱلۡعِزَّةَ فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡعِزَّةُ جَمِيعًاۚ إِلَيۡهِ يَصۡعَدُ ٱلۡكَلِمُ ٱلطَّيِّبُ وَٱلۡعَمَلُ ٱلصَّٰلِحُ يَرۡفَعُهُۥۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ يَمۡكُرُونَ ٱلسَّيِّـَٔاتِ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞۖ وَمَكۡرُ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُوَ يَبُورُ
data.footnotes:
[1245]- See footnote to 4:139.
[1246]- For acceptance by Allāh, meaning that righteous deeds are confirmation and proof of what is uttered by the tongue.

data.price: (11) And Allāh created you from dust, then from a sperm-drop; then He made you mates. And no female conceives nor does she give birth except with His knowledge. And no aged person is granted [additional] life nor is his lifespan lessened but that it is in a register. Indeed, that for Allāh is easy.
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُم مِّن تُرَابٖ ثُمَّ مِن نُّطۡفَةٖ ثُمَّ جَعَلَكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗاۚ وَمَا تَحۡمِلُ مِنۡ أُنثَىٰ وَلَا تَضَعُ إِلَّا بِعِلۡمِهِۦۚ وَمَا يُعَمَّرُ مِن مُّعَمَّرٖ وَلَا يُنقَصُ مِنۡ عُمُرِهِۦٓ إِلَّا فِي كِتَٰبٍۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٞ

data.price: (12) And not alike are the two seas [i.e., bodies of water]. One is fresh and sweet, palatable for drinking, and one is salty and bitter. And from each you eat tender meat and extract ornaments which you wear, and you see the ships plowing through [them] that you might seek of His bounty; and perhaps you will be grateful.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَسۡتَوِي ٱلۡبَحۡرَانِ هَٰذَا عَذۡبٞ فُرَاتٞ سَآئِغٞ شَرَابُهُۥ وَهَٰذَا مِلۡحٌ أُجَاجٞۖ وَمِن كُلّٖ تَأۡكُلُونَ لَحۡمٗا طَرِيّٗا وَتَسۡتَخۡرِجُونَ حِلۡيَةٗ تَلۡبَسُونَهَاۖ وَتَرَى ٱلۡفُلۡكَ فِيهِ مَوَاخِرَ لِتَبۡتَغُواْ مِن فَضۡلِهِۦ وَلَعَلَّكُمۡ تَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: (13) He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night and has subjected the sun and the moon - each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allāh, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. And those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.
data.arabic: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيۡلَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِي ٱلَّيۡلِ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمۡسَ وَٱلۡقَمَرَۖ كُلّٞ يَجۡرِي لِأَجَلٖ مُّسَمّٗىۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمۡ لَهُ ٱلۡمُلۡكُۚ وَٱلَّذِينَ تَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِن قِطۡمِيرٍ

data.price: (14) If you invoke them, they do not hear your supplication; and if they heard, they would not respond to you. And on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your association.[1247] And none can inform you like [one] Aware [of all matters].
data.arabic: إِن تَدۡعُوهُمۡ لَا يَسۡمَعُواْ دُعَآءَكُمۡ وَلَوۡ سَمِعُواْ مَا ٱسۡتَجَابُواْ لَكُمۡۖ وَيَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ يَكۡفُرُونَ بِشِرۡكِكُمۡۚ وَلَا يُنَبِّئُكَ مِثۡلُ خَبِيرٖ
data.footnotes: [1247]- Of them with Allāh or your worship of them.

data.price: (15) O mankind, you are those in need of Allāh, while Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
data.arabic: ۞ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ أَنتُمُ ٱلۡفُقَرَآءُ إِلَى ٱللَّهِۖ وَٱللَّهُ هُوَ ٱلۡغَنِيُّ ٱلۡحَمِيدُ

data.price: (16) If He wills, He can do away with you and bring forth a new creation.
data.arabic: إِن يَشَأۡ يُذۡهِبۡكُمۡ وَيَأۡتِ بِخَلۡقٖ جَدِيدٖ

data.price: (17) And that is for Allāh not difficult.
data.arabic: وَمَا ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ بِعَزِيزٖ

data.price: (18) And no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another. And if a heavily laden soul calls [another] to [carry some of] its load, nothing of it will be carried, even if he should be a close relative. You can only warn those who fear their Lord unseen and have established prayer. And whoever purifies himself only purifies himself for [the benefit of] his soul. And to Allāh is the [final] destination.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰۚ وَإِن تَدۡعُ مُثۡقَلَةٌ إِلَىٰ حِمۡلِهَا لَا يُحۡمَلۡ مِنۡهُ شَيۡءٞ وَلَوۡ كَانَ ذَا قُرۡبَىٰٓۗ إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ ٱلَّذِينَ يَخۡشَوۡنَ رَبَّهُم بِٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَأَقَامُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَۚ وَمَن تَزَكَّىٰ فَإِنَّمَا يَتَزَكَّىٰ لِنَفۡسِهِۦۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: (19) Not equal are the blind and the seeing,
data.arabic: وَمَا يَسۡتَوِي ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ وَٱلۡبَصِيرُ

data.price: (20) Nor are the darknesses and the light,
data.arabic: وَلَا ٱلظُّلُمَٰتُ وَلَا ٱلنُّورُ

data.price: (21) Nor are the shade and the heat,[1248]
data.arabic: وَلَا ٱلظِّلُّ وَلَا ٱلۡحَرُورُ
data.footnotes: [1248]- Of the sun or of a scorching wind.

data.price: (22) And not equal are the living and the dead. Indeed, Allāh causes to hear whom He wills, but you cannot make hear those in the graves.[1249]
data.arabic: وَمَا يَسۡتَوِي ٱلۡأَحۡيَآءُ وَلَا ٱلۡأَمۡوَٰتُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُسۡمِعُ مَن يَشَآءُۖ وَمَآ أَنتَ بِمُسۡمِعٖ مَّن فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ
data.footnotes: [1249]- The four comparisons given by Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) in verses 19-22 are those of the believer and unbeliever, various kinds of misbelief and (true) belief, Paradise and Hellfire, and those receptive to guidance and those unreceptive.

data.price: (23) You, [O Muḥammad], are not but a warner.
data.arabic: إِنۡ أَنتَ إِلَّا نَذِيرٌ

data.price: (24) Indeed, We have sent you with the truth as a bringer of good tidings and a warner. And there was no nation but that there had passed within it a warner.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَٰكَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ بَشِيرٗا وَنَذِيرٗاۚ وَإِن مِّنۡ أُمَّةٍ إِلَّا خَلَا فِيهَا نَذِيرٞ

data.price: (25) And if they deny you - then already have those before them denied. Their messengers came to them with clear proofs and written ordinances and with the enlightening Scripture.
data.arabic: وَإِن يُكَذِّبُوكَ فَقَدۡ كَذَّبَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ جَآءَتۡهُمۡ رُسُلُهُم بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَبِٱلزُّبُرِ وَبِٱلۡكِتَٰبِ ٱلۡمُنِيرِ

data.price: (26) Then I seized the ones who disbelieved, and how [terrible] was My reproach.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَخَذۡتُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۖ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ نَكِيرِ

data.price: (27) Do you not see that Allāh sends down rain from the sky, and We produce thereby fruits of varying colors? And in the mountains are tracts, white and red of varying shades and [some] extremely black.
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ أَنزَلَ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ مَآءٗ فَأَخۡرَجۡنَا بِهِۦ ثَمَرَٰتٖ مُّخۡتَلِفًا أَلۡوَٰنُهَاۚ وَمِنَ ٱلۡجِبَالِ جُدَدُۢ بِيضٞ وَحُمۡرٞ مُّخۡتَلِفٌ أَلۡوَٰنُهَا وَغَرَابِيبُ سُودٞ

data.price: (28) And among people and moving creatures and grazing livestock are various colors similarly. Only those fear Allāh, from among His servants, who have knowledge. Indeed, Allāh is Exalted in Might and Forgiving.
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ وَٱلدَّوَآبِّ وَٱلۡأَنۡعَٰمِ مُخۡتَلِفٌ أَلۡوَٰنُهُۥ كَذَٰلِكَۗ إِنَّمَا يَخۡشَى ٱللَّهَ مِنۡ عِبَادِهِ ٱلۡعُلَمَٰٓؤُاْۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ غَفُورٌ

data.price: (29) Indeed, those who recite the Book of Allāh and establish prayer and spend [in His cause] out of what We have provided them, secretly and publicly, [can] expect a transaction [i.e., profit] that will never perish -
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يَتۡلُونَ كِتَٰبَ ٱللَّهِ وَأَقَامُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأَنفَقُواْ مِمَّا رَزَقۡنَٰهُمۡ سِرّٗا وَعَلَانِيَةٗ يَرۡجُونَ تِجَٰرَةٗ لَّن تَبُورَ

data.price: (30) That He may give them in full their rewards and increase for them of His bounty. Indeed, He is Forgiving and Appreciative.[1250]
data.arabic: لِيُوَفِّيَهُمۡ أُجُورَهُمۡ وَيَزِيدَهُم مِّن فَضۡلِهِۦٓۚ إِنَّهُۥ غَفُورٞ شَكُورٞ
data.footnotes: [1250]- i.e., He gives much in return for little and multiplies rewards.

data.price: (31) And that which We have revealed to you, [O Muḥammad], of the Book is the truth, confirming what was before it. Indeed Allāh, of His servants, is Aware and Seeing.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَوۡحَيۡنَآ إِلَيۡكَ مِنَ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ هُوَ ٱلۡحَقُّ مُصَدِّقٗا لِّمَا بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡهِۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِعِبَادِهِۦ لَخَبِيرُۢ بَصِيرٞ

data.price: (32) Then We caused to inherit the Book those We have chosen of Our servants;[1251] and among them is he who wrongs himself [i.e., sins], and among them is he who is moderate, and among them is he who is foremost in good deeds by permission of Allāh. That [inheritance] is what is the great bounty.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوۡرَثۡنَا ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱصۡطَفَيۡنَا مِنۡ عِبَادِنَاۖ فَمِنۡهُمۡ ظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ وَمِنۡهُم مُّقۡتَصِدٞ وَمِنۡهُمۡ سَابِقُۢ بِٱلۡخَيۡرَٰتِ بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَضۡلُ ٱلۡكَبِيرُ
data.footnotes: [1251]- The followers of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ).

data.price: (33) [For them are] gardens of perpetual residence which they will enter. They will be adorned therein with bracelets of gold and pearls, and their garments therein will be silk.
data.arabic: جَنَّٰتُ عَدۡنٖ يَدۡخُلُونَهَا يُحَلَّوۡنَ فِيهَا مِنۡ أَسَاوِرَ مِن ذَهَبٖ وَلُؤۡلُؤٗاۖ وَلِبَاسُهُمۡ فِيهَا حَرِيرٞ

data.price: (34) And they will say, "Praise to Allāh, who has removed from us [all] sorrow. Indeed, our Lord is Forgiving and Appreciative -
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ ٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَذۡهَبَ عَنَّا ٱلۡحَزَنَۖ إِنَّ رَبَّنَا لَغَفُورٞ شَكُورٌ

data.price: (35) He who has settled us in the home of duration [i.e., Paradise] out of His bounty. There touches us not in it any fatigue, and there touches us not in it weariness [of mind]."
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَحَلَّنَا دَارَ ٱلۡمُقَامَةِ مِن فَضۡلِهِۦ لَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا نَصَبٞ وَلَا يَمَسُّنَا فِيهَا لُغُوبٞ

data.price: (36) And for those who disbelieve will be the fire of Hell. [Death] is not decreed for them[1252] so they may die, nor will its torment be lightened for them. Thus do We recompense every ungrateful one.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لَهُمۡ نَارُ جَهَنَّمَ لَا يُقۡضَىٰ عَلَيۡهِمۡ فَيَمُوتُواْ وَلَا يُخَفَّفُ عَنۡهُم مِّنۡ عَذَابِهَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي كُلَّ كَفُورٖ
data.footnotes: [1252]- Or "They are not killed."

data.price: (37) And they will cry out therein, "Our Lord, remove us;[1253] we will do righteousness - other than what we were doing!" But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you? So taste [the punishment], for there is not for the wrongdoers any helper.
data.arabic: وَهُمۡ يَصۡطَرِخُونَ فِيهَا رَبَّنَآ أَخۡرِجۡنَا نَعۡمَلۡ صَٰلِحًا غَيۡرَ ٱلَّذِي كُنَّا نَعۡمَلُۚ أَوَلَمۡ نُعَمِّرۡكُم مَّا يَتَذَكَّرُ فِيهِ مَن تَذَكَّرَ وَجَآءَكُمُ ٱلنَّذِيرُۖ فَذُوقُواْ فَمَا لِلظَّٰلِمِينَ مِن نَّصِيرٍ
data.footnotes: [1253]- The implication is "Return us to the previous world."

data.price: (38) Indeed, Allāh is Knower of the unseen [aspects] of the heavens and earth. Indeed, He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَٰلِمُ غَيۡبِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ إِنَّهُۥ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: (39) It is He who has made you successors upon the earth. And whoever disbelieves - upon him will be [the consequence of] his disbelief. And the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them in the sight of their Lord except in hatred; and the disbelief of the disbelievers does not increase them except in loss.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَكُمۡ خَلَٰٓئِفَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ فَمَن كَفَرَ فَعَلَيۡهِ كُفۡرُهُۥۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ كُفۡرُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ إِلَّا مَقۡتٗاۖ وَلَا يَزِيدُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ كُفۡرُهُمۡ إِلَّا خَسَارٗا

data.price: (40) Say, "Have you considered[1254] your 'partners' whom you invoke besides Allāh? Show me what they have created from the earth, or have they partnership [with Him] in the heavens? Or have We given them a book so they are [standing] on evidence therefrom? [No], rather, the wrongdoers do not promise each other except delusion."[1255]
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَرَءَيۡتُمۡ شُرَكَآءَكُمُ ٱلَّذِينَ تَدۡعُونَ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ أَرُونِي مَاذَا خَلَقُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ لَهُمۡ شِرۡكٞ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ أَمۡ ءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمۡ كِتَٰبٗا فَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَيِّنَتٖ مِّنۡهُۚ بَلۡ إِن يَعِدُ ٱلظَّٰلِمُونَ بَعۡضُهُم بَعۡضًا إِلَّا غُرُورًا
data.footnotes:
[1254]- Understood to mean "Tell me about..."
[1255]- By telling their followers that the so-called deities will intercede for them with Allāh.

data.price: (41) Indeed, Allāh holds the heavens and the earth, lest they cease. And if they should cease, no one could hold them [in place] after Him. Indeed, He is Forbearing[1256] and Forgiving.
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُمۡسِكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ أَن تَزُولَاۚ وَلَئِن زَالَتَآ إِنۡ أَمۡسَكَهُمَا مِنۡ أَحَدٖ مِّنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦٓۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ حَلِيمًا غَفُورٗا
data.footnotes: [1256]- Refer to footnote in 2:225.

data.price: (42) And they swore by Allāh their strongest oaths that if a warner came to them, they would be more guided than [any] one of the [previous] nations. But when a warner came to them, it did not increase them except in aversion
data.arabic: وَأَقۡسَمُواْ بِٱللَّهِ جَهۡدَ أَيۡمَٰنِهِمۡ لَئِن جَآءَهُمۡ نَذِيرٞ لَّيَكُونُنَّ أَهۡدَىٰ مِنۡ إِحۡدَى ٱلۡأُمَمِۖ فَلَمَّا جَآءَهُمۡ نَذِيرٞ مَّا زَادَهُمۡ إِلَّا نُفُورًا

data.price: (43) [Due to] arrogance in the land and plotting of evil; but the evil plot does not encompass except its own people. Then do they await except the way [i.e., fate] of the former peoples? But you will never find in the way [i.e., established method] of Allāh any change, and you will never find in the way of Allāh[1257] any alteration.[1258]
data.arabic: ٱسۡتِكۡبَارٗا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَكۡرَ ٱلسَّيِّيِٕۚ وَلَا يَحِيقُ ٱلۡمَكۡرُ ٱلسَّيِّئُ إِلَّا بِأَهۡلِهِۦۚ فَهَلۡ يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا سُنَّتَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَۚ فَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ ٱللَّهِ تَبۡدِيلٗاۖ وَلَن تَجِدَ لِسُنَّتِ ٱللَّهِ تَحۡوِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[1257]- i.e., in His punishment of those who deny the prophets.
[1258]- Or "transfer" of punishment to others in place of them.

data.price: (44) Have they not traveled through the land and observed how was the end of those before them? And they were greater than them in power. But Allāh is not to be caused failure [i.e., prevented] by anything in the heavens or on the earth. Indeed, He is ever Knowing and Competent.
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَسِيرُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَيَنظُرُواْ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ وَكَانُوٓاْ أَشَدَّ مِنۡهُمۡ قُوَّةٗۚ وَمَا كَانَ ٱللَّهُ لِيُعۡجِزَهُۥ مِن شَيۡءٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَلَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ عَلِيمٗا قَدِيرٗا

data.price: (45) And if Allāh were to impose blame on the people for what they have earned, He would not leave upon it [i.e., the earth] any creature. But He defers them for a specified term. And when their time comes, then indeed Allāh has ever been, of His servants, Seeing.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ يُؤَاخِذُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلنَّاسَ بِمَا كَسَبُواْ مَا تَرَكَ عَلَىٰ ظَهۡرِهَا مِن دَآبَّةٖ وَلَٰكِن يُؤَخِّرُهُمۡ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٖ مُّسَمّٗىۖ فَإِذَا جَآءَ أَجَلُهُمۡ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ بِعِبَادِهِۦ بَصِيرَۢا
يسٓ
data.footnotes: [1260]- See footnote to 2:1.

data.price: (2) By the wise[1261] Qur’ān,
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ٱلۡحَكِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1261]- See footnote to 10:1.

data.price: (3) Indeed you, [O Muḥammad], are from among the messengers,
data.arabic: إِنَّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (4) On a straight path.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ صِرَٰطٖ مُّسۡتَقِيمٖ

data.price: (5) [This is] a revelation of the Exalted in Might, the Merciful,
data.arabic: تَنزِيلَ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ

data.price: (6) That you may warn a people whose forefathers were not warned, so they are unaware.
data.arabic: لِتُنذِرَ قَوۡمٗا مَّآ أُنذِرَ ءَابَآؤُهُمۡ فَهُمۡ غَٰفِلُونَ

data.price: (7) Already the word [i.e., decree] has come into effect upon most of them, so they do not believe.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ حَقَّ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ عَلَىٰٓ أَكۡثَرِهِمۡ فَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (8) Indeed, We have put shackles on their necks, and they are to their chins, so they are with heads [kept] aloft.
data.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلۡنَا فِيٓ أَعۡنَٰقِهِمۡ أَغۡلَٰلٗا فَهِيَ إِلَى ٱلۡأَذۡقَانِ فَهُم مُّقۡمَحُونَ

data.price: (9) And We have put before them a barrier and behind them a barrier and covered them, so they do not see.
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا مِنۢ بَيۡنِ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ سَدّٗا وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِمۡ سَدّٗا فَأَغۡشَيۡنَٰهُمۡ فَهُمۡ لَا يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: (10) And it is all the same for them whether you warn them or do not warn them - they will not believe.
data.arabic: وَسَوَآءٌ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ءَأَنذَرۡتَهُمۡ أَمۡ لَمۡ تُنذِرۡهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (11) You can only warn one who follows the message and fears the Most Merciful unseen. So give him good tidings of forgiveness and noble reward.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُنذِرُ مَنِ ٱتَّبَعَ ٱلذِّكۡرَ وَخَشِيَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنَ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِۖ فَبَشِّرۡهُ بِمَغۡفِرَةٖ وَأَجۡرٖ كَرِيمٍ

data.price: (12) Indeed, it is We who bring the dead to life and record what they have put forth and what they left behind, and all things We have enumerated in a clear register.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نُحۡيِ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ وَنَكۡتُبُ مَا قَدَّمُواْ وَءَاثَٰرَهُمۡۚ وَكُلَّ شَيۡءٍ أَحۡصَيۡنَٰهُ فِيٓ إِمَامٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: (13) And present to them an example: the people of the city, when the messengers came to it -
data.arabic: وَٱضۡرِبۡ لَهُم مَّثَلًا أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡقَرۡيَةِ إِذۡ جَآءَهَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: (14) When We sent to them two but they denied them, so We strengthened [them] with a third, and they said, "Indeed, we are messengers to you."
data.arabic: إِذۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡهِمُ ٱثۡنَيۡنِ فَكَذَّبُوهُمَا فَعَزَّزۡنَا بِثَالِثٖ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّآ إِلَيۡكُم مُّرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: (15) They said, "You are not but human beings like us, and the Most Merciful has not revealed a thing. You are only telling lies."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ مَآ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا بَشَرٞ مِّثۡلُنَا وَمَآ أَنزَلَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ مِن شَيۡءٍ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا تَكۡذِبُونَ

data.price: (16) They said, "Our Lord knows that we are messengers to you,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ رَبُّنَا يَعۡلَمُ إِنَّآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ لَمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: (17) And we are not responsible except for clear notification."
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَيۡنَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡبَلَٰغُ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

data.price: (18) They said, "Indeed, we consider you a bad omen. If you do not desist, we will surely stone you, and there will surely touch you, from us, a painful punishment."
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا تَطَيَّرۡنَا بِكُمۡۖ لَئِن لَّمۡ تَنتَهُواْ لَنَرۡجُمَنَّكُمۡ وَلَيَمَسَّنَّكُم مِّنَّا عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

data.price: (19) They said, "Your omen [i.e., fate] is with yourselves. Is it[1262] because you were reminded? Rather, you are a transgressing people."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ طَٰٓئِرُكُم مَّعَكُمۡ أَئِن ذُكِّرۡتُمۚ بَلۡ أَنتُمۡ قَوۡمٞ مُّسۡرِفُونَ
data.footnotes: [1262]- Your threat against us.

data.price: (20) And there came from the farthest end of the city a man, running. He said, "O my people, follow the messengers.
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ مِنۡ أَقۡصَا ٱلۡمَدِينَةِ رَجُلٞ يَسۡعَىٰ قَالَ يَٰقَوۡمِ ٱتَّبِعُواْ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (21) Follow those who do not ask of you [any] payment, and they are [rightly] guided.
data.arabic: ٱتَّبِعُواْ مَن لَّا يَسۡـَٔلُكُمۡ أَجۡرٗا وَهُم مُّهۡتَدُونَ

data.price: (22) And why should I not worship He who created me and to whom you will be returned?
data.arabic: وَمَالِيَ لَآ أَعۡبُدُ ٱلَّذِي فَطَرَنِي وَإِلَيۡهِ تُرۡجَعُونَ

data.price: (23) Should I take other than Him [false] deities [while], if the Most Merciful intends for me some adversity, their intercession will not avail me at all, nor can they save me?
data.arabic: ءَأَتَّخِذُ مِن دُونِهِۦٓ ءَالِهَةً إِن يُرِدۡنِ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ بِضُرّٖ لَّا تُغۡنِ عَنِّي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا يُنقِذُونِ

data.price: (24) Indeed, I would then be in manifest error.
data.arabic: إِنِّيٓ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٍ

data.price: (25) Indeed, I have believed in your Lord, so listen to me."
data.arabic: إِنِّيٓ ءَامَنتُ بِرَبِّكُمۡ فَٱسۡمَعُونِ

data.price: (26) It was said, "Enter Paradise."[1263] He said, "I wish my people could know
data.arabic: قِيلَ ٱدۡخُلِ ٱلۡجَنَّةَۖ قَالَ يَٰلَيۡتَ قَوۡمِي يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1263]- An abrupt transfer to the Hereafter conveys the meaning that the man met a violent death at the hands of the disbelievers and so was martyred for the cause of Allāh.

data.price: (27) Of how my Lord has forgiven me and placed me among the honored."
data.arabic: بِمَا غَفَرَ لِي رَبِّي وَجَعَلَنِي مِنَ ٱلۡمُكۡرَمِينَ

data.price: (28) And We did not send down upon his people after him any soldiers from the heaven, nor would We have done so.
data.arabic: ۞ وَمَآ أَنزَلۡنَا عَلَىٰ قَوۡمِهِۦ مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِۦ مِن جُندٖ مِّنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا كُنَّا مُنزِلِينَ

data.price: (29) It was not but one shout,[1264] and immediately they were extinguished.
data.arabic: إِن كَانَتۡ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَإِذَا هُمۡ خَٰمِدُونَ
data.footnotes: [1264]- From Gabriel or a blast from the sky.

data.price: (30) How regretful for the servants. There did not come to them any messenger except that they used to ridicule him.
data.arabic: يَٰحَسۡرَةً عَلَى ٱلۡعِبَادِۚ مَا يَأۡتِيهِم مِّن رَّسُولٍ إِلَّا كَانُواْ بِهِۦ يَسۡتَهۡزِءُونَ

data.price: (31) Have they not considered how many generations We destroyed before them - that they to them[1265] will not return?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ كَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا قَبۡلَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡقُرُونِ أَنَّهُمۡ إِلَيۡهِمۡ لَا يَرۡجِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [1265]- i.e., to those living presently in the world.

data.price: (32) And indeed, all of them will yet be brought present before Us.
data.arabic: وَإِن كُلّٞ لَّمَّا جَمِيعٞ لَّدَيۡنَا مُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: (33) And a sign for them is the dead earth. We have brought it to life and brought forth from it grain, and from it they eat.
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ ٱلۡمَيۡتَةُ أَحۡيَيۡنَٰهَا وَأَخۡرَجۡنَا مِنۡهَا حَبّٗا فَمِنۡهُ يَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: (34) And We placed therein gardens of palm trees and grapevines and caused to burst forth therefrom some springs -
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا جَنَّٰتٖ مِّن نَّخِيلٖ وَأَعۡنَٰبٖ وَفَجَّرۡنَا فِيهَا مِنَ ٱلۡعُيُونِ

data.price: (35) That they may eat of His fruit.[1266] And their hands have not produced it,[1267] so will they not be grateful?
data.arabic: لِيَأۡكُلُواْ مِن ثَمَرِهِۦ وَمَا عَمِلَتۡهُ أَيۡدِيهِمۡۚ أَفَلَا يَشۡكُرُونَ
data.footnotes:
[1266]- i.e., that which Allāh has produced for them.
[1267]- An alternative meaning is "And [eat from] what their hands have produced [i.e., planted and harvested]."  Both are grammatically correct.

data.price: (36) Exalted is He who created all pairs[1268] - from what the earth grows and from themselves and from that which they do not know.
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلۡأَزۡوَٰجَ كُلَّهَا مِمَّا تُنۢبِتُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَمِنۡ أَنفُسِهِمۡ وَمِمَّا لَا يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1268]- Or "all species."

data.price: (37) And a sign for them is the night. We remove[1269] from it the [light of] day, so they are [left] in darkness.
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمُ ٱلَّيۡلُ نَسۡلَخُ مِنۡهُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فَإِذَا هُم مُّظۡلِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1269]- Literally, "strip" or "peel."  Sunlight projected onto the earth is removed from it as the earth turns and night approaches.

data.price: (38) And the sun runs [on course] toward its stopping point. That is the determination of the Exalted in Might, the Knowing.
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّمۡسُ تَجۡرِي لِمُسۡتَقَرّٖ لَّهَاۚ ذَٰلِكَ تَقۡدِيرُ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡعَلِيمِ

data.price: (39) And the moon - We have determined for it phases, until it returns [appearing] like the old date stalk.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرَ قَدَّرۡنَٰهُ مَنَازِلَ حَتَّىٰ عَادَ كَٱلۡعُرۡجُونِ ٱلۡقَدِيمِ

data.price: (40) It is not allowable [i.e., possible] for the sun to reach the moon, nor does the night overtake the day, but each, in an orbit, is swimming.
data.arabic: لَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ يَنۢبَغِي لَهَآ أَن تُدۡرِكَ ٱلۡقَمَرَ وَلَا ٱلَّيۡلُ سَابِقُ ٱلنَّهَارِۚ وَكُلّٞ فِي فَلَكٖ يَسۡبَحُونَ

data.price: (41) And a sign for them is that We carried their forefathers[1270] in a laden ship.
data.arabic: وَءَايَةٞ لَّهُمۡ أَنَّا حَمَلۡنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ
data.footnotes: [1270]- Usually meaning "descendants" or "offspring," the word "dhurriyyah" is used here to denote forefathers (their being the offspring of Noah), who were saved from the flood.

data.price: (42) And We created for them from the likes of it that which they ride.
data.arabic: وَخَلَقۡنَا لَهُم مِّن مِّثۡلِهِۦ مَا يَرۡكَبُونَ

data.price: (43) And if We should will, We could drown them; then no one responding to a cry would there be for them, nor would they be saved
data.arabic: وَإِن نَّشَأۡ نُغۡرِقۡهُمۡ فَلَا صَرِيخَ لَهُمۡ وَلَا هُمۡ يُنقَذُونَ

data.price: (44) Except as a mercy from Us and provision for a time.
data.arabic: إِلَّا رَحۡمَةٗ مِّنَّا وَمَتَٰعًا إِلَىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: (45) But when it is said to them, "Beware of what is before you and what is behind you;[1271] perhaps you will receive mercy..."[1272]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّقُواْ مَا بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيكُمۡ وَمَا خَلۡفَكُمۡ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تُرۡحَمُونَ
data.footnotes:
[1271]- Of sins or of life in this world and the Hereafter.
[1272]- The conclusion of this sentence is understood to be "...they ignored the warning."

data.price: (46) And no sign comes to them from the signs of their Lord except that they are from it turning away.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَأۡتِيهِم مِّنۡ ءَايَةٖ مِّنۡ ءَايَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ إِلَّا كَانُواْ عَنۡهَا مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: (47) And when it is said to them, "Spend from that which Allāh has provided for you," those who disbelieve say to those who believe, "Should we feed one whom, if Allāh had willed, He would have fed? You are not but in clear error."
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ أَنفِقُواْ مِمَّا رَزَقَكُمُ ٱللَّهُ قَالَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَنُطۡعِمُ مَن لَّوۡ يَشَآءُ ٱللَّهُ أَطۡعَمَهُۥٓ إِنۡ أَنتُمۡ إِلَّا فِي ضَلَٰلٖ مُّبِينٖ

data.price: (48) And they say, "When is this promise, if you should be truthful?"
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ مَتَىٰ هَٰذَا ٱلۡوَعۡدُ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (49) They do not await except one blast[1273] which will seize them while they are disputing.
data.arabic: مَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ تَأۡخُذُهُمۡ وَهُمۡ يَخِصِّمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1273]- Literally, "cry" or "shriek," meaning the first blast of the Horn which will strike dead every living thing on the earth without warning.

data.price: (50) And they will not be able [to give] any instruction, nor to their people can they return.
data.arabic: فَلَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ تَوۡصِيَةٗ وَلَآ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمۡ يَرۡجِعُونَ

data.price: (51) And the Horn will be blown;[1274] and at once from the graves to their Lord they will hasten.
data.arabic: وَنُفِخَ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَإِذَا هُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِمۡ يَنسِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [1274]- For the second time, signaling the Resurrection.

data.price: (52) They will say, "O woe to us! Who has raised us up from our sleeping place?" [The reply will be], "This is what the Most Merciful had promised, and the messengers told the truth."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَا مَنۢ بَعَثَنَا مِن مَّرۡقَدِنَاۜۗ هَٰذَا مَا وَعَدَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَصَدَقَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلُونَ

data.price: (53) It will not be but one blast, and at once they are all brought present before Us.
data.arabic: إِن كَانَتۡ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَإِذَا هُمۡ جَمِيعٞ لَّدَيۡنَا مُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: (54) So today [i.e., the Day of Judgement] no soul will be wronged at all, and you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do.
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا تُظۡلَمُ نَفۡسٞ شَيۡـٔٗا وَلَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (55) Indeed the companions of Paradise, that Day, will be amused in [joyful] occupation -
data.arabic: إِنَّ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ فِي شُغُلٖ فَٰكِهُونَ

data.price: (56) They and their spouses - in shade, reclining on adorned couches.
data.arabic: هُمۡ وَأَزۡوَٰجُهُمۡ فِي ظِلَٰلٍ عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ مُتَّكِـُٔونَ

data.price: (57) For them therein is fruit, and for them is whatever they request [or wish]
data.arabic: لَهُمۡ فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَلَهُم مَّا يَدَّعُونَ

data.price: (58) [And] "Peace," a word from a Merciful Lord.
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٞ قَوۡلٗا مِّن رَّبّٖ رَّحِيمٖ

data.price: (59) [Then He will say], "But stand apart today, you criminals.[1275]
data.arabic: وَٱمۡتَٰزُواْ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ أَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1275]- i.e., remove yourself from the ranks of the believers to be distinguished from them.

data.price: (60) Did I not enjoin upon you, O children of Adam, that you not worship Satan - [for] indeed, he is to you a clear enemy -
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ أَعۡهَدۡ إِلَيۡكُمۡ يَٰبَنِيٓ ءَادَمَ أَن لَّا تَعۡبُدُواْ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنَۖ إِنَّهُۥ لَكُمۡ عَدُوّٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: (61) And that you worship [only] Me? This is a straight path.
data.arabic: وَأَنِ ٱعۡبُدُونِيۚ هَٰذَا صِرَٰطٞ مُّسۡتَقِيمٞ

data.price: (62) And he had already led astray from among you much of creation, so did you not use reason?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَضَلَّ مِنكُمۡ جِبِلّٗا كَثِيرًاۖ أَفَلَمۡ تَكُونُواْ تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: (63) This is the Hellfire which you were promised.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي كُنتُمۡ تُوعَدُونَ

data.price: (64) [Enter to] burn therein today for what you used to deny."[1276]
data.arabic: ٱصۡلَوۡهَا ٱلۡيَوۡمَ بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَكۡفُرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1276]- Or "because you used to disbelieve."

data.price: (65) That Day, We will seal over their mouths, and their hands will speak to Us, and their feet will testify about what they used to earn.
data.arabic: ٱلۡيَوۡمَ نَخۡتِمُ عَلَىٰٓ أَفۡوَٰهِهِمۡ وَتُكَلِّمُنَآ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَتَشۡهَدُ أَرۡجُلُهُم بِمَا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ

data.price: (66) And if We willed, We could have obliterated their eyes, and they would race to [find] the path, and how could they see?[1277]
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَطَمَسۡنَا عَلَىٰٓ أَعۡيُنِهِمۡ فَٱسۡتَبَقُواْ ٱلصِّرَٰطَ فَأَنَّىٰ يُبۡصِرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1277]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) could have left man without means of guidance in the life of this world, although in His mercy He did not.

data.price: (67) And if We willed, We could have deformed them, [paralyzing them] in their places so they would not be able to proceed, nor could they return.[1278]
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَمَسَخۡنَٰهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَكَانَتِهِمۡ فَمَا ٱسۡتَطَٰعُواْ مُضِيّٗا وَلَا يَرۡجِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [1278]- He (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) could have prevented man from taking any action to benefit himself in this world or the Hereafter, yet He did not.

data.price: (68) And he to whom We grant long life We reverse in creation;[1279] so will they not understand?
data.arabic: وَمَن نُّعَمِّرۡهُ نُنَكِّسۡهُ فِي ٱلۡخَلۡقِۚ أَفَلَا يَعۡقِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [1279]- In his physical and mental capacity.

data.price: (69) And We did not give him [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] knowledge of poetry, nor is it befitting for him. It is not but a message and a clear Qur’ān
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَّمۡنَٰهُ ٱلشِّعۡرَ وَمَا يَنۢبَغِي لَهُۥٓۚ إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ وَقُرۡءَانٞ مُّبِينٞ

data.price: (70) To warn whoever is alive[1280] and justify the word [i.e., decree] against the disbelievers.
data.arabic: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيّٗا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلۡقَوۡلُ عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [1280]- In heart and mind, i.e., the believers.

data.price: (71) Do they not see that We have created for them from what Our hands[1281] have made, grazing livestock, and [then] they are their owners?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَوۡاْ أَنَّا خَلَقۡنَا لَهُم مِّمَّا عَمِلَتۡ أَيۡدِينَآ أَنۡعَٰمٗا فَهُمۡ لَهَا مَٰلِكُونَ
data.footnotes: [1281]- See footnote to 2:19.

data.price: (72) And We have tamed them for them, so some of them they ride, and some of them they eat.
data.arabic: وَذَلَّلۡنَٰهَا لَهُمۡ فَمِنۡهَا رَكُوبُهُمۡ وَمِنۡهَا يَأۡكُلُونَ

data.price: (73) And for them therein are [other] benefits and drinks, so will they not be grateful?
data.arabic: وَلَهُمۡ فِيهَا مَنَٰفِعُ وَمَشَارِبُۚ أَفَلَا يَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: (74) But they have taken besides Allāh [false] deities that perhaps they would be helped.
data.arabic: وَٱتَّخَذُواْ مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ ءَالِهَةٗ لَّعَلَّهُمۡ يُنصَرُونَ

data.price: (75) They are not able to help them, and they [themselves] are for them soldiers in attendance.[1282]
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡتَطِيعُونَ نَصۡرَهُمۡ وَهُمۡ لَهُمۡ جُندٞ مُّحۡضَرُونَ
data.footnotes: [1282]- Maintaining and protecting their "gods."  Another interpretation is that they (i.e., the gods) will be soldiers set against them in Hellfire.

data.price: (76) So let not their speech grieve you. Indeed, We know what they conceal and what they declare.
data.arabic: فَلَا يَحۡزُنكَ قَوۡلُهُمۡۘ إِنَّا نَعۡلَمُ مَا يُسِرُّونَ وَمَا يُعۡلِنُونَ

data.price: (77) Does man not consider that We created him from a [mere] sperm-drop - then at once[1283] he is a clear adversary?
data.arabic: أَوَلَمۡ يَرَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُ مِن نُّطۡفَةٖ فَإِذَا هُوَ خَصِيمٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [1283]- i.e., as soon as he becomes self-sufficient.

data.price: (78) And he presents for Us an example[1284] and forgets his [own] creation. He says, "Who will give life to bones while they are disintegrated?"
data.arabic: وَضَرَبَ لَنَا مَثَلٗا وَنَسِيَ خَلۡقَهُۥۖ قَالَ مَن يُحۡيِ ٱلۡعِظَٰمَ وَهِيَ رَمِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [1284]- Attempting to establish the finality of death.

data.price: (79) Say, "He will give them life who produced them the first time; and He is, of all creation, Knowing."
data.arabic: قُلۡ يُحۡيِيهَا ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنشَأَهَآ أَوَّلَ مَرَّةٖۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ خَلۡقٍ عَلِيمٌ

data.price: (80) [It is] He who made for you from the green tree, fire, and then from it you ignite.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَعَلَ لَكُم مِّنَ ٱلشَّجَرِ ٱلۡأَخۡضَرِ نَارٗا فَإِذَآ أَنتُم مِّنۡهُ تُوقِدُونَ

data.price: (81) Is not He who created the heavens and the earth Able to create the likes of them? Yes, [it is so]; and He is the Knowing Creator.
data.arabic: أَوَلَيۡسَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يَخۡلُقَ مِثۡلَهُمۚ بَلَىٰ وَهُوَ ٱلۡخَلَّٰقُ ٱلۡعَلِيمُ

data.price: (82) His command is only when He intends a thing that He says to it, "Be," and it is.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَمۡرُهُۥٓ إِذَآ أَرَادَ شَيۡـًٔا أَن يَقُولَ لَهُۥ كُن فَيَكُونُ

data.price: (83) So exalted is He in whose hand is the realm of all things, and to Him you will be returned.
data.arabic: فَسُبۡحَٰنَ ٱلَّذِي بِيَدِهِۦ مَلَكُوتُ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ وَإِلَيۡهِ تُرۡجَعُونَ

data.price: (1) By those [angels] lined up in rows
data.arabic: وَٱلصَّٰٓفَّٰتِ صَفّٗا

data.price: (2) And those who drive [the clouds]
data.arabic: فَٱلزَّٰجِرَٰتِ زَجۡرٗا

data.price: (3) And those who recite the message,[1286]
data.arabic: فَٱلتَّٰلِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا
data.footnotes: [1286]- To the prophets or among themselves.  Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) swears by these three kinds of angels to the fact mentioned in the following verse.

data.price: (4) Indeed, your God is One,
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَٰهَكُمۡ لَوَٰحِدٞ

data.price: (5) Lord of the heavens and the earth and that between them and Lord of the sunrises.[1287]
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَشَٰرِقِ
data.footnotes: [1287]- i.e., each point or place of sunrise.

data.price: (6) Indeed, We have adorned the nearest heaven with an adornment of stars
data.arabic: إِنَّا زَيَّنَّا ٱلسَّمَآءَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا بِزِينَةٍ ٱلۡكَوَاكِبِ

data.price: (7) And as protection against every rebellious devil
data.arabic: وَحِفۡظٗا مِّن كُلِّ شَيۡطَٰنٖ مَّارِدٖ

data.price: (8) [So] they may not listen to the exalted assembly [of angels] and are pelted from every side,[1288]
data.arabic: لَّا يَسَّمَّعُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡمَلَإِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ وَيُقۡذَفُونَ مِن كُلِّ جَانِبٖ
data.footnotes: [1288]- By flaming meteors.

data.price: (9) Repelled; and for them is a constant punishment,
data.arabic: دُحُورٗاۖ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ وَاصِبٌ

data.price: (10) Except one who snatches [some words] by theft, but they are pursued by a burning flame, piercing [in brightness].
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ خَطِفَ ٱلۡخَطۡفَةَ فَأَتۡبَعَهُۥ شِهَابٞ ثَاقِبٞ

data.price: (11) Then inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Are they a stronger [or more difficult] creation or those [others] We have created?" Indeed, We created them [i.e., men] from sticky clay.
data.arabic: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَهُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَم مَّنۡ خَلَقۡنَآۚ إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَٰهُم مِّن طِينٖ لَّازِبِۭ

data.price: (12) But you wonder, while they mock,
data.arabic: بَلۡ عَجِبۡتَ وَيَسۡخَرُونَ

data.price: (13) And when they are reminded, they remember not.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ذُكِّرُواْ لَا يَذۡكُرُونَ

data.price: (14) And when they see a sign, they ridicule.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يَسۡتَسۡخِرُونَ

data.price: (15) And say, "This is not but obvious magic.
data.arabic: وَقَالُوٓاْ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ مُّبِينٌ

data.price: (16) When we have died and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
data.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: (17) And our forefathers [as well]?"
data.arabic: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ

data.price: (18) Say, "Yes, and you will be [rendered] contemptible."
data.arabic: قُلۡ نَعَمۡ وَأَنتُمۡ دَٰخِرُونَ

data.price: (19) It will be only one shout, and at once they will be observing.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ فَإِذَا هُمۡ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: (20) They will say, "O woe to us! This is the Day of Recompense."
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ يَٰوَيۡلَنَا هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (21) [They will be told], "This is the Day of Judgement which you used to deny."
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (22) [The angels will be ordered], "Gather those who committed wrong, their kinds,[1289] and what they used to worship
data.arabic: ۞ ٱحۡشُرُواْ ٱلَّذِينَ ظَلَمُواْ وَأَزۡوَٰجَهُمۡ وَمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡبُدُونَ
data.footnotes: [1289]- Those similar to them in evil deeds.  Another possible meaning is "their wives."

data.price: (23) Other than Allāh, and guide them to the path of Hellfire
data.arabic: مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ فَٱهۡدُوهُمۡ إِلَىٰ صِرَٰطِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: (24) And stop them; indeed, they are to be questioned."
data.arabic: وَقِفُوهُمۡۖ إِنَّهُم مَّسۡـُٔولُونَ

data.price: (25) [They will be asked], "What is [wrong] with you? Why do you not help each other?"
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ لَا تَنَاصَرُونَ

data.price: (26) But they, that Day, are in surrender.
data.arabic: بَلۡ هُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ مُسۡتَسۡلِمُونَ

data.price: (27) And they will approach one another asking [i.e., blaming] each other.
data.arabic: وَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: (28) They will say, "Indeed, you used to come at us from the right."[1290]
data.arabic: قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّكُمۡ كُنتُمۡ تَأۡتُونَنَا عَنِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [1290]- i.e., from our position of strength, oppressing us.  Or from where we would have grasped the truth, preventing us.

data.price: (29) They [i.e., the oppressors] will say, "Rather, you [yourselves] were not believers,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ بَل لَّمۡ تَكُونُواْ مُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (30) And we had over you no authority, but you were a transgressing people.
data.arabic: وَمَا كَانَ لَنَا عَلَيۡكُم مِّن سُلۡطَٰنِۭۖ بَلۡ كُنتُمۡ قَوۡمٗا طَٰغِينَ

data.price: (31) So the word [i.e., decree] of our Lord has come into effect upon us; indeed, we will taste [punishment].
data.arabic: فَحَقَّ عَلَيۡنَا قَوۡلُ رَبِّنَآۖ إِنَّا لَذَآئِقُونَ

data.price: (32) And we led you to deviation; indeed, we were deviators."
data.arabic: فَأَغۡوَيۡنَٰكُمۡ إِنَّا كُنَّا غَٰوِينَ

data.price: (33) So indeed they, that Day, will be sharing in the punishment.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ فِي ٱلۡعَذَابِ مُشۡتَرِكُونَ

data.price: (34) Indeed, that is how We deal with the criminals.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: (35) Indeed they, when it was said to them, "There is no deity but Allāh," were arrogant
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمۡ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا ٱللَّهُ يَسۡتَكۡبِرُونَ

data.price: (36) And were saying, "Are we to leave our gods for a mad poet?"
data.arabic: وَيَقُولُونَ أَئِنَّا لَتَارِكُوٓاْ ءَالِهَتِنَا لِشَاعِرٖ مَّجۡنُونِۭ

data.price: (37) Rather, he [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ)] has come with the truth and confirmed the [previous] messengers.
data.arabic: بَلۡ جَآءَ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَصَدَّقَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (38) Indeed, you [disbelievers] will be tasters of the painful punishment,
data.arabic: إِنَّكُمۡ لَذَآئِقُواْ ٱلۡعَذَابِ ٱلۡأَلِيمِ

data.price: (39) And you will not be recompensed except for what you used to do -
data.arabic: وَمَا تُجۡزَوۡنَ إِلَّا مَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (40) But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: (41) Those will have a provision determined -
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ لَهُمۡ رِزۡقٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ

data.price: (42) Fruits;[1291] and they will be honored
data.arabic: فَوَٰكِهُ وَهُم مُّكۡرَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1291]- Meaning everything delicious.

data.price: (43) In gardens of pleasure
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: (44) On thrones facing one another.
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مُّتَقَٰبِلِينَ

data.price: (45) There will be circulated among them a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring,
data.arabic: يُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينِۭ

data.price: (46) White and delicious to the drinkers;
data.arabic: بَيۡضَآءَ لَذَّةٖ لِّلشَّٰرِبِينَ

data.price: (47) No bad effect is there in it, nor from it will they be intoxicated.
data.arabic: لَا فِيهَا غَوۡلٞ وَلَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا يُنزَفُونَ

data.price: (48) And with them will be women limiting [their] glances,[1292] with large, [beautiful] eyes,
data.arabic: وَعِندَهُمۡ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ عِينٞ
data.footnotes: [1292]- i.e., chaste and modest, looking only at their mates.

data.price: (49) As if they were [delicate] eggs, well-protected.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ بَيۡضٞ مَّكۡنُونٞ

data.price: (50) And they will approach one another, inquiring of each other.
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلَ بَعۡضُهُمۡ عَلَىٰ بَعۡضٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: (51) A speaker among them will say, "Indeed, I had a companion [on earth].
data.arabic: قَالَ قَآئِلٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ إِنِّي كَانَ لِي قَرِينٞ

data.price: (52) Who would say, 'Are you indeed of those who believe
data.arabic: يَقُولُ أَءِنَّكَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُصَدِّقِينَ

data.price: (53) That when we have died and become dust and bones, we will indeed be recompensed?'"
data.arabic: أَءِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَدِينُونَ

data.price: (54) He will say,[1293] "Would you [care to] look?"
data.arabic: قَالَ هَلۡ أَنتُم مُّطَّلِعُونَ
data.footnotes: [1293]- To his companions in Paradise.

data.price: (55) And he will look and see him[1294] in the midst of the Hellfire.
data.arabic: فَٱطَّلَعَ فَرَءَاهُ فِي سَوَآءِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1294]- The companion who had tried to dissuade him from belief on earth.

data.price: (56) He will say, "By Allāh, you almost ruined me.
data.arabic: قَالَ تَٱللَّهِ إِن كِدتَّ لَتُرۡدِينِ

data.price: (57) If not for the favor of my Lord, I would have been of those brought in [to Hell].
data.arabic: وَلَوۡلَا نِعۡمَةُ رَبِّي لَكُنتُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُحۡضَرِينَ

data.price: (58) Then, are we not to die
data.arabic: أَفَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَيِّتِينَ

data.price: (59) Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَوۡتَتَنَا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ

data.price: (60) Indeed, this is the great attainment.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ

data.price: (61) For the like of this let the workers [on earth] work.
data.arabic: لِمِثۡلِ هَٰذَا فَلۡيَعۡمَلِ ٱلۡعَٰمِلُونَ

data.price: (62) Is that [i.e., Paradise] a better accommodation or the tree of zaqqūm?
data.arabic: أَذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ نُّزُلًا أَمۡ شَجَرَةُ ٱلزَّقُّومِ

data.price: (63) Indeed, We have made it a torment for the wrongdoers.
data.arabic: إِنَّا جَعَلۡنَٰهَا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: (64) Indeed, it is a tree issuing from the bottom of the Hellfire,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا شَجَرَةٞ تَخۡرُجُ فِيٓ أَصۡلِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: (65) Its emerging fruit as if it was heads of the devils.
data.arabic: طَلۡعُهَا كَأَنَّهُۥ رُءُوسُ ٱلشَّيَٰطِينِ

data.price: (66) And indeed, they will eat from it and fill with it their bellies.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَأٓكِلُونَ مِنۡهَا فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ

data.price: (67) Then indeed, they will have after it a mixture of scalding water.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ لَهُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا لَشَوۡبٗا مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ

data.price: (68) Then indeed, their return will be to the Hellfire.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ مَرۡجِعَهُمۡ لَإِلَى ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: (69) Indeed they found their fathers astray.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ أَلۡفَوۡاْ ءَابَآءَهُمۡ ضَآلِّينَ

data.price: (70) So they hastened [to follow] in their footsteps.
data.arabic: فَهُمۡ عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِمۡ يُهۡرَعُونَ

data.price: (71) And there had already strayed before them most of the former peoples,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ ضَلَّ قَبۡلَهُمۡ أَكۡثَرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (72) And We had already sent among them warners.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا فِيهِم مُّنذِرِينَ

data.price: (73) Then look how was the end of those who were warned -
data.arabic: فَٱنظُرۡ كَيۡفَ كَانَ عَٰقِبَةُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: (74) But not the chosen servants of Allāh.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: (75) And Noah had certainly called Us, and [We are] the best of responders.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ نَادَىٰنَا نُوحٞ فَلَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡمُجِيبُونَ

data.price: (76) And We saved him and his family from the great affliction.
data.arabic: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥ مِنَ ٱلۡكَرۡبِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (77) And We made his descendants those remaining [on the earth]
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ذُرِّيَّتَهُۥ هُمُ ٱلۡبَاقِينَ

data.price: (78) And left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (79) "Peace upon Noah among the worlds."
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ نُوحٖ فِي ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (80) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (81) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (82) Then We drowned the others [i.e., disbelievers].
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَغۡرَقۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: (83) And indeed, among his kind was Abraham,
data.arabic: ۞ وَإِنَّ مِن شِيعَتِهِۦ لَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

data.price: (84) When he came to his Lord with a sound heart
data.arabic: إِذۡ جَآءَ رَبَّهُۥ بِقَلۡبٖ سَلِيمٍ

data.price: (85) [And] when he said to his father and his people, "What do you worship?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِأَبِيهِ وَقَوۡمِهِۦ مَاذَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (86) Is it falsehood [as] gods other than Allāh you desire?
data.arabic: أَئِفۡكًا ءَالِهَةٗ دُونَ ٱللَّهِ تُرِيدُونَ

data.price: (87) Then what is your thought about the Lord of the worlds?"
data.arabic: فَمَا ظَنُّكُم بِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (88) And he cast a look at the stars
data.arabic: فَنَظَرَ نَظۡرَةٗ فِي ٱلنُّجُومِ

data.price: (89) And said, "Indeed, I am [about to be] ill."
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنِّي سَقِيمٞ

data.price: (90) So they turned away from him, departing.
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّوۡاْ عَنۡهُ مُدۡبِرِينَ

data.price: (91) Then he turned to their gods and said, "Do you not eat?[1295]
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ إِلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِهِمۡ فَقَالَ أَلَا تَأۡكُلُونَ
data.footnotes: [1295]- Consume the offerings placed before them.

data.price: (92) What is [wrong] with you that you do not speak?"
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ لَا تَنطِقُونَ

data.price: (93) And he turned upon them a blow with [his] right hand.
data.arabic: فَرَاغَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ ضَرۡبَۢا بِٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: (94) Then they [i.e., the people] came toward him, hastening.
data.arabic: فَأَقۡبَلُوٓاْ إِلَيۡهِ يَزِفُّونَ

data.price: (95) He said, "Do you worship that which you [yourselves] carve,
data.arabic: قَالَ أَتَعۡبُدُونَ مَا تَنۡحِتُونَ

data.price: (96) While Allāh created you and that which you do?"
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ خَلَقَكُمۡ وَمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (97) They said, "Construct for him a structure [i.e., furnace] and throw him into the burning fire."
data.arabic: قَالُواْ ٱبۡنُواْ لَهُۥ بُنۡيَٰنٗا فَأَلۡقُوهُ فِي ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: (98) And they intended for him a plan [i.e., harm], but We made them the most debased.
data.arabic: فَأَرَادُواْ بِهِۦ كَيۡدٗا فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُمُ ٱلۡأَسۡفَلِينَ

data.price: (99) And [then] he said, "Indeed, I will go to [where I am ordered by] my Lord; He will guide me.
data.arabic: وَقَالَ إِنِّي ذَاهِبٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّي سَيَهۡدِينِ

data.price: (100) My Lord, grant me [a child] from among the righteous."
data.arabic: رَبِّ هَبۡ لِي مِنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ

data.price: (101) So We gave him good tidings of a forbearing boy.
data.arabic: فَبَشَّرۡنَٰهُ بِغُلَٰمٍ حَلِيمٖ

data.price: (102) And when he reached with him [the age of] exertion,[1296] he said, "O my son, indeed I have seen in a dream that I [must] sacrifice you, so see what you think." He said, "O my father, do as you are commanded. You will find me, if Allāh wills, of the steadfast."
data.arabic: فَلَمَّا بَلَغَ مَعَهُ ٱلسَّعۡيَ قَالَ يَٰبُنَيَّ إِنِّيٓ أَرَىٰ فِي ٱلۡمَنَامِ أَنِّيٓ أَذۡبَحُكَ فَٱنظُرۡ مَاذَا تَرَىٰۚ قَالَ يَٰٓأَبَتِ ٱفۡعَلۡ مَا تُؤۡمَرُۖ سَتَجِدُنِيٓ إِن شَآءَ ٱللَّهُ مِنَ ٱلصَّٰبِرِينَ
data.footnotes: [1296]- i.e., the ability to work and be of assistance.

data.price: (103) And when they had both submitted[1297] and he put him down upon his forehead,
data.arabic: فَلَمَّآ أَسۡلَمَا وَتَلَّهُۥ لِلۡجَبِينِ
data.footnotes: [1297]- To the command of Allāh.

data.price: (104) We called to him, "O Abraham,
data.arabic: وَنَٰدَيۡنَٰهُ أَن يَٰٓإِبۡرَٰهِيمُ

data.price: (105) You have fulfilled the vision." Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: قَدۡ صَدَّقۡتَ ٱلرُّءۡيَآۚ إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (106) Indeed, this was the clear trial.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ ٱلۡبَلَٰٓؤُاْ ٱلۡمُبِينُ

data.price: (107) And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,[1298]
data.arabic: وَفَدَيۡنَٰهُ بِذِبۡحٍ عَظِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [1298]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) sent a huge ram to be sacrificed in place of Ishmael.

data.price: (108) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (109) "Peace upon Abraham."
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ

data.price: (110) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (111) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (112) And We gave him good tidings of Isaac, a prophet from among the righteous.[1299]
data.arabic: وَبَشَّرۡنَٰهُ بِإِسۡحَٰقَ نَبِيّٗا مِّنَ ٱلصَّٰلِحِينَ
data.footnotes: [1299]- This verifies that the firstborn son who was to be sacrificed was Ishmael and not Isaac, as claimed by the Jews and Christians.

data.price: (113) And We blessed him and Isaac. But among their descendants is the doer of good and the clearly unjust to himself [i.e., sinner].
data.arabic: وَبَٰرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ وَعَلَىٰٓ إِسۡحَٰقَۚ وَمِن ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا مُحۡسِنٞ وَظَالِمٞ لِّنَفۡسِهِۦ مُبِينٞ

data.price: (114) And We did certainly confer favor upon Moses and Aaron.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ مَنَنَّا عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

data.price: (115) And We saved them and their people from the great affliction,
data.arabic: وَنَجَّيۡنَٰهُمَا وَقَوۡمَهُمَا مِنَ ٱلۡكَرۡبِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (116) And We supported them so it was they who overcame.
data.arabic: وَنَصَرۡنَٰهُمۡ فَكَانُواْ هُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبِينَ

data.price: (117) And We gave them the explicit Scripture [i.e., the Torah],
data.arabic: وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُمَا ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَبِينَ

data.price: (118) And We guided them on the straight path.
data.arabic: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُمَا ٱلصِّرَٰطَ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقِيمَ

data.price: (119) And We left for them [favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمَا فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (120) "Peace upon Moses and Aaron."
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰ مُوسَىٰ وَهَٰرُونَ

data.price: (121) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (122) Indeed, they were of Our believing servants.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمَا مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (123) And indeed, Elias was from among the messengers,
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ إِلۡيَاسَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (124) When he said to his people, "Will you not fear Allāh?
data.arabic: إِذۡ قَالَ لِقَوۡمِهِۦٓ أَلَا تَتَّقُونَ

data.price: (125) Do you call upon Baʿl[1300] and leave the best of creators -
data.arabic: أَتَدۡعُونَ بَعۡلٗا وَتَذَرُونَ أَحۡسَنَ ٱلۡخَٰلِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [1300]- The name of a great idol worshipped by the people and said to mean "lord."

data.price: (126) Allāh, your Lord and the Lord of your first forefathers?"
data.arabic: ٱللَّهَ رَبَّكُمۡ وَرَبَّ ءَابَآئِكُمُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (127) And they denied him, so indeed, they will be brought [for punishment],
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَإِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: (128) Except the chosen servants of Allāh.
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: (129) And We left for him [favorable mention] among later generations:
data.arabic: وَتَرَكۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (130) "Peace upon Elias."[1301]
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ عَلَىٰٓ إِلۡ يَاسِينَ
data.footnotes: [1301]- Ilyāseen is said by some commentators to be a plural form, meaning "Elias and those who followed him."

data.price: (131) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (132) Indeed, he was of Our believing servants.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ مِنۡ عِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (133) And indeed, Lot was among the messengers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لُوطٗا لَّمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (134) [So mention] when We saved him and his family, all,
data.arabic: إِذۡ نَجَّيۡنَٰهُ وَأَهۡلَهُۥٓ أَجۡمَعِينَ

data.price: (135) Except an old woman [i.e., his wife] among those who remained [with the evildoers].
data.arabic: إِلَّا عَجُوزٗا فِي ٱلۡغَٰبِرِينَ

data.price: (136) Then We destroyed the others.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ دَمَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأٓخَرِينَ

data.price: (137) And indeed, you pass by them in the morning
data.arabic: وَإِنَّكُمۡ لَتَمُرُّونَ عَلَيۡهِم مُّصۡبِحِينَ

data.price: (138) And at night. Then will you not use reason?
data.arabic: وَبِٱلَّيۡلِۚ أَفَلَا تَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: (139) And indeed, Jonah was among the messengers.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ يُونُسَ لَمِنَ ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (140) [Mention] when he ran away to the laden ship.
data.arabic: إِذۡ أَبَقَ إِلَى ٱلۡفُلۡكِ ٱلۡمَشۡحُونِ

data.price: (141) And he drew lots[1302] and was among the losers.
data.arabic: فَسَاهَمَ فَكَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُدۡحَضِينَ
data.footnotes: [1302]- To determine who would be cast overboard in order to save the other passengers.  Having been overloaded, the ship was on the verge of sinking.

data.price: (142) Then the fish swallowed him, while he was blameworthy.[1303]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡتَقَمَهُ ٱلۡحُوتُ وَهُوَ مُلِيمٞ
data.footnotes: [1303]- For having given up hope on his people prematurely and having left them without permission from Allāh.

data.price: (143) And had he not been of those who exalt Allāh,
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ أَنَّهُۥ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُسَبِّحِينَ

data.price: (144) He would have remained inside its belly until the Day they are resurrected.[1304]
data.arabic: لَلَبِثَ فِي بَطۡنِهِۦٓ إِلَىٰ يَوۡمِ يُبۡعَثُونَ
data.footnotes: [1304]- Meaning that the belly of the fish would have become his grave.

data.price: (145) But We threw him onto the open shore while he was ill.
data.arabic: ۞ فَنَبَذۡنَٰهُ بِٱلۡعَرَآءِ وَهُوَ سَقِيمٞ

data.price: (146) And We caused to grow over him a gourd vine.[1305]
data.arabic: وَأَنۢبَتۡنَا عَلَيۡهِ شَجَرَةٗ مِّن يَقۡطِينٖ
data.footnotes: [1305]- Which is known to give cooling shade and to be a repellent of flies.

data.price: (147) And We sent him[1306] to [his people of] a hundred thousand or more.
data.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلۡنَٰهُ إِلَىٰ مِاْئَةِ أَلۡفٍ أَوۡ يَزِيدُونَ
data.footnotes: [1306]- i.e., returned him thereafter.

data.price: (148) And they believed, so We gave them enjoyment [of life] for a time.
data.arabic: فَـَٔامَنُواْ فَمَتَّعۡنَٰهُمۡ إِلَىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: (149) So inquire of them, [O Muḥammad], "Does your Lord have daughters while they have sons?[1307]
data.arabic: فَٱسۡتَفۡتِهِمۡ أَلِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡبَنَاتُ وَلَهُمُ ٱلۡبَنُونَ
data.footnotes: [1307]- The people of Makkah claimed that the angels were daughters of Allāh, yet they preferred sons for themselves.

data.price: (150) Or did We create the angels as females while they were witnesses?"
data.arabic: أَمۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ إِنَٰثٗا وَهُمۡ شَٰهِدُونَ

data.price: (151) Unquestionably, it is out of their [invented] falsehood that they say,
data.arabic: أَلَآ إِنَّهُم مِّنۡ إِفۡكِهِمۡ لَيَقُولُونَ

data.price: (152) "Allāh has begotten," and indeed, they are liars.
data.arabic: وَلَدَ ٱللَّهُ وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَكَٰذِبُونَ

data.price: (153) Has He chosen daughters over sons?
data.arabic: أَصۡطَفَى ٱلۡبَنَاتِ عَلَى ٱلۡبَنِينَ

data.price: (154) What is [wrong] with you? How do you make judgement?
data.arabic: مَا لَكُمۡ كَيۡفَ تَحۡكُمُونَ

data.price: (155) Then will you not be reminded?
data.arabic: أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: (156) Or do you have a clear authority?[1308]
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَكُمۡ سُلۡطَٰنٞ مُّبِينٞ
data.footnotes: [1308]- i.e., evidence.

data.price: (157) Then produce your scripture, if you should be truthful.
data.arabic: فَأۡتُواْ بِكِتَٰبِكُمۡ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ

data.price: (158) And they have made [i.e., claimed] between Him and the jinn a lineage, but the jinn have already known that they [who made such claims] will be brought [to punishment].
data.arabic: وَجَعَلُواْ بَيۡنَهُۥ وَبَيۡنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ نَسَبٗاۚ وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمَتِ ٱلۡجِنَّةُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَمُحۡضَرُونَ

data.price: (159) Exalted is Allāh above what they describe,
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

data.price: (160) Except the chosen servants of Allāh [who do not share in that sin].
data.arabic: إِلَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: (161) So indeed, you [disbelievers] and whatever you worship,
data.arabic: فَإِنَّكُمۡ وَمَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (162) You cannot tempt [anyone] away from Him
data.arabic: مَآ أَنتُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ بِفَٰتِنِينَ

data.price: (163) Except he who is to [enter and] burn in the Hellfire.[1309]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنۡ هُوَ صَالِ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1309]- Due to his disbelief and evil deeds.

data.price: (164) [The angels say],[1310] "There is not among us any except that he has a known position.[1311]
data.arabic: وَمَا مِنَّآ إِلَّا لَهُۥ مَقَامٞ مَّعۡلُومٞ
data.footnotes:
[1310]- Refuting what the disbelievers had said about them.
[1311]- For worship.  Or "an assigned task" to perform.

data.price: (165) And indeed, we are those who line up [for prayer].
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلصَّآفُّونَ

data.price: (166) And indeed, we are those who exalt Allāh."
data.arabic: وَإِنَّا لَنَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُسَبِّحُونَ

data.price: (167) And indeed, they [i.e., the disbelievers] used to say,[1312]
data.arabic: وَإِن كَانُواْ لَيَقُولُونَ
data.footnotes: [1312]- Before the revelation of the Qur’ān.

data.price: (168) "If we had a message from [those of] the former peoples,
data.arabic: لَوۡ أَنَّ عِندَنَا ذِكۡرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (169) We would have been the chosen servants of Allāh."
data.arabic: لَكُنَّا عِبَادَ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُخۡلَصِينَ

data.price: (170) But they disbelieved in it,[1313] so they are going to know.
data.arabic: فَكَفَرُواْ بِهِۦۖ فَسَوۡفَ يَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1313]- i.e., in their own message, the Qur’ān.

data.price: (171) And Our word [i.e., decree] has already preceded for Our servants, the messengers,
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ سَبَقَتۡ كَلِمَتُنَا لِعِبَادِنَا ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (172) [That] indeed, they would be those given victory
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ لَهُمُ ٱلۡمَنصُورُونَ

data.price: (173) And [that] indeed, Our soldiers [i.e., the believers] will be those who overcome.[1314]
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ جُندَنَا لَهُمُ ٱلۡغَٰلِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1314]- If not in this world, then definitely in the Hereafter.

data.price: (174) So, [O Muḥammad], leave them for a time.
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: (175) And see [what will befall] them, for they are going to see.
data.arabic: وَأَبۡصِرۡهُمۡ فَسَوۡفَ يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: (176) Then for Our punishment are they impatient?
data.arabic: أَفَبِعَذَابِنَا يَسۡتَعۡجِلُونَ

data.price: (177) But when it descends in their territory, then evil is the morning of those who were warned.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نَزَلَ بِسَاحَتِهِمۡ فَسَآءَ صَبَاحُ ٱلۡمُنذَرِينَ

data.price: (178) And leave them for a time.
data.arabic: وَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡ حَتَّىٰ حِينٖ

data.price: (179) And see, for they are going to see.
data.arabic: وَأَبۡصِرۡ فَسَوۡفَ يُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: (180) Exalted is your Lord, the Lord of might, above what they describe.
data.arabic: سُبۡحَٰنَ رَبِّكَ رَبِّ ٱلۡعِزَّةِ عَمَّا يَصِفُونَ

data.price: (181) And peace upon the messengers.
data.arabic: وَسَلَٰمٌ عَلَى ٱلۡمُرۡسَلِينَ

data.price: (182) And praise to Allāh, Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡحَمۡدُ لِلَّهِ رَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (1) Ṣād.[1316] By the Qur’ān containing reminder...[1317]
data.arabic: صٓۚ وَٱلۡقُرۡءَانِ ذِي ٱلذِّكۡرِ
data.footnotes:
[1316]- See footnote to 2:1.
[1317]- The completion of the oath is understood to be that the Qur’ān is inimitable and thus a miracle from Allāh.

data.price: (2) But those who disbelieve are in pride and dissension.
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي عِزَّةٖ وَشِقَاقٖ

data.price: (3) How many a generation have We destroyed before them, and they [then] called out; but it was not a time for escape.
data.arabic: كَمۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَا مِن قَبۡلِهِم مِّن قَرۡنٖ فَنَادَواْ وَّلَاتَ حِينَ مَنَاصٖ

data.price: (4) And they wonder that there has come to them a warner [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ)] from among themselves. And the disbelievers say, "This is a magician and a liar.
data.arabic: وَعَجِبُوٓاْ أَن جَآءَهُم مُّنذِرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡۖ وَقَالَ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا سَٰحِرٞ كَذَّابٌ

data.price: (5) Has he made the gods [only] one God? Indeed, this is a curious thing."
data.arabic: أَجَعَلَ ٱلۡأٓلِهَةَ إِلَٰهٗا وَٰحِدًاۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٌ عُجَابٞ

data.price: (6) And the eminent among them went forth, [saying], "Continue, and be patient over [the defense of] your gods. Indeed, this is a thing intended.[1318]
data.arabic: وَٱنطَلَقَ ٱلۡمَلَأُ مِنۡهُمۡ أَنِ ٱمۡشُواْ وَٱصۡبِرُواْ عَلَىٰٓ ءَالِهَتِكُمۡۖ إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَشَيۡءٞ يُرَادُ
data.footnotes: [1318]- Planned by Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) in order to gain influence and prestige for himself.

data.price: (7) We have not heard of this in the latest religion.[1319] This is not but a fabrication.
data.arabic: مَا سَمِعۡنَا بِهَٰذَا فِي ٱلۡمِلَّةِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا ٱخۡتِلَٰقٌ
data.footnotes: [1319]- Referring to Christianity or possibly the pagan religion of the Quraysh.

data.price: (8) Has the message been revealed to him out of [all of] us?" Rather, they are in doubt about My message. Rather, they have not yet tasted My punishment.
data.arabic: أَءُنزِلَ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلذِّكۡرُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَاۚ بَلۡ هُمۡ فِي شَكّٖ مِّن ذِكۡرِيۚ بَل لَّمَّا يَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِ

data.price: (9) Or do they have the depositories of the mercy of your Lord, the Exalted in Might, the Bestower?[1320]
data.arabic: أَمۡ عِندَهُمۡ خَزَآئِنُ رَحۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡوَهَّابِ
data.footnotes: [1320]- Refer to footnote of verse 3:8.

data.price: (10) Or is theirs the dominion of the heavens and the earth and what is between them? Then let them ascend through [any] ways of access.[1321]
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَهُم مُّلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَاۖ فَلۡيَرۡتَقُواْ فِي ٱلۡأَسۡبَٰبِ
data.footnotes: [1321]- To oversee the affairs of their dominion.

data.price: (11) [They are but] soldiers [who will be] defeated there among the companies [of disbelievers].
data.arabic: جُندٞ مَّا هُنَالِكَ مَهۡزُومٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابِ

data.price: (12) The people of Noah denied before them, and [the tribe of] ʿAad and Pharaoh, the owner of stakes,[1322]
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ وَعَادٞ وَفِرۡعَوۡنُ ذُو ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
data.footnotes: [1322]- By which he tortured people.

data.price: (13) And [the tribe of] Thamūd and the people of Lot and the companions of the thicket [i.e., people of Madyan]. Those are the companies.[1323]
data.arabic: وَثَمُودُ وَقَوۡمُ لُوطٖ وَأَصۡحَٰبُ لۡـَٔيۡكَةِۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡأَحۡزَابُ
data.footnotes: [1323]- That were defeated, among whom will be the disbelievers of Quraysh and others.

data.price: (14) Each of them denied the messengers, so My penalty was justified.
data.arabic: إِن كُلٌّ إِلَّا كَذَّبَ ٱلرُّسُلَ فَحَقَّ عِقَابِ

data.price: (15) And these [disbelievers] await not but one blast [of the Horn]; for it there will be no delay.[1324]
data.arabic: وَمَا يَنظُرُ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ إِلَّا صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ مَّا لَهَا مِن فَوَاقٖ
data.footnotes: [1324]- Or "respite."  More literally, "a period between two milkings of a she-camel," which also alludes to the meanings of "return" or "repetition."

data.price: (16) And they say, "Our Lord, hasten for us our share [of the punishment] before the Day of Account."
data.arabic: وَقَالُواْ رَبَّنَا عَجِّل لَّنَا قِطَّنَا قَبۡلَ يَوۡمِ ٱلۡحِسَابِ

data.price: (17) Be patient over what they say and remember Our servant, David, the possessor of strength; indeed, he was one who repeatedly turned back [to Allāh].
data.arabic: ٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱذۡكُرۡ عَبۡدَنَا دَاوُۥدَ ذَا ٱلۡأَيۡدِۖ إِنَّهُۥٓ أَوَّابٌ

data.price: (18) Indeed, We subjected the mountains [to praise] with him, exalting [Allāh] in the [late] afternoon and [after] sunrise.
data.arabic: إِنَّا سَخَّرۡنَا ٱلۡجِبَالَ مَعَهُۥ يُسَبِّحۡنَ بِٱلۡعَشِيِّ وَٱلۡإِشۡرَاقِ

data.price: (19) And the birds were assembled, all with him repeating [praises].
