data.price: (23) They are not but [mere] names you have named them - you and your forefathers - for which Allāh has sent down no authority. They follow not except assumption and what [their] souls desire, and there has already come to them from their Lord guidance.
data.arabic: إِنۡ هِيَ إِلَّآ أَسۡمَآءٞ سَمَّيۡتُمُوهَآ أَنتُمۡ وَءَابَآؤُكُم مَّآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَا مِن سُلۡطَٰنٍۚ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّ وَمَا تَهۡوَى ٱلۡأَنفُسُۖ وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّن رَّبِّهِمُ ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ

data.price: (24) Or is there for man whatever he wishes?
data.arabic: أَمۡ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ مَا تَمَنَّىٰ

data.price: (25) Rather, to Allāh belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
data.arabic: فَلِلَّهِ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: (26) And how many angels there are in the heavens whose intercession will not avail at all except [only] after Allāh has permitted [it] to whom He wills and approves.
data.arabic: ۞ وَكَم مِّن مَّلَكٖ فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ لَا تُغۡنِي شَفَٰعَتُهُمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ أَن يَأۡذَنَ ٱللَّهُ لِمَن يَشَآءُ وَيَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: (27) Indeed, those who do not believe in the Hereafter name the angels female names,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ لَيُسَمُّونَ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةَ تَسۡمِيَةَ ٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: (28) And they have thereof no knowledge. They follow not except assumption, and indeed, assumption avails not against the truth at all.
data.arabic: وَمَا لَهُم بِهِۦ مِنۡ عِلۡمٍۖ إِن يَتَّبِعُونَ إِلَّا ٱلظَّنَّۖ وَإِنَّ ٱلظَّنَّ لَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ شَيۡـٔٗا

data.price: (29) So turn away from whoever turns his back on Our message and desires not except the worldly life.
data.arabic: فَأَعۡرِضۡ عَن مَّن تَوَلَّىٰ عَن ذِكۡرِنَا وَلَمۡ يُرِدۡ إِلَّا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: (30) That is their sum of knowledge. Indeed, your Lord is most knowing of who strays from His way, and He is most knowing of who is guided.
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ مَبۡلَغُهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡعِلۡمِۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَن ضَلَّ عَن سَبِيلِهِۦ وَهُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱهۡتَدَىٰ

data.price: (31) And to Allāh belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is in the earth - that He may recompense those who do evil with [the penalty of] what they have done and recompense those who do good with the best [reward] -
data.arabic: وَلِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ لِيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَسَٰٓـُٔواْ بِمَا عَمِلُواْ وَيَجۡزِيَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَحۡسَنُواْ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَى

data.price: (32) Those who avoid the major sins and immoralities, only [committing] slight ones. Indeed, your Lord is vast in forgiveness. He was most knowing of you when He produced you from the earth and when you were fetuses in the wombs of your mothers. So do not claim yourselves to be pure; He is most knowing of who fears Him.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَجۡتَنِبُونَ كَبَٰٓئِرَ ٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡفَوَٰحِشَ إِلَّا ٱللَّمَمَۚ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ وَٰسِعُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِۚ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِكُمۡ إِذۡ أَنشَأَكُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَإِذۡ أَنتُمۡ أَجِنَّةٞ فِي بُطُونِ أُمَّهَٰتِكُمۡۖ فَلَا تُزَكُّوٓاْ أَنفُسَكُمۡۖ هُوَ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَنِ ٱتَّقَىٰٓ

data.price: (33) Have you seen the one who turned away
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي تَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: (34) And gave a little and [then] refrained?
data.arabic: وَأَعۡطَىٰ قَلِيلٗا وَأَكۡدَىٰٓ

data.price: (35) Does he have knowledge of the unseen, so he sees?[1571]
data.arabic: أَعِندَهُۥ عِلۡمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَهُوَ يَرَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [1571]- Knows that his provision will be exhausted if he spends on the poor, while Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) has promised otherwise.

data.price: (36) Or has he not been informed of what was in the scriptures of Moses
data.arabic: أَمۡ لَمۡ يُنَبَّأۡ بِمَا فِي صُحُفِ مُوسَىٰ

data.price: (37) And [of] Abraham, who fulfilled [his obligations] -
data.arabic: وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ ٱلَّذِي وَفَّىٰٓ

data.price: (38) That no bearer of burdens will bear the burden of another
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَزِرُ وَازِرَةٞ وِزۡرَ أُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: (39) And that there is not for man except that [good] for which he strives
data.arabic: وَأَن لَّيۡسَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ إِلَّا مَا سَعَىٰ

data.price: (40) And that his effort is going to be seen -
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ سَعۡيَهُۥ سَوۡفَ يُرَىٰ

data.price: (41) Then he will be recompensed for it with the fullest recompense -
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُجۡزَىٰهُ ٱلۡجَزَآءَ ٱلۡأَوۡفَىٰ

data.price: (42) And that to your Lord is the finality
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡمُنتَهَىٰ

data.price: (43) And that it is He who makes [one] laugh and weep
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَضۡحَكَ وَأَبۡكَىٰ

data.price: (44) And that it is He who causes death and gives life
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَمَاتَ وَأَحۡيَا

data.price: (45) And that He creates the two mates - the male and female -
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ خَلَقَ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰ

data.price: (46) From a sperm-drop when it is emitted
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ إِذَا تُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: (47) And that [incumbent] upon Him is the other [i.e., next] creation.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ عَلَيۡهِ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُخۡرَىٰ

data.price: (48) And that it is He who enriches and suffices
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ أَغۡنَىٰ وَأَقۡنَىٰ

data.price: (49) And that it is He who is the Lord of Sirius[1572]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ هُوَ رَبُّ ٱلشِّعۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1572]- A star worshipped by some of the pagan Arabs.

data.price: (50) And that He destroyed the first [people of] ʿAad
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥٓ أَهۡلَكَ عَادًا ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: (51) And Thamūd - and He did not spare [them] -
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَاْ فَمَآ أَبۡقَىٰ

data.price: (52) And the people of Noah before. Indeed, it was they who were [even] more unjust and oppressing.
data.arabic: وَقَوۡمَ نُوحٖ مِّن قَبۡلُۖ إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ هُمۡ أَظۡلَمَ وَأَطۡغَىٰ

data.price: (53) And the overturned towns[1573] He hurled down
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُؤۡتَفِكَةَ أَهۡوَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1573]- Whose inhabitants defied Prophet Lot.

data.price: (54) And covered them by that which He covered.[1574]
data.arabic: فَغَشَّىٰهَا مَا غَشَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [1574]- i.e., a rain of stones.

data.price: (55) Then which of the favors of your Lord do you doubt?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكَ تَتَمَارَىٰ

data.price: (56) This [Prophet (ﷺ)] is a warner from [i.e., like] the former warners.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نَذِيرٞ مِّنَ ٱلنُّذُرِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ

data.price: (57) The Approaching Day has approached.
data.arabic: أَزِفَتِ ٱلۡأٓزِفَةُ

data.price: (58) Of it, [from those] besides Allāh, there is no remover.
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لَهَا مِن دُونِ ٱللَّهِ كَاشِفَةٌ

data.price: (59) Then at this statement do you wonder?
data.arabic: أَفَمِنۡ هَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ تَعۡجَبُونَ

data.price: (60) And you laugh and do not weep
data.arabic: وَتَضۡحَكُونَ وَلَا تَبۡكُونَ

data.price: (61) While you are proudly sporting?[1575]
data.arabic: وَأَنتُمۡ سَٰمِدُونَ
data.footnotes: [1575]- Additional meanings are "singing [with expanded chest]," "heedless," or "lost in vain amusements."

data.price: (62) So prostrate to Allāh and worship [Him].
data.arabic: فَٱسۡجُدُواْۤ لِلَّهِۤ وَٱعۡبُدُواْ۩

data.price: (1) The Hour has come near, and the moon has split [in two].[1577]
data.arabic: ٱقۡتَرَبَتِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ وَٱنشَقَّ ٱلۡقَمَرُ
data.footnotes: [1577]- This was a sign given by Allāh to Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) when the Quraysh challenged him to show them a miracle.

data.price: (2) And if they see a sign [i.e., miracle], they turn away and say, "Passing magic."[1578]
data.arabic: وَإِن يَرَوۡاْ ءَايَةٗ يُعۡرِضُواْ وَيَقُولُواْ سِحۡرٞ مُّسۡتَمِرّٞ
data.footnotes: [1578]- Or "Continuing magic."

data.price: (3) And they denied and followed their inclinations. But for every matter is a [time of] settlement.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ وَٱتَّبَعُوٓاْ أَهۡوَآءَهُمۡۚ وَكُلُّ أَمۡرٖ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: (4) And there has already come to them of information that in which there is deterrence.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَهُم مِّنَ ٱلۡأَنۢبَآءِ مَا فِيهِ مُزۡدَجَرٌ

data.price: (5) Extensive wisdom - but warning does not avail [them].
data.arabic: حِكۡمَةُۢ بَٰلِغَةٞۖ فَمَا تُغۡنِ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: (6) So leave them, [O Muḥammad]. The Day the Caller[1579] calls to something forbidding,
data.arabic: فَتَوَلَّ عَنۡهُمۡۘ يَوۡمَ يَدۡعُ ٱلدَّاعِ إِلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ نُّكُرٍ
data.footnotes: [1579]- Said to be an angel announcing the account and judgement.

data.price: (7) Their eyes humbled, they will emerge from the graves as if they were locusts spreading,
data.arabic: خُشَّعًا أَبۡصَٰرُهُمۡ يَخۡرُجُونَ مِنَ ٱلۡأَجۡدَاثِ كَأَنَّهُمۡ جَرَادٞ مُّنتَشِرٞ

data.price: (8) Racing ahead toward the Caller. The disbelievers will say, "This is a difficult Day."
data.arabic: مُّهۡطِعِينَ إِلَى ٱلدَّاعِۖ يَقُولُ ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ هَٰذَا يَوۡمٌ عَسِرٞ

data.price: (9) The people of Noah denied before them, and they denied Our servant and said, "A madman," and he was repelled.
data.arabic: ۞ كَذَّبَتۡ قَبۡلَهُمۡ قَوۡمُ نُوحٖ فَكَذَّبُواْ عَبۡدَنَا وَقَالُواْ مَجۡنُونٞ وَٱزۡدُجِرَ

data.price: (10) So he invoked his Lord, "Indeed, I am overpowered, so help."
data.arabic: فَدَعَا رَبَّهُۥٓ أَنِّي مَغۡلُوبٞ فَٱنتَصِرۡ

data.price: (11) Then We opened the gates of the heaven with rain pouring down
data.arabic: فَفَتَحۡنَآ أَبۡوَٰبَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ بِمَآءٖ مُّنۡهَمِرٖ

data.price: (12) And caused the earth to burst with springs, and the waters met for a matter already predestined.
data.arabic: وَفَجَّرۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ عُيُونٗا فَٱلۡتَقَى ٱلۡمَآءُ عَلَىٰٓ أَمۡرٖ قَدۡ قُدِرَ

data.price: (13) And We carried him on a [construction of] planks and nails,
data.arabic: وَحَمَلۡنَٰهُ عَلَىٰ ذَاتِ أَلۡوَٰحٖ وَدُسُرٖ

data.price: (14) Sailing under Our observation as reward for he who had been denied.
data.arabic: تَجۡرِي بِأَعۡيُنِنَا جَزَآءٗ لِّمَن كَانَ كُفِرَ

data.price: (15) And We left it as a sign, so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَد تَّرَكۡنَٰهَآ ءَايَةٗ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: (16) And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.[1580]
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ
data.footnotes: [1580]- To those after them, who were expected to derive a lesson from previous occurrences.

data.price: (17) And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: (18) ʿAad denied; and how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ عَادٞ فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: (19) Indeed, We sent upon them a screaming wind on a day of continuous misfortune,
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ رِيحٗا صَرۡصَرٗا فِي يَوۡمِ نَحۡسٖ مُّسۡتَمِرّٖ

data.price: (20) Extracting the people[1581] as if they were trunks of palm trees uprooted.
data.arabic: تَنزِعُ ٱلنَّاسَ كَأَنَّهُمۡ أَعۡجَازُ نَخۡلٖ مُّنقَعِرٖ
data.footnotes: [1581]- From their hiding places.

data.price: (21) And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: (22) And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: (23) Thamūd denied the warning.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: (24) And said, "Is it one human being[1582] among us that we should follow? Indeed, we would then be in error and madness.
data.arabic: فَقَالُوٓاْ أَبَشَرٗا مِّنَّا وَٰحِدٗا نَّتَّبِعُهُۥٓ إِنَّآ إِذٗا لَّفِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٍ
data.footnotes: [1582]- i.e., the prophet Ṣāliḥ.

data.price: (25) Has the message been sent down upon him from among us? Rather, he is an insolent liar."
data.arabic: أَءُلۡقِيَ ٱلذِّكۡرُ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۢ بَيۡنِنَا بَلۡ هُوَ كَذَّابٌ أَشِرٞ

data.price: (26) They will know tomorrow who is the insolent liar.
data.arabic: سَيَعۡلَمُونَ غَدٗا مَّنِ ٱلۡكَذَّابُ ٱلۡأَشِرُ

data.price: (27) Indeed, We are sending the she-camel as trial for them, so watch them and be patient.[1583]
data.arabic: إِنَّا مُرۡسِلُواْ ٱلنَّاقَةِ فِتۡنَةٗ لَّهُمۡ فَٱرۡتَقِبۡهُمۡ وَٱصۡطَبِرۡ
data.footnotes: [1583]- This and the following verse are an address to Ṣāliḥ (upon him be peace).

data.price: (28) And inform them that the water is shared between them,[1584] each [day of] drink attended [by turn].
data.arabic: وَنَبِّئۡهُمۡ أَنَّ ٱلۡمَآءَ قِسۡمَةُۢ بَيۡنَهُمۡۖ كُلُّ شِرۡبٖ مُّحۡتَضَرٞ
data.footnotes: [1584]- i.e., between the tribe of Thamūd and the she-camel - a day for each to drink.

data.price: (29) But they called their companion,[1585] and he dared[1586] and hamstrung [her].
data.arabic: فَنَادَوۡاْ صَاحِبَهُمۡ فَتَعَاطَىٰ فَعَقَرَ
data.footnotes:
[1585]- i.e., the worst and most despicable among them.
[1586]- Or "he took," referring to his sword or to the she-camel.

data.price: (30) And how [severe] were My punishment and warning.
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ كَانَ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: (31) Indeed, We sent upon them one shriek [i.e., blast from the sky], and they became like the dry twig fragments of an [animal] pen.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ صَيۡحَةٗ وَٰحِدَةٗ فَكَانُواْ كَهَشِيمِ ٱلۡمُحۡتَظِرِ

data.price: (32) And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: (33) The people of Lot denied the warning.
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ قَوۡمُ لُوطِۭ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: (34) Indeed, We sent upon them a storm of stones, except the family of Lot - We saved them before dawn.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَاصِبًا إِلَّآ ءَالَ لُوطٖۖ نَّجَّيۡنَٰهُم بِسَحَرٖ

data.price: (35) As favor from Us. Thus do We reward he who is grateful.
data.arabic: نِّعۡمَةٗ مِّنۡ عِندِنَاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي مَن شَكَرَ

data.price: (36) And he had already warned them of Our assault, but they disputed the warning.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَنذَرَهُم بَطۡشَتَنَا فَتَمَارَوۡاْ بِٱلنُّذُرِ

data.price: (37) And they had demanded from him his guests, but We obliterated their eyes, [saying], "Taste My punishment and warning."
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَٰوَدُوهُ عَن ضَيۡفِهِۦ فَطَمَسۡنَآ أَعۡيُنَهُمۡ فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: (38) And there came upon them by morning an abiding punishment.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ صَبَّحَهُم بُكۡرَةً عَذَابٞ مُّسۡتَقِرّٞ

data.price: (39) So taste My punishment and warning.
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ عَذَابِي وَنُذُرِ

data.price: (40) And We have certainly made the Qur’ān easy for remembrance, so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ يَسَّرۡنَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ لِلذِّكۡرِ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ

data.price: (41) And there certainly came to the people of Pharaoh warning.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ جَآءَ ءَالَ فِرۡعَوۡنَ ٱلنُّذُرُ

data.price: (42) They denied Our signs, all of them, so We seized them with a seizure of one Exalted in Might and Perfect in Ability.
data.arabic: كَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كُلِّهَا فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُمۡ أَخۡذَ عَزِيزٖ مُّقۡتَدِرٍ

data.price: (43) Are your disbelievers better than those [former ones], or have you immunity in the scriptures?
data.arabic: أَكُفَّارُكُمۡ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أُوْلَٰٓئِكُمۡ أَمۡ لَكُم بَرَآءَةٞ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ

data.price: (44) Or do they say, "We are an assembly supporting [each other]"?
data.arabic: أَمۡ يَقُولُونَ نَحۡنُ جَمِيعٞ مُّنتَصِرٞ

data.price: (45) [Their] assembly will be defeated, and they will turn their backs [in retreat].[1587]
data.arabic: سَيُهۡزَمُ ٱلۡجَمۡعُ وَيُوَلُّونَ ٱلدُّبُرَ
data.footnotes: [1587]- This foretold event took place on the day of Badr.

data.price: (46) But the Hour is their appointment [for due punishment], and the Hour is more disastrous and more bitter.
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلسَّاعَةُ مَوۡعِدُهُمۡ وَٱلسَّاعَةُ أَدۡهَىٰ وَأَمَرُّ

data.price: (47) Indeed, the criminals are in error and madness.[1588].
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ فِي ضَلَٰلٖ وَسُعُرٖ
data.footnotes: [1588]- Or "in blazing fires."

data.price: (48) The Day they are dragged into the Fire on their faces [it will be said], "Taste the touch of Saqar."[1589]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُسۡحَبُونَ فِي ٱلنَّارِ عَلَىٰ وُجُوهِهِمۡ ذُوقُواْ مَسَّ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: [1589]- One of the proper names of Hell.

data.price: (49) Indeed, all things We created with predestination.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقۡنَٰهُ بِقَدَرٖ

data.price: (50) And Our command is but one, like a glance of the eye.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَمۡرُنَآ إِلَّا وَٰحِدَةٞ كَلَمۡحِۭ بِٱلۡبَصَرِ

data.price: (51) And We have already destroyed your kinds,[1590] so is there any who will remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَهۡلَكۡنَآ أَشۡيَاعَكُمۡ فَهَلۡ مِن مُّدَّكِرٖ
data.footnotes: [1590]- i.e., those similar to you in attitude and behavior when they rejected Allāh's messengers.

data.price: (52) And everything they did is in written records.
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ شَيۡءٖ فَعَلُوهُ فِي ٱلزُّبُرِ

data.price: (53) And every small and great [thing] is inscribed.
data.arabic: وَكُلُّ صَغِيرٖ وَكَبِيرٖ مُّسۡتَطَرٌ

data.price: (54) Indeed, the righteous will be among gardens and rivers,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي جَنَّٰتٖ وَنَهَرٖ

data.price: (55) In a seat of honor near a Sovereign, Perfect in Ability.[1591]
data.arabic: فِي مَقۡعَدِ صِدۡقٍ عِندَ مَلِيكٖ مُّقۡتَدِرِۭ
data.footnotes: [1591]- Who accomplishes whatever He wills whenever He wills.

data.price: (1) The Most Merciful
data.arabic: ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ

data.price: (2) Taught the Qur’ān,
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ

data.price: (3) Created man,
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ

data.price: (4) [And] taught him eloquence.
data.arabic: عَلَّمَهُ ٱلۡبَيَانَ

data.price: (5) The sun and the moon [move] by precise calculation,
data.arabic: ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ بِحُسۡبَانٖ

data.price: (6) And the stars and trees prostrate.[1593]
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّجۡمُ وَٱلشَّجَرُ يَسۡجُدَانِ
data.footnotes: [1593]- They submit obediently to the laws of Allāh.  See 22:18.  An additional meaning of "najm" is vegetation of a kind without a trunk, stalk or stem.

data.price: (7) And the heaven He raised and imposed the balance
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءَ رَفَعَهَا وَوَضَعَ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: (8) That you not transgress within the balance.
data.arabic: أَلَّا تَطۡغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡمِيزَانِ

data.price: (9) And establish weight in justice and do not make deficient the balance.
data.arabic: وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلۡوَزۡنَ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِ وَلَا تُخۡسِرُواْ ٱلۡمِيزَانَ

data.price: (10) And the earth He laid [out] for the creatures.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ وَضَعَهَا لِلۡأَنَامِ

data.price: (11) Therein is fruit and palm trees having sheaths [of dates]
data.arabic: فِيهَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَٱلنَّخۡلُ ذَاتُ ٱلۡأَكۡمَامِ

data.price: (12) And grain having husks and scented plants.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡحَبُّ ذُو ٱلۡعَصۡفِ وَٱلرَّيۡحَانُ

data.price: (13) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?[1594]
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ
data.footnotes: [1594]- Literally, "you two," addressing the species of mankind and jinn.

data.price: (14) He created man from clay like [that of] pottery.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن صَلۡصَٰلٖ كَٱلۡفَخَّارِ

data.price: (15) And He created the jinn from a smokeless flame of fire.
data.arabic: وَخَلَقَ ٱلۡجَآنَّ مِن مَّارِجٖ مِّن نَّارٖ

data.price: (16) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (17) [He is] Lord of the two sunrises and Lord of the two sunsets.[1595]
data.arabic: رَبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقَيۡنِ وَرَبُّ ٱلۡمَغۡرِبَيۡنِ
data.footnotes: [1595]- i.e., the points of sunrise in the east and sunset in the west in both summer and winter.

data.price: (18) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (19) He released the two seas,[1596] meeting [one another];
data.arabic: مَرَجَ ٱلۡبَحۡرَيۡنِ يَلۡتَقِيَانِ
data.footnotes: [1596]- Two bodies of water or two sea waters of distinct characteristics.

data.price: (20) Between them is a barrier so neither of them transgresses.
data.arabic: بَيۡنَهُمَا بَرۡزَخٞ لَّا يَبۡغِيَانِ

data.price: (21) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (22) From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهُمَا ٱللُّؤۡلُؤُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ

data.price: (23) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (24) And to Him belong the ships [with sails] elevated in the sea like mountains.
data.arabic: وَلَهُ ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡمُنشَـَٔاتُ فِي ٱلۡبَحۡرِ كَٱلۡأَعۡلَٰمِ

data.price: (25) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (26) Everyone upon it [i.e., the earth] will perish,
data.arabic: كُلُّ مَنۡ عَلَيۡهَا فَانٖ

data.price: (27) And there will remain the Face[1597] of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
data.arabic: وَيَبۡقَىٰ وَجۡهُ رَبِّكَ ذُو ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ
data.footnotes: [1597]- See footnote to 2:19.

data.price: (28) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (29) Whoever is within the heavens and earth asks Him; every day He is in [i.e., bringing about] a matter.[1598]
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُهُۥ مَن فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ كُلَّ يَوۡمٍ هُوَ فِي شَأۡنٖ
data.footnotes: [1598]- For each of His creatures.

data.price: (30) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (31) We will attend to you, O prominent beings.[1599]
data.arabic: سَنَفۡرُغُ لَكُمۡ أَيُّهَ ٱلثَّقَلَانِ
data.footnotes: [1599]- Specifically two:  mankind and jinn.

data.price: (32) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (33) O company of jinn and mankind, if you are able to pass beyond the regions of the heavens and the earth, then pass. You will not pass except by authority [from Allāh].
data.arabic: يَٰمَعۡشَرَ ٱلۡجِنِّ وَٱلۡإِنسِ إِنِ ٱسۡتَطَعۡتُمۡ أَن تَنفُذُواْ مِنۡ أَقۡطَارِ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ فَٱنفُذُواْۚ لَا تَنفُذُونَ إِلَّا بِسُلۡطَٰنٖ

data.price: (34) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (35) There will be sent upon you a flame of fire and smoke,[1600] and you will not defend yourselves.
data.arabic: يُرۡسَلُ عَلَيۡكُمَا شُوَاظٞ مِّن نَّارٖ وَنُحَاسٞ فَلَا تَنتَصِرَانِ
data.footnotes: [1600]- Another possible meaning is liquefied brass or copper.

data.price: (36) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (37) And when the heaven is split open and becomes rose-colored like oil[1601] -
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱنشَقَّتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ وَرۡدَةٗ كَٱلدِّهَانِ
data.footnotes: [1601]- Or "like a tanned skin."

data.price: (38) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (39) Then on that Day none will be asked about his sin among men or jinn.[1602]
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُسۡـَٔلُ عَن ذَنۢبِهِۦٓ إِنسٞ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes: [1602]- Once they have been condemned to the Fire.

data.price: (40) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (41) The criminals will be known by their marks, and they will be seized by the forelocks and the feet.
data.arabic: يُعۡرَفُ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ بِسِيمَٰهُمۡ فَيُؤۡخَذُ بِٱلنَّوَٰصِي وَٱلۡأَقۡدَامِ

data.price: (42) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (43) This is Hell, which the criminals deny.
data.arabic: هَٰذِهِۦ جَهَنَّمُ ٱلَّتِي يُكَذِّبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: (44) They will circulate between it and scalding water, heated [to the utmost degree].
data.arabic: يَطُوفُونَ بَيۡنَهَا وَبَيۡنَ حَمِيمٍ ءَانٖ

data.price: (45) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (46) But for he who has feared the position of his Lord[1603] are two gardens -
data.arabic: وَلِمَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ جَنَّتَانِ
data.footnotes: [1603]- An alternative meaning is "the standing [for account] before his Lord."

data.price: (47) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (48) Having [spreading] branches.
data.arabic: ذَوَاتَآ أَفۡنَانٖ

data.price: (49) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (50) In both of them are two springs, flowing.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ تَجۡرِيَانِ

data.price: (51) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (52) In both of them are of every fruit, two kinds.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا مِن كُلِّ فَٰكِهَةٖ زَوۡجَانِ

data.price: (53) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (54) [They are] reclining on beds whose linings are of silk brocade, and the fruit of the two gardens is hanging low.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ فُرُشِۭ بَطَآئِنُهَا مِنۡ إِسۡتَبۡرَقٖۚ وَجَنَى ٱلۡجَنَّتَيۡنِ دَانٖ

data.price: (55) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (56) In them are women limiting [their] glances,[1604] untouched[1605] before them by man or jinnī -
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ قَٰصِرَٰتُ ٱلطَّرۡفِ لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ
data.footnotes:
[1604]- To their own mates, i.e., being chaste and modest.
[1605]- Literally, they have not been caused to bleed by loss of virginity.

data.price: (57) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (58) As if they were rubies and coral.[1606]
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُنَّ ٱلۡيَاقُوتُ وَٱلۡمَرۡجَانُ
data.footnotes: [1606]- In purity, color and beauty.

data.price: (59) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (60) Is the reward for good [anything] but good?
data.arabic: هَلۡ جَزَآءُ ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنِ إِلَّا ٱلۡإِحۡسَٰنُ

data.price: (61) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (62) And below them both [in excellence] are two [other] gardens -
data.arabic: وَمِن دُونِهِمَا جَنَّتَانِ

data.price: (63) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (64) Dark green [in color].
data.arabic: مُدۡهَآمَّتَانِ

data.price: (65) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (66) In both of them are two springs, spouting.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا عَيۡنَانِ نَضَّاخَتَانِ

data.price: (67) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (68) In both of them are fruit and palm trees and pomegranates.
data.arabic: فِيهِمَا فَٰكِهَةٞ وَنَخۡلٞ وَرُمَّانٞ

data.price: (69) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (70) In them are good and beautiful women -
data.arabic: فِيهِنَّ خَيۡرَٰتٌ حِسَانٞ

data.price: (71) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (72) Fair ones reserved in pavilions -
data.arabic: حُورٞ مَّقۡصُورَٰتٞ فِي ٱلۡخِيَامِ

data.price: (73) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (74) Untouched before them by man or jinnī -
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَطۡمِثۡهُنَّ إِنسٞ قَبۡلَهُمۡ وَلَا جَآنّٞ

data.price: (75) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny? -
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (76) Reclining on green cushions and beautiful fine carpets.
data.arabic: مُتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَىٰ رَفۡرَفٍ خُضۡرٖ وَعَبۡقَرِيٍّ حِسَانٖ

data.price: (77) So which of the favors of your Lord would you deny?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ ءَالَآءِ رَبِّكُمَا تُكَذِّبَانِ

data.price: (78) Blessed is the name of your Lord, Owner of Majesty and Honor.
data.arabic: تَبَٰرَكَ ٱسۡمُ رَبِّكَ ذِي ٱلۡجَلَٰلِ وَٱلۡإِكۡرَامِ

data.price: (1) When the Occurrence occurs,
data.arabic: إِذَا وَقَعَتِ ٱلۡوَاقِعَةُ

data.price: (2) There is, at its occurrence, no denial.
data.arabic: لَيۡسَ لِوَقۡعَتِهَا كَاذِبَةٌ

data.price: (3) It will bring down [some] and raise up [others].[1608]
data.arabic: خَافِضَةٞ رَّافِعَةٌ
data.footnotes: [1608]- According to their deeds rather than wealth and social position, as is the case in this world.

data.price: (4) When the earth is shaken with convulsion
data.arabic: إِذَا رُجَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ رَجّٗا

data.price: (5) And the mountains are broken down, crumbling
data.arabic: وَبُسَّتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ بَسّٗا

data.price: (6) And become dust dispersing,
data.arabic: فَكَانَتۡ هَبَآءٗ مُّنۢبَثّٗا

data.price: (7) And you become [of] three kinds:
data.arabic: وَكُنتُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا ثَلَٰثَةٗ

data.price: (8) Then the companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?[1609]
data.arabic: فَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
data.footnotes: [1609]- i.e., those given their records in their right hand and who are destined for Paradise.

data.price: (9) And the companions of the left - what are companions of the left?[1610]
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
data.footnotes: [1610]- i.e., those given their records in their left hand and who are destined for Hell.

data.price: (10) And the forerunners, the forerunners[1611] -
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ ٱلسَّٰبِقُونَ
data.footnotes: [1611]- The words can also be understood as a complete sentence, i.e., "The forerunners [in good deeds] are the forerunners [in entering Paradise]."

data.price: (11) Those are the ones brought near [to Allāh]
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: (12) In the Gardens of Pleasure,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: (13) A [large] company of the former peoples
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (14) And a few of the later peoples,
data.arabic: وَقَلِيلٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (15) On thrones woven [with ornament],
data.arabic: عَلَىٰ سُرُرٖ مَّوۡضُونَةٖ

data.price: (16) Reclining on them, facing each other.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ عَلَيۡهَا مُتَقَٰبِلِينَ

data.price: (17) There will circulate among them young boys made eternal
data.arabic: يَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ

data.price: (18) With vessels, pitchers and a cup [of wine] from a flowing spring -
data.arabic: بِأَكۡوَابٖ وَأَبَارِيقَ وَكَأۡسٖ مِّن مَّعِينٖ

data.price: (19) No headache will they have therefrom, nor will they be intoxicated -
data.arabic: لَّا يُصَدَّعُونَ عَنۡهَا وَلَا يُنزِفُونَ

data.price: (20) And fruit of what they select
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ مِّمَّا يَتَخَيَّرُونَ

data.price: (21) And the meat of fowl, from whatever they desire.
data.arabic: وَلَحۡمِ طَيۡرٖ مِّمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: (22) And [for them are] fair women with large, [beautiful] eyes,
data.arabic: وَحُورٌ عِينٞ

data.price: (23) The likenesses of pearls well-protected,
data.arabic: كَأَمۡثَٰلِ ٱللُّؤۡلُوِٕ ٱلۡمَكۡنُونِ

data.price: (24) As reward for what they used to do.
data.arabic: جَزَآءَۢ بِمَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (25) They will not hear therein ill speech or commission of sin -
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا تَأۡثِيمًا

data.price: (26) Only a saying [of] peace, peace.
data.arabic: إِلَّا قِيلٗا سَلَٰمٗا سَلَٰمٗا

data.price: (27) The companions of the right - what are the companions of the right?
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: (28) [They will be] among lote trees with thorns removed
data.arabic: فِي سِدۡرٖ مَّخۡضُودٖ

data.price: (29) And [banana] trees layered [with fruit]
data.arabic: وَطَلۡحٖ مَّنضُودٖ

data.price: (30) And shade extended
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مَّمۡدُودٖ

data.price: (31) And water poured out
data.arabic: وَمَآءٖ مَّسۡكُوبٖ

data.price: (32) And fruit, abundant [and varied],
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٖ كَثِيرَةٖ

data.price: (33) Neither limited [to season] nor forbidden,
data.arabic: لَّا مَقۡطُوعَةٖ وَلَا مَمۡنُوعَةٖ

data.price: (34) And [upon] beds raised high.
data.arabic: وَفُرُشٖ مَّرۡفُوعَةٍ

data.price: (35) Indeed, We have produced them [i.e., the women of Paradise] in a [new] creation
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنشَأۡنَٰهُنَّ إِنشَآءٗ

data.price: (36) And made them virgins,
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُنَّ أَبۡكَارًا

data.price: (37) Devoted [to their husbands] and of equal age,
data.arabic: عُرُبًا أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: (38) For the companions of the right [who are]
data.arabic: لِّأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: (39) A company of the former peoples
data.arabic: ثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (40) And a company of the later peoples.
data.arabic: وَثُلَّةٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (41) And the companions of the left - what are the companions of the left?
data.arabic: وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ مَآ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلشِّمَالِ

data.price: (42) [They will be] in scorching fire and scalding water
data.arabic: فِي سَمُومٖ وَحَمِيمٖ

data.price: (43) And a shade of black smoke,
data.arabic: وَظِلّٖ مِّن يَحۡمُومٖ

data.price: (44) Neither cool nor beneficial.
data.arabic: لَّا بَارِدٖ وَلَا كَرِيمٍ

data.price: (45) Indeed they were, before that, indulging in affluence,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ قَبۡلَ ذَٰلِكَ مُتۡرَفِينَ

data.price: (46) And they used to persist in the great violation,[1612]
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يُصِرُّونَ عَلَى ٱلۡحِنثِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1612]- i.e., shirk (association with Allāh) or disbelief.

data.price: (47) And they used to say, "When we die and become dust and bones, are we indeed to be resurrected?
data.arabic: وَكَانُواْ يَقُولُونَ أَئِذَا مِتۡنَا وَكُنَّا تُرَابٗا وَعِظَٰمًا أَءِنَّا لَمَبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: (48) And our forefathers [as well]?"
data.arabic: أَوَءَابَآؤُنَا ٱلۡأَوَّلُونَ

data.price: (49) Say, [O Muḥammad], "Indeed, the former and later peoples
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ وَٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (50) Are to be gathered together for the appointment of a known Day."
data.arabic: لَمَجۡمُوعُونَ إِلَىٰ مِيقَٰتِ يَوۡمٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: (51) Then indeed you, O those astray [who are] deniers,
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّكُمۡ أَيُّهَا ٱلضَّآلُّونَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (52) Will be eating from trees of zaqqūm
data.arabic: لَأٓكِلُونَ مِن شَجَرٖ مِّن زَقُّومٖ

data.price: (53) And filling with it your bellies
data.arabic: فَمَالِـُٔونَ مِنۡهَا ٱلۡبُطُونَ

data.price: (54) And drinking on top of it from scalding water
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ عَلَيۡهِ مِنَ ٱلۡحَمِيمِ

data.price: (55) And will drink as the drinking of thirsty camels.
data.arabic: فَشَٰرِبُونَ شُرۡبَ ٱلۡهِيمِ

data.price: (56) That is their accommodation on the Day of Recompense.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا نُزُلُهُمۡ يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (57) We have created you, so why do you not believe?
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ فَلَوۡلَا تُصَدِّقُونَ

data.price: (58) Have you seen that which you emit?[1613]
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تُمۡنُونَ
data.footnotes: [1613]- i.e., semen, which contains the potential for human life.

data.price: (59) Is it you who creates it, or are We the Creator?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَخۡلُقُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُونَ

data.price: (60) We have decreed death among you, and We are not to be outdone
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ قَدَّرۡنَا بَيۡنَكُمُ ٱلۡمَوۡتَ وَمَا نَحۡنُ بِمَسۡبُوقِينَ

data.price: (61) In that We will change your likenesses and produce you in that [form] which you do not know.[1614]
data.arabic: عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّبَدِّلَ أَمۡثَٰلَكُمۡ وَنُنشِئَكُمۡ فِي مَا لَا تَعۡلَمُونَ
data.footnotes: [1614]- An alternative meaning has also been given:  "...in that We will replace the likes of you [with others upon the earth] and create you [in the Hereafter] in that which you do not know."

data.price: (62) And you have already known the first creation, so will you not remember?
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ عَلِمۡتُمُ ٱلنَّشۡأَةَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ فَلَوۡلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ

data.price: (63) And have you seen that [seed] which you sow?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُم مَّا تَحۡرُثُونَ

data.price: (64) Is it you who makes it grow, or are We the grower?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ تَزۡرَعُونَهُۥٓ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلزَّٰرِعُونَ

data.price: (65) If We willed, We could make it [dry] debris, and you would remain in wonder,[1615]
data.arabic: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ لَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ حُطَٰمٗا فَظَلۡتُمۡ تَفَكَّهُونَ
data.footnotes: [1615]- At what had happened or remain in a state of shock.  Another meaning is "in regret."

data.price: (66) [Saying], "Indeed, we are [now] in debt;
data.arabic: إِنَّا لَمُغۡرَمُونَ

data.price: (67) Rather, we have been deprived."
data.arabic: بَلۡ نَحۡنُ مَحۡرُومُونَ

data.price: (68) And have you seen the water that you drink?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَآءَ ٱلَّذِي تَشۡرَبُونَ

data.price: (69) Is it you who brought it down from the clouds, or is it We who bring it down?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنزَلۡتُمُوهُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُزۡنِ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنزِلُونَ

data.price: (70) If We willed, We could make it bitter, so why are you not grateful?
data.arabic: لَوۡ نَشَآءُ جَعَلۡنَٰهُ أُجَاجٗا فَلَوۡلَا تَشۡكُرُونَ

data.price: (71) And have you seen the fire that you ignite?
data.arabic: أَفَرَءَيۡتُمُ ٱلنَّارَ ٱلَّتِي تُورُونَ

data.price: (72) Is it you who produced its tree, or are We the producer?
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَنشَأۡتُمۡ شَجَرَتَهَآ أَمۡ نَحۡنُ ٱلۡمُنشِـُٔونَ

data.price: (73) We have made it a reminder[1616] and provision for the travelers,[1617]
data.arabic: نَحۡنُ جَعَلۡنَٰهَا تَذۡكِرَةٗ وَمَتَٰعٗا لِّلۡمُقۡوِينَ
data.footnotes:
[1616]- Of the great fire of Hell.
[1617]- In the form of flints or other means by which to ignite fire.  Travelers are mentioned because of the special convenience to them, although it is a provision for all people in general.

data.price: (74) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (75) Then I swear by the setting of the stars,[1618]
data.arabic: ۞ فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِمَوَٰقِعِ ٱلنُّجُومِ
data.footnotes: [1618]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) confirms absolutely by oath.

data.price: (76) And indeed, it is an oath - if you could know - [most] great.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لَقَسَمٞ لَّوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عَظِيمٌ

data.price: (77) Indeed, it is a noble Qur’ān.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقُرۡءَانٞ كَرِيمٞ

data.price: (78) In a Register well-protected;[1619].
data.arabic: فِي كِتَٰبٖ مَّكۡنُونٖ
data.footnotes: [1619]- The Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ), which is with Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

data.price: (79) None touch it except the purified [i.e., the angels].
data.arabic: لَّا يَمَسُّهُۥٓ إِلَّا ٱلۡمُطَهَّرُونَ

data.price: (80) [It is] a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: تَنزِيلٞ مِّن رَّبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (81) Then is it to this statement that you are indifferent
data.arabic: أَفَبِهَٰذَا ٱلۡحَدِيثِ أَنتُم مُّدۡهِنُونَ

data.price: (82) And make [the thanks for] your provision that you deny [the Provider]?
data.arabic: وَتَجۡعَلُونَ رِزۡقَكُمۡ أَنَّكُمۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (83) Then why, when it [i.e., the soul at death] reaches the throat
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلۡحُلۡقُومَ

data.price: (84) And you are at that time looking on -
data.arabic: وَأَنتُمۡ حِينَئِذٖ تَنظُرُونَ

data.price: (85) And We [i.e., Our angels] are nearer to him than you, but you do not see -
data.arabic: وَنَحۡنُ أَقۡرَبُ إِلَيۡهِ مِنكُمۡ وَلَٰكِن لَّا تُبۡصِرُونَ

data.price: (86) Then why do you not, if you are not to be recompensed,
data.arabic: فَلَوۡلَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ غَيۡرَ مَدِينِينَ

data.price: (87) Bring it back,[1620] if you should be truthful?
data.arabic: تَرۡجِعُونَهَآ إِن كُنتُمۡ صَٰدِقِينَ
data.footnotes: [1620]- i.e., return the soul to the body, meaning that just as you cannot prevent death when it is decreed, you will not escape the recompense when it is decreed.

data.price: (88) And if he [i.e., the deceased] was of those brought near [to Allāh],
data.arabic: فَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبِينَ

data.price: (89) Then [for him is] rest and bounty and a garden of pleasure.
data.arabic: فَرَوۡحٞ وَرَيۡحَانٞ وَجَنَّتُ نَعِيمٖ

data.price: (90) And if he was of the companions of the right,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: (91) Then [the angels will say], "Peace for you; [you are] from the companions of the right."
data.arabic: فَسَلَٰمٞ لَّكَ مِنۡ أَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡيَمِينِ

data.price: (92) But if he was of the deniers [who were] astray,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِن كَانَ مِنَ ٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ ٱلضَّآلِّينَ

data.price: (93) Then [for him is] accommodation of scalding water
data.arabic: فَنُزُلٞ مِّنۡ حَمِيمٖ

data.price: (94) And burning in Hellfire.
data.arabic: وَتَصۡلِيَةُ جَحِيمٍ

data.price: (95) Indeed, this is the true certainty,
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَهُوَ حَقُّ ٱلۡيَقِينِ

data.price: (96) So exalt the name of your Lord, the Most Great.
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (1) Whatever is in the heavens and earth exalts Allāh,[1622] and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
data.arabic: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
data.footnotes: [1622]- By praising Him and declaring Him far above and beyond any failure or imperfection.

data.price: (2) His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. He gives life and causes death, and He is over all things competent.
data.arabic: لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ يُحۡيِۦ وَيُمِيتُۖ وَهُوَ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٌ

data.price: (3) He is the First[1623] and the Last,[1624] the Ascendant[1625] and the Intimate,[1626] and He is, of all things, Knowing.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلۡأَوَّلُ وَٱلۡأٓخِرُ وَٱلظَّٰهِرُ وَٱلۡبَاطِنُۖ وَهُوَ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٌ
data.footnotes:
[1623]- Before whom nothing existed.  Also, He who is supreme, foremost or uppermost.
[1624]- Enduring eternally when nothing else remains.
[1625]- Nothing being above Him.  Another meaning is "the Apparent," i.e., evident through His creation and revelation.
[1626]- Nothing being nearer than Him by way of His knowledge.  Another meaning is "the Unapparent," i.e., concealed from man's physical senses.

data.price: (4) It is He who created the heavens and earth in six days and then established Himself above the Throne.[1627] He knows what penetrates into the earth and what emerges from it and what descends from the heaven and what ascends therein; and He is with you[1628] wherever you are. And Allāh, of what you do, is Seeing.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ يَعۡلَمُ مَا يَلِجُ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا يَخۡرُجُ مِنۡهَا وَمَا يَنزِلُ مِنَ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا يَعۡرُجُ فِيهَاۖ وَهُوَ مَعَكُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كُنتُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ بَصِيرٞ
data.footnotes:
[1627]- See footnotes to 2:19 and 7:54.
[1628]- In knowledge - observing and witnessing.

data.price: (5) His is the dominion of the heavens and earth. And to Allāh are returned [all] matters.
data.arabic: لَّهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ تُرۡجَعُ ٱلۡأُمُورُ

data.price: (6) He causes the night to enter the day and causes the day to enter the night, and He is Knowing of that within the breasts.
data.arabic: يُولِجُ ٱلَّيۡلَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِي ٱلَّيۡلِۚ وَهُوَ عَلِيمُۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ

data.price: (7) Believe in Allāh and His Messenger and spend out of that in which He has made you successive inheritors. For those who have believed among you and spent,[1629] there will be a great reward.
data.arabic: ءَامِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦ وَأَنفِقُواْ مِمَّا جَعَلَكُم مُّسۡتَخۡلَفِينَ فِيهِۖ فَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنكُمۡ وَأَنفَقُواْ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَبِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [1629]- In ways pleasing to Allāh.

data.price: (8) And why do you not believe in Allāh while the Messenger invites you to believe in your Lord and He has taken your covenant, if you should [truly] be believers?
data.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمۡ لَا تُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلرَّسُولُ يَدۡعُوكُمۡ لِتُؤۡمِنُواْ بِرَبِّكُمۡ وَقَدۡ أَخَذَ مِيثَٰقَكُمۡ إِن كُنتُم مُّؤۡمِنِينَ

data.price: (9) It is He who sends down upon His Servant [Muḥammad (ﷺ)] verses of clear evidence that He may bring you out from darknesses into the light. And indeed, Allāh is to you Kind and Merciful.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِي يُنَزِّلُ عَلَىٰ عَبۡدِهِۦٓ ءَايَٰتِۭ بَيِّنَٰتٖ لِّيُخۡرِجَكُم مِّنَ ٱلظُّلُمَٰتِ إِلَى ٱلنُّورِۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُمۡ لَرَءُوفٞ رَّحِيمٞ

data.price: (10) And why do you not spend in the cause of Allāh while to Allāh belongs the heritage of the heavens and the earth? Not equal among you are those who spent before the conquest [of Makkah] and fought [and those who did so after it]. Those are greater in degree than they who spent afterwards and fought. But to all Allāh has promised the best [reward]. And Allāh, of what you do, is Aware.
data.arabic: وَمَا لَكُمۡ أَلَّا تُنفِقُواْ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِلَّهِ مِيرَٰثُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ لَا يَسۡتَوِي مِنكُم مَّنۡ أَنفَقَ مِن قَبۡلِ ٱلۡفَتۡحِ وَقَٰتَلَۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَعۡظَمُ دَرَجَةٗ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أَنفَقُواْ مِنۢ بَعۡدُ وَقَٰتَلُواْۚ وَكُلّٗا وَعَدَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ

data.price: (11) Who is it that would loan Allāh a goodly loan so He will multiply it for him and he will have a noble reward?
data.arabic: مَّن ذَا ٱلَّذِي يُقۡرِضُ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا فَيُضَٰعِفَهُۥ لَهُۥ وَلَهُۥٓ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ

data.price: (12) On the Day you see the believing men and believing women, their light proceeding before them and on their right, [it will be said], "Your good tidings today are [of] gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide eternally." That is what is the great attainment.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرَى ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ يَسۡعَىٰ نُورُهُم بَيۡنَ أَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَبِأَيۡمَٰنِهِمۖ بُشۡرَىٰكُمُ ٱلۡيَوۡمَ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۚ ذَٰلِكَ هُوَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡعَظِيمُ

data.price: (13) On the [same] Day the hypocrite men and hypocrite women will say to those who believed, "Wait for us that we may acquire some of your light." It will be said, "Go back behind you[1630] and seek light." And a wall will be placed between them with a door, its interior containing mercy, but on the outside of it is torment.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُولُ ٱلۡمُنَٰفِقُونَ وَٱلۡمُنَٰفِقَٰتُ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱنظُرُونَا نَقۡتَبِسۡ مِن نُّورِكُمۡ قِيلَ ٱرۡجِعُواْ وَرَآءَكُمۡ فَٱلۡتَمِسُواْ نُورٗاۖ فَضُرِبَ بَيۡنَهُم بِسُورٖ لَّهُۥ بَابُۢ بَاطِنُهُۥ فِيهِ ٱلرَّحۡمَةُ وَظَٰهِرُهُۥ مِن قِبَلِهِ ٱلۡعَذَابُ
data.footnotes: [1630]- To where light was acquired, i.e., in the worldly life.

data.price: (14) They [i.e., the hypocrites] will call to them [i.e., the believers], "Were we not with you?" They will say, "Yes, but you afflicted yourselves[1631] and awaited [misfortune for us] and doubted, and wishful thinking deluded you until there came the command of Allāh. And the Deceiver [i.e., Satan] deceived you concerning Allāh.
data.arabic: يُنَادُونَهُمۡ أَلَمۡ نَكُن مَّعَكُمۡۖ قَالُواْ بَلَىٰ وَلَٰكِنَّكُمۡ فَتَنتُمۡ أَنفُسَكُمۡ وَتَرَبَّصۡتُمۡ وَٱرۡتَبۡتُمۡ وَغَرَّتۡكُمُ ٱلۡأَمَانِيُّ حَتَّىٰ جَآءَ أَمۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَغَرَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡغَرُورُ
data.footnotes: [1631]- By hypocrisy or by falling into temptations.

data.price: (15) So today no ransom will be taken from you or from those who disbelieved. Your refuge is the Fire. It is most worthy of you, and wretched is the destination."
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ لَا يُؤۡخَذُ مِنكُمۡ فِدۡيَةٞ وَلَا مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْۚ مَأۡوَىٰكُمُ ٱلنَّارُۖ هِيَ مَوۡلَىٰكُمۡۖ وَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ

data.price: (16) Has the time not come for those who have believed that their hearts should become humbly submissive at the remembrance of Allāh and what has come down of the truth? And let them not be like those who were given the Scripture before, and a long period passed over them, so their hearts hardened; and many of them are defiantly disobedient.
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ يَأۡنِ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ أَن تَخۡشَعَ قُلُوبُهُمۡ لِذِكۡرِ ٱللَّهِ وَمَا نَزَلَ مِنَ ٱلۡحَقِّ وَلَا يَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ مِن قَبۡلُ فَطَالَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡأَمَدُ فَقَسَتۡ قُلُوبُهُمۡۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: (17) Know that Allāh gives life to the earth after its lifelessness. We have made clear to you the signs; perhaps you will understand.[1632]
data.arabic: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُحۡيِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ مَوۡتِهَاۚ قَدۡ بَيَّنَّا لَكُمُ ٱلۡأٓيَٰتِ لَعَلَّكُمۡ تَعۡقِلُونَ
data.footnotes: [1632]- That similarly, Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) can soften a heart after its hardness and guide one who had previously been astray.

data.price: (18) Indeed, the men who practice charity and the women who practice charity and [they who] have loaned Allāh a goodly loan - it will be multiplied for them, and they will have a noble reward.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُصَّدِّقِينَ وَٱلۡمُصَّدِّقَٰتِ وَأَقۡرَضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗا يُضَٰعَفُ لَهُمۡ وَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٞ كَرِيمٞ

data.price: (19) And those who have believed in Allāh and His messengers - those are [in the ranks of] the supporters of truth and the martyrs, with their Lord. For them is their reward and their light.[1633] But those who have disbelieved and denied Our verses - those are the companions of Hellfire.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦٓ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصِّدِّيقُونَۖ وَٱلشُّهَدَآءُ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرُهُمۡ وَنُورُهُمۡۖ وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَآ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1633]- Another accepted meaning is "And those who have believed in Allāh and His messengers - they are the supporters of truth.  And the martyrs, with their Lord, will have their reward and their light."

data.price: (20) Know that the life of this world is but amusement and diversion and adornment and boasting to one another and competition in increase of wealth and children - like the example of a rain whose [resulting] plant growth pleases the tillers; then it dries and you see it turned yellow; then it becomes [scattered] debris. And in the Hereafter is severe punishment and forgiveness from Allāh and approval. And what is the worldly life except the enjoyment of delusion.
data.arabic: ٱعۡلَمُوٓاْ أَنَّمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَا لَعِبٞ وَلَهۡوٞ وَزِينَةٞ وَتَفَاخُرُۢ بَيۡنَكُمۡ وَتَكَاثُرٞ فِي ٱلۡأَمۡوَٰلِ وَٱلۡأَوۡلَٰدِۖ كَمَثَلِ غَيۡثٍ أَعۡجَبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارَ نَبَاتُهُۥ ثُمَّ يَهِيجُ فَتَرَىٰهُ مُصۡفَرّٗا ثُمَّ يَكُونُ حُطَٰمٗاۖ وَفِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ عَذَابٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَغۡفِرَةٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضۡوَٰنٞۚ وَمَا ٱلۡحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنۡيَآ إِلَّا مَتَٰعُ ٱلۡغُرُورِ

data.price: (21) Race [i.e., compete] toward forgiveness from your Lord and a Garden whose width is like the width of the heavens and earth, prepared for those who believed in Allāh and His messengers. That is the bounty of Allāh which He gives to whom He wills, and Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.
data.arabic: سَابِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَغۡفِرَةٖ مِّن رَّبِّكُمۡ وَجَنَّةٍ عَرۡضُهَا كَعَرۡضِ ٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ أُعِدَّتۡ لِلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرُسُلِهِۦۚ ذَٰلِكَ فَضۡلُ ٱللَّهِ يُؤۡتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلۡفَضۡلِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ

data.price: (22) No disaster strikes upon the earth or among yourselves except that it is in a register[1634] before We bring it into being - indeed that, for Allāh, is easy -
data.arabic: مَآ أَصَابَ مِن مُّصِيبَةٖ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَا فِيٓ أَنفُسِكُمۡ إِلَّا فِي كِتَٰبٖ مِّن قَبۡلِ أَن نَّبۡرَأَهَآۚ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ يَسِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [1634]- i.e., the Preserved Slate (al-Lawḥ al-Maḥfūẓ).

data.price: (23) In order that you not despair over what has eluded you and not exult [in pride] over what He has given you. And Allāh does not like everyone self-deluded and boastful -
data.arabic: لِّكَيۡلَا تَأۡسَوۡاْ عَلَىٰ مَا فَاتَكُمۡ وَلَا تَفۡرَحُواْ بِمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمۡۗ وَٱللَّهُ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخۡتَالٖ فَخُورٍ

data.price: (24) [Those] who are stingy and enjoin upon people stinginess. And whoever turns away[1635] - then indeed, Allāh is the Free of need, the Praiseworthy.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يَبۡخَلُونَ وَيَأۡمُرُونَ ٱلنَّاسَ بِٱلۡبُخۡلِۗ وَمَن يَتَوَلَّ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلۡغَنِيُّ ٱلۡحَمِيدُ
data.footnotes: [1635]- Refusing to spend for Allāh's cause or refusing obedience to Him.

data.price: (25) We have already sent Our messengers with clear evidences and sent down with them the Scripture and the balance that the people may maintain [their affairs] in justice. And We sent down iron, wherein is great military might and benefits for the people, and so that Allāh may make evident those who support Him and His messengers unseen. Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا رُسُلَنَا بِٱلۡبَيِّنَٰتِ وَأَنزَلۡنَا مَعَهُمُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمِيزَانَ لِيَقُومَ ٱلنَّاسُ بِٱلۡقِسۡطِۖ وَأَنزَلۡنَا ٱلۡحَدِيدَ فِيهِ بَأۡسٞ شَدِيدٞ وَمَنَٰفِعُ لِلنَّاسِ وَلِيَعۡلَمَ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَنصُرُهُۥ وَرُسُلَهُۥ بِٱلۡغَيۡبِۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٞ

data.price: (26) And We have already sent Noah and Abraham and placed in their descendants prophethood and scripture; and among them is he who is guided, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ أَرۡسَلۡنَا نُوحٗا وَإِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي ذُرِّيَّتِهِمَا ٱلنُّبُوَّةَ وَٱلۡكِتَٰبَۖ فَمِنۡهُم مُّهۡتَدٖۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: (27) Then We sent following their footsteps [i.e., traditions] Our messengers and followed [them] with Jesus, the son of Mary, and gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy and monasticism, which they innovated; We did not prescribe it for them except [that they did so] seeking the approval of Allāh. But they did not observe it with due observance. So We gave the ones who believed among them their reward, but many of them are defiantly disobedient.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ قَفَّيۡنَا عَلَىٰٓ ءَاثَٰرِهِم بِرُسُلِنَا وَقَفَّيۡنَا بِعِيسَى ٱبۡنِ مَرۡيَمَ وَءَاتَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلۡإِنجِيلَۖ وَجَعَلۡنَا فِي قُلُوبِ ٱلَّذِينَ ٱتَّبَعُوهُ رَأۡفَةٗ وَرَحۡمَةٗۚ وَرَهۡبَانِيَّةً ٱبۡتَدَعُوهَا مَا كَتَبۡنَٰهَا عَلَيۡهِمۡ إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ رِضۡوَٰنِ ٱللَّهِ فَمَا رَعَوۡهَا حَقَّ رِعَايَتِهَاۖ فَـَٔاتَيۡنَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ أَجۡرَهُمۡۖ وَكَثِيرٞ مِّنۡهُمۡ فَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: (28) O you who have believed, fear Allāh and believe in His Messenger; He will [then] give you a double portion of His mercy and make for you a light by which you will walk and forgive you; and Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَءَامِنُواْ بِرَسُولِهِۦ يُؤۡتِكُمۡ كِفۡلَيۡنِ مِن رَّحۡمَتِهِۦ وَيَجۡعَل لَّكُمۡ نُورٗا تَمۡشُونَ بِهِۦ وَيَغۡفِرۡ لَكُمۡۚ وَٱللَّهُ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٞ

data.price: (29) [This is] so that the People of the Scripture may know that they are not able [to obtain] anything from the bounty of Allāh[1636] and that [all] bounty is in the hand[1637] of Allāh; He gives it to whom He wills. And Allāh is the possessor of great bounty.
data.arabic: لِّئَلَّا يَعۡلَمَ أَهۡلُ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ أَلَّا يَقۡدِرُونَ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٖ مِّن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَأَنَّ ٱلۡفَضۡلَ بِيَدِ ٱللَّهِ يُؤۡتِيهِ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ ذُو ٱلۡفَضۡلِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes:
[1636]- As long as they refuse to believe in the message of Allāh which was conveyed through Muḥammad (ﷺ).
[1637]- See footnote to 2:19.

data.price: (1) Certainly has Allāh heard the speech of the one who argues [i.e., pleads] with you, [O Muḥammad], concerning her husband and directs her complaint to Allāh. And Allāh hears your dialogue; indeed, Allāh is Hearing and Seeing.
data.arabic: قَدۡ سَمِعَ ٱللَّهُ قَوۡلَ ٱلَّتِي تُجَٰدِلُكَ فِي زَوۡجِهَا وَتَشۡتَكِيٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَٱللَّهُ يَسۡمَعُ تَحَاوُرَكُمَآۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعُۢ بَصِيرٌ

data.price: (2) Those who pronounce ẓihār[1639] among you [to separate] from their wives - they are not [consequently] their mothers. Their mothers are none but those who gave birth to them. And indeed, they are saying an objectionable statement and a falsehood. But indeed, Allāh is Pardoning and Forgiving.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِنكُم مِّن نِّسَآئِهِم مَّا هُنَّ أُمَّهَٰتِهِمۡۖ إِنۡ أُمَّهَٰتُهُمۡ إِلَّا ٱلَّٰٓـِٔي وَلَدۡنَهُمۡۚ وَإِنَّهُمۡ لَيَقُولُونَ مُنكَرٗا مِّنَ ٱلۡقَوۡلِ وَزُورٗاۚ وَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَعَفُوٌّ غَفُورٞ
data.footnotes: [1639]- The saying by a husband to his wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother," meaning unlawful to approach.  This was a type of divorce practiced by the Arabs before the prophethood of Muḥammad (ﷺ).

data.price: (3) And those who pronounce ẓihār from their wives and then [wish to] go back on what they said - then [there must be] the freeing of a slave before they touch one another. That is what you are admonished thereby; and Allāh is Aware of what you do.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ يُظَٰهِرُونَ مِن نِّسَآئِهِمۡ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا قَالُواْ فَتَحۡرِيرُ رَقَبَةٖ مِّن قَبۡلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّاۚ ذَٰلِكُمۡ تُوعَظُونَ بِهِۦۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ

data.price: (4) And he who does not find [a slave] - then a fast for two months consecutively[1640] before they touch one another; and he who is unable - then the feeding of sixty poor persons. That is for you to believe [completely] in Allāh and His Messenger; and those are the limits [set by] Allāh. And for the disbelievers is a painful punishment.
data.arabic: فَمَن لَّمۡ يَجِدۡ فَصِيَامُ شَهۡرَيۡنِ مُتَتَابِعَيۡنِ مِن قَبۡلِ أَن يَتَمَآسَّاۖ فَمَن لَّمۡ يَسۡتَطِعۡ فَإِطۡعَامُ سِتِّينَ مِسۡكِينٗاۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِتُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ وَرَسُولِهِۦۚ وَتِلۡكَ حُدُودُ ٱللَّهِۗ وَلِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٌ
data.footnotes: [1640]- See footnote to 4:92.

data.price: (5) Indeed, those who oppose Allāh and His Messenger are abased as those before them were abased. And We have certainly sent down verses of clear evidence. And for the disbelievers is a humiliating punishment
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُحَآدُّونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ كُبِتُواْ كَمَا كُبِتَ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡۚ وَقَدۡ أَنزَلۡنَآ ءَايَٰتِۭ بَيِّنَٰتٖۚ وَلِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ عَذَابٞ مُّهِينٞ

data.price: (6) On the Day when Allāh will resurrect them all and inform them of what they did. Allāh had enumerated it, while they forgot it; and Allāh is, over all things, Witness.[1641]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَبۡعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعٗا فَيُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوٓاْۚ أَحۡصَىٰهُ ٱللَّهُ وَنَسُوهُۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٌ
data.footnotes: [1641]- See footnote to 4:79.

data.price: (7) Have you not considered that Allāh knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth? There are not three in a private conversation but that He is the fourth of them,[1642] nor are there five but that He is the sixth of them - and no less than that and no more except that He is with them [in knowledge] wherever they are. Then He will inform them of what they did on the Day of Resurrection. Indeed Allāh is, of all things, Knowing.
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَعۡلَمُ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ مَا يَكُونُ مِن نَّجۡوَىٰ ثَلَٰثَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ رَابِعُهُمۡ وَلَا خَمۡسَةٍ إِلَّا هُوَ سَادِسُهُمۡ وَلَآ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ذَٰلِكَ وَلَآ أَكۡثَرَ إِلَّا هُوَ مَعَهُمۡ أَيۡنَ مَا كَانُواْۖ ثُمَّ يُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُواْ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِكُلِّ شَيۡءٍ عَلِيمٌ
data.footnotes: [1642]- Through His knowledge of them and their secrets.

data.price: (8) Have you not considered those who were forbidden from private conversation [i.e., ridicule and conspiracy] and then return to that which they were forbidden and converse among themselves about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger? And when they come to you, they greet you with that [word] by which Allāh does not greet you[1643] and say among themselves, "Why does Allāh not punish us for what we say?" Sufficient for them is Hell, which they will [enter to] burn, and wretched is the destination.
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نُهُواْ عَنِ ٱلنَّجۡوَىٰ ثُمَّ يَعُودُونَ لِمَا نُهُواْ عَنۡهُ وَيَتَنَٰجَوۡنَ بِٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡعُدۡوَٰنِ وَمَعۡصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِۖ وَإِذَا جَآءُوكَ حَيَّوۡكَ بِمَا لَمۡ يُحَيِّكَ بِهِ ٱللَّهُ وَيَقُولُونَ فِيٓ أَنفُسِهِمۡ لَوۡلَا يُعَذِّبُنَا ٱللَّهُ بِمَا نَقُولُۚ حَسۡبُهُمۡ جَهَنَّمُ يَصۡلَوۡنَهَاۖ فَبِئۡسَ ٱلۡمَصِيرُ
data.footnotes: [1643]- This is in reference to the Jews who would greet the Muslims with the words "Death be upon you," rather than "Peace."

data.price: (9) O you who have believed, when you converse privately, do not converse about sin and aggression and disobedience to the Messenger but converse about righteousness and piety. And fear Allāh, to whom you will be gathered.
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِذَا تَنَٰجَيۡتُمۡ فَلَا تَتَنَٰجَوۡاْ بِٱلۡإِثۡمِ وَٱلۡعُدۡوَٰنِ وَمَعۡصِيَتِ ٱلرَّسُولِ وَتَنَٰجَوۡاْ بِٱلۡبِرِّ وَٱلتَّقۡوَىٰۖ وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ ٱلَّذِيٓ إِلَيۡهِ تُحۡشَرُونَ

data.price: (10) Private conversation is only from Satan that he may grieve those who have believed,[1644] but he will not harm them at all except by permission of Allāh. And upon Allāh let the believers rely.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا ٱلنَّجۡوَىٰ مِنَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنِ لِيَحۡزُنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَلَيۡسَ بِضَآرِّهِمۡ شَيۡـًٔا إِلَّا بِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِۚ وَعَلَى ٱللَّهِ فَلۡيَتَوَكَّلِ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ
data.footnotes: [1644]- The reference may be to the sinful type of conversation, as mentioned in the previous verses, or to the practice of two persons speaking in confidence in the presence of a third, which might lead him to assume that he is the subject of their conversation.  Such behavior was prohibited by the Prophet (ﷺ) in narrations of al-Bukhārī and Muslim.

data.price: (11) O you who have believed, when you are told, "Space yourselves" in assemblies, then make space; Allāh will make space for you.[1645] And when you are told, "Arise,"[1646] then arise; Allāh will raise those who have believed among you and those who were given knowledge, by degrees. And Allāh is Aware of what you do.
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِذَا قِيلَ لَكُمۡ تَفَسَّحُواْ فِي ٱلۡمَجَٰلِسِ فَٱفۡسَحُواْ يَفۡسَحِ ٱللَّهُ لَكُمۡۖ وَإِذَا قِيلَ ٱنشُزُواْ فَٱنشُزُواْ يَرۡفَعِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنكُمۡ وَٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡعِلۡمَ دَرَجَٰتٖۚ وَٱللَّهُ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ خَبِيرٞ
data.footnotes:
[1645]- In His mercy, in Paradise, or in everything good.
[1646]- To prayer, to battle, or to good deeds.

data.price: (12) O you who have believed, when you [wish to] privately consult the Messenger, present before your consultation a charity. That is better for you and purer. But if you find not [the means] - then indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِذَا نَٰجَيۡتُمُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَقَدِّمُواْ بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡ نَجۡوَىٰكُمۡ صَدَقَةٗۚ ذَٰلِكَ خَيۡرٞ لَّكُمۡ وَأَطۡهَرُۚ فَإِن لَّمۡ تَجِدُواْ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمٌ

data.price: (13) Have you feared to present before your consultation charities? Then when you do not and Allāh has forgiven you, then [at least] establish prayer and give zakāh and obey Allāh and His Messenger. And Allāh is Aware of what you do.
data.arabic: ءَأَشۡفَقۡتُمۡ أَن تُقَدِّمُواْ بَيۡنَ يَدَيۡ نَجۡوَىٰكُمۡ صَدَقَٰتٖۚ فَإِذۡ لَمۡ تَفۡعَلُواْ وَتَابَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡكُمۡ فَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَطِيعُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥۚ وَٱللَّهُ خَبِيرُۢ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (14) Have you not considered those who make allies of a people with whom Allāh has become angry? They are neither of you nor of them, and they swear to untruth while they know [they are lying].
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ تَوَلَّوۡاْ قَوۡمًا غَضِبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡهِم مَّا هُم مِّنكُمۡ وَلَا مِنۡهُمۡ وَيَحۡلِفُونَ عَلَى ٱلۡكَذِبِ وَهُمۡ يَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (15) Allāh has prepared for them a severe punishment. Indeed, it was evil that they were doing.
data.arabic: أَعَدَّ ٱللَّهُ لَهُمۡ عَذَابٗا شَدِيدًاۖ إِنَّهُمۡ سَآءَ مَا كَانُواْ يَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (16) They took their [false] oaths as a cover, so they averted [people] from the way of Allāh, and for them is a humiliating punishment.
data.arabic: ٱتَّخَذُوٓاْ أَيۡمَٰنَهُمۡ جُنَّةٗ فَصَدُّواْ عَن سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٞ مُّهِينٞ

data.price: (17) Never will their wealth or their children avail them against Allāh at all. Those are the companions of the Fire; they will abide therein eternally
data.arabic: لَّن تُغۡنِيَ عَنۡهُمۡ أَمۡوَٰلُهُمۡ وَلَآ أَوۡلَٰدُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ شَيۡـًٔاۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِۖ هُمۡ فِيهَا خَٰلِدُونَ

data.price: (18) On the Day Allāh will resurrect them all, and they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think that they are [standing] on something.[1647] Unquestionably, it is they who are the liars.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَبۡعَثُهُمُ ٱللَّهُ جَمِيعٗا فَيَحۡلِفُونَ لَهُۥ كَمَا يَحۡلِفُونَ لَكُمۡ وَيَحۡسَبُونَ أَنَّهُمۡ عَلَىٰ شَيۡءٍۚ أَلَآ إِنَّهُمۡ هُمُ ٱلۡكَٰذِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1647]- They assume that their lies will be believed and that they will escape detection as they did in worldly life.

data.price: (19) Satan has overcome them and made them forget the remembrance of Allāh. Those are the party of Satan. Unquestionably, the party of Satan - they will be the losers.
data.arabic: ٱسۡتَحۡوَذَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنُ فَأَنسَىٰهُمۡ ذِكۡرَ ٱللَّهِۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ حِزۡبُ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنِۚ أَلَآ إِنَّ حِزۡبَ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنِ هُمُ ٱلۡخَٰسِرُونَ

data.price: (20) Indeed, the ones who oppose Allāh and His Messenger - those will be among the most humbled.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ يُحَآدُّونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ فِي ٱلۡأَذَلِّينَ

data.price: (21) Allāh has written [i.e., decreed], "I will surely overcome, I and My messengers." Indeed, Allāh is Powerful and Exalted in Might.
data.arabic: كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ لَأَغۡلِبَنَّ أَنَا۠ وَرُسُلِيٓۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ قَوِيٌّ عَزِيزٞ

data.price: (22) You will not find a people who believe in Allāh and the Last Day having affection for those who oppose Allāh and His Messenger, even if they were their fathers or their sons or their brothers or their kindred. Those - He has decreed within their hearts faith and supported them with spirit[1648] from Him. And We will admit them to gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they abide eternally. Allāh is pleased with them, and they are pleased with Him - those are the party of Allāh. Unquestionably, the party of Allāh - they are the successful.
data.arabic: لَّا تَجِدُ قَوۡمٗا يُؤۡمِنُونَ بِٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡأٓخِرِ يُوَآدُّونَ مَنۡ حَآدَّ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ وَلَوۡ كَانُوٓاْ ءَابَآءَهُمۡ أَوۡ أَبۡنَآءَهُمۡ أَوۡ إِخۡوَٰنَهُمۡ أَوۡ عَشِيرَتَهُمۡۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ كَتَبَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلۡإِيمَٰنَ وَأَيَّدَهُم بِرُوحٖ مِّنۡهُۖ وَيُدۡخِلُهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَاۚ رَضِيَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُواْ عَنۡهُۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ حِزۡبُ ٱللَّهِۚ أَلَآ إِنَّ حِزۡبَ ٱللَّهِ هُمُ ٱلۡمُفۡلِحُونَ
data.footnotes: [1648]- i.e., "that which gives life," explained as the guidance of the Qur’ān or victory over their opponents.

data.price: (1) Whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth exalts Allāh,[1650] and He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.
data.arabic: سَبَّحَ لِلَّهِ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
data.footnotes: [1650]- See footnote to 57:1.

data.price: (2) It is He who expelled the ones who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture[1651] from their homes at the first gathering.[1652] You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allāh; but [the decree of] Allāh came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱلَّذِيٓ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمۡ لِأَوَّلِ ٱلۡحَشۡرِۚ مَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن يَخۡرُجُواْۖ وَظَنُّوٓاْ أَنَّهُم مَّانِعَتُهُمۡ حُصُونُهُم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ فَأَتَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ مِنۡ حَيۡثُ لَمۡ يَحۡتَسِبُواْۖ وَقَذَفَ فِي قُلُوبِهِمُ ٱلرُّعۡبَۚ يُخۡرِبُونَ بُيُوتَهُم بِأَيۡدِيهِمۡ وَأَيۡدِي ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ فَٱعۡتَبِرُواْ يَٰٓأُوْلِي ٱلۡأَبۡصَٰرِ
data.footnotes:
[1651]- Referring to the Jews of Banun-Naḍeer, who broke their pact with the Messenger of Allāh (ﷺ).
[1652]- This was the first tme they had ever been gathered and expelled.

data.price: (3) And if not that Allāh had decreed for them evacuation, He would have punished them in [this] world, and for them in the Hereafter is the punishment of the Fire.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡلَآ أَن كَتَبَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡجَلَآءَ لَعَذَّبَهُمۡ فِي ٱلدُّنۡيَاۖ وَلَهُمۡ فِي ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ عَذَابُ ٱلنَّارِ

data.price: (4) That is because they opposed Allāh and His Messenger. And whoever opposes Allāh - then indeed, Allāh is severe in penalty.
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ شَآقُّواْ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥۖ وَمَن يُشَآقِّ ٱللَّهَ فَإِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡعِقَابِ

data.price: (5) Whatever you have cut down of [their] palm trees or left standing on their trunks - it was by permission of Allāh and so He would disgrace the defiantly disobedient.
data.arabic: مَا قَطَعۡتُم مِّن لِّينَةٍ أَوۡ تَرَكۡتُمُوهَا قَآئِمَةً عَلَىٰٓ أُصُولِهَا فَبِإِذۡنِ ٱللَّهِ وَلِيُخۡزِيَ ٱلۡفَٰسِقِينَ

data.price: (6) And what Allāh restored [of property] to His Messenger from them - you did not spur for it [in an expedition] any horses or camels,[1653] but Allāh gives His messengers power over whom He wills, and Allāh is over all things competent.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنۡهُمۡ فَمَآ أَوۡجَفۡتُمۡ عَلَيۡهِ مِنۡ خَيۡلٖ وَلَا رِكَابٖ وَلَٰكِنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُسَلِّطُ رُسُلَهُۥ عَلَىٰ مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ قَدِيرٞ
data.footnotes: [1653]- Meaning that they went through no hardship (i.e., war) to obtain it.

data.price: (7) And what Allāh restored to His Messenger from the people of the towns - it is for Allāh and for the Messenger and for [his] near relatives[1654] and orphans and the needy and the [stranded] traveler[1655] - so that it will not be a perpetual distribution among the rich from among you. And whatever the Messenger has given you - take; and what he has forbidden you - refrain from. And fear Allāh; indeed, Allāh is severe in penalty.
data.arabic: مَّآ أَفَآءَ ٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ رَسُولِهِۦ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡقُرَىٰ فَلِلَّهِ وَلِلرَّسُولِ وَلِذِي ٱلۡقُرۡبَىٰ وَٱلۡيَتَٰمَىٰ وَٱلۡمَسَٰكِينِ وَٱبۡنِ ٱلسَّبِيلِ كَيۡ لَا يَكُونَ دُولَةَۢ بَيۡنَ ٱلۡأَغۡنِيَآءِ مِنكُمۡۚ وَمَآ ءَاتَىٰكُمُ ٱلرَّسُولُ فَخُذُوهُ وَمَا نَهَىٰكُمۡ عَنۡهُ فَٱنتَهُواْۚ وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ شَدِيدُ ٱلۡعِقَابِ
data.footnotes:
[1654]- Those of Banū Hāshim and Banū Muṭṭalib, whom he (ﷺ) had prohibited from accepting zakāh.
[1655]- This ruling concerning properties abandoned by an enemy without a war effort differs from that in Sūrah al-Anfāl, verse 41, which refers to spoils of war in which four fifths is distributed among those who fought in Allāh's cause.

data.price: (8) For the poor emigrants who were expelled from their homes and their properties, seeking bounty from Allāh and [His] approval and supporting [the cause of] Allāh and His Messenger, [there is also a share]. Those are the truthful.
data.arabic: لِلۡفُقَرَآءِ ٱلۡمُهَٰجِرِينَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُخۡرِجُواْ مِن دِيَٰرِهِمۡ وَأَمۡوَٰلِهِمۡ يَبۡتَغُونَ فَضۡلٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِضۡوَٰنٗا وَيَنصُرُونَ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥٓۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلصَّٰدِقُونَ

data.price: (9) And [also for] those who were settled in the Home [i.e.,al-Madīnah] and [adopted] the faith before them.[1656] They love those who emigrated to them and find not any want in their breasts of what they [i.e., the emigrants] were given but give [them] preference over themselves, even though they are in privation. And whoever is protected from the stinginess of his soul - it is those who will be the successful.
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ تَبَوَّءُو ٱلدَّارَ وَٱلۡإِيمَٰنَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ يُحِبُّونَ مَنۡ هَاجَرَ إِلَيۡهِمۡ وَلَا يَجِدُونَ فِي صُدُورِهِمۡ حَاجَةٗ مِّمَّآ أُوتُواْ وَيُؤۡثِرُونَ عَلَىٰٓ أَنفُسِهِمۡ وَلَوۡ كَانَ بِهِمۡ خَصَاصَةٞۚ وَمَن يُوقَ شُحَّ نَفۡسِهِۦ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡمُفۡلِحُونَ
data.footnotes: [1656]- Before the settlement of the emigrants (Muhājireen) among the Anṣār, for whom a share is delegated as well.

data.price: (10) And [there is a share for] those who come after them, saying, "Our Lord, forgive us and our brothers who preceded us in faith and put not in our hearts [any] resentment toward those who have believed. Our Lord, indeed You are Kind and Merciful."
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ جَآءُو مِنۢ بَعۡدِهِمۡ يَقُولُونَ رَبَّنَا ٱغۡفِرۡ لَنَا وَلِإِخۡوَٰنِنَا ٱلَّذِينَ سَبَقُونَا بِٱلۡإِيمَٰنِ وَلَا تَجۡعَلۡ فِي قُلُوبِنَا غِلّٗا لِّلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ رَبَّنَآ إِنَّكَ رَءُوفٞ رَّحِيمٌ

data.price: (11) Have you not considered those who practice hypocrisy, saying to their brothers [i.e., associates] who have disbelieved among the People of the Scripture, "If you are expelled, we will surely leave with you, and we will not obey, in regard to you, anyone - ever; and if you are fought, we will surely aid you." But Allāh testifies that they are liars.
data.arabic: ۞ أَلَمۡ تَرَ إِلَى ٱلَّذِينَ نَافَقُواْ يَقُولُونَ لِإِخۡوَٰنِهِمُ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ لَئِنۡ أُخۡرِجۡتُمۡ لَنَخۡرُجَنَّ مَعَكُمۡ وَلَا نُطِيعُ فِيكُمۡ أَحَدًا أَبَدٗا وَإِن قُوتِلۡتُمۡ لَنَنصُرَنَّكُمۡ وَٱللَّهُ يَشۡهَدُ إِنَّهُمۡ لَكَٰذِبُونَ

data.price: (12) If they are expelled, they will not leave with them, and if they are fought, they will not aid them. And [even] if they should aid them, they will surely turn their backs; then [thereafter] they will not be aided.
data.arabic: لَئِنۡ أُخۡرِجُواْ لَا يَخۡرُجُونَ مَعَهُمۡ وَلَئِن قُوتِلُواْ لَا يَنصُرُونَهُمۡ وَلَئِن نَّصَرُوهُمۡ لَيُوَلُّنَّ ٱلۡأَدۡبَٰرَ ثُمَّ لَا يُنصَرُونَ

data.price: (13) You [believers] are more fearful within their breasts than Allāh. That is because they are a people who do not understand.
data.arabic: لَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ رَهۡبَةٗ فِي صُدُورِهِم مِّنَ ٱللَّهِۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ قَوۡمٞ لَّا يَفۡقَهُونَ

data.price: (14) They will not fight you all except within fortified cities or from behind walls. Their violence [i.e., enmity] among themselves is severe. You think they are together, but their hearts are diverse. That is because they are a people who do not reason.
data.arabic: لَا يُقَٰتِلُونَكُمۡ جَمِيعًا إِلَّا فِي قُرٗى مُّحَصَّنَةٍ أَوۡ مِن وَرَآءِ جُدُرِۭۚ بَأۡسُهُم بَيۡنَهُمۡ شَدِيدٞۚ تَحۡسَبُهُمۡ جَمِيعٗا وَقُلُوبُهُمۡ شَتَّىٰۚ ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّهُمۡ قَوۡمٞ لَّا يَعۡقِلُونَ

data.price: (15) [Theirs is] like the example of those shortly before them: they tasted the bad consequence of their affair, and they will have a painful punishment.
data.arabic: كَمَثَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ مِن قَبۡلِهِمۡ قَرِيبٗاۖ ذَاقُواْ وَبَالَ أَمۡرِهِمۡ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابٌ أَلِيمٞ

data.price: (16) [The hypocrites are] like the example of Satan when he says to man, "Disbelieve." But when he disbelieves, he says, "Indeed, I am disassociated from you. Indeed, I fear Allāh, Lord of the worlds."
data.arabic: كَمَثَلِ ٱلشَّيۡطَٰنِ إِذۡ قَالَ لِلۡإِنسَٰنِ ٱكۡفُرۡ فَلَمَّا كَفَرَ قَالَ إِنِّي بَرِيٓءٞ مِّنكَ إِنِّيٓ أَخَافُ ٱللَّهَ رَبَّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (17) So the outcome for both of them is that they will be in the Fire, abiding eternally therein. And that is the recompense of the wrongdoers.
data.arabic: فَكَانَ عَٰقِبَتَهُمَآ أَنَّهُمَا فِي ٱلنَّارِ خَٰلِدَيۡنِ فِيهَاۚ وَذَٰلِكَ جَزَٰٓؤُاْ ٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ

data.price: (18) O you who have believed, fear Allāh. And let every soul look to what it has put forth for tomorrow - and fear Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Aware of what you do.
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ ٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَ وَلۡتَنظُرۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ لِغَدٖۖ وَٱتَّقُواْ ٱللَّهَۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ خَبِيرُۢ بِمَا تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (19) And be not like those who forgot Allāh, so He made them forget themselves. Those are the defiantly disobedient.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَكُونُواْ كَٱلَّذِينَ نَسُواْ ٱللَّهَ فَأَنسَىٰهُمۡ أَنفُسَهُمۡۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡفَٰسِقُونَ

data.price: (20) Not equal are the companions of the Fire and the companions of Paradise. The companions of Paradise - they are the attainers [of success].
data.arabic: لَا يَسۡتَوِيٓ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلنَّارِ وَأَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَنَّةِۚ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡجَنَّةِ هُمُ ٱلۡفَآئِزُونَ

data.price: (21) If We had sent down this Qur’ān upon a mountain, you would have seen it humbled and splitting from fear of Allāh. And these examples We present to the people that perhaps they will give thought.
data.arabic: لَوۡ أَنزَلۡنَا هَٰذَا ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ عَلَىٰ جَبَلٖ لَّرَأَيۡتَهُۥ خَٰشِعٗا مُّتَصَدِّعٗا مِّنۡ خَشۡيَةِ ٱللَّهِۚ وَتِلۡكَ ٱلۡأَمۡثَٰلُ نَضۡرِبُهَا لِلنَّاسِ لَعَلَّهُمۡ يَتَفَكَّرُونَ

data.price: (22) He is Allāh, other than whom there is no deity, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed.[1657] He is the Entirely Merciful, the Especially Merciful.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِي لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَۖ عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ وَٱلشَّهَٰدَةِۖ هُوَ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ ٱلرَّحِيمُ
data.footnotes: [1657]- See footnotes to 6:73.

data.price: (23) He is Allāh, other than whom there is no deity, the Sovereign,[1658] the Pure,[1659] the Perfection,[1660] the Grantor of Security,[1661] the Overseer,[1662] the Exalted in Might,[1663] the Compeller,[1664] the Superior.[1665] Exalted is Allāh above whatever they associate with Him.
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِي لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ ٱلۡمَلِكُ ٱلۡقُدُّوسُ ٱلسَّلَٰمُ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُ ٱلۡمُهَيۡمِنُ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡجَبَّارُ ٱلۡمُتَكَبِّرُۚ سُبۡحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ عَمَّا يُشۡرِكُونَ
data.footnotes:
[1658]- And owner of everything in existence.
[1659]- i.e., transcendent above any aspect belonging to His creation.  Also, the possessor and grantor of blessings.
[1660]- Literally, "Free" from any imperfection.  Also, "Peace" or "Soundness."
[1661]- And safety, i.e., reassurance that His promise is always fulfilled.  Also, He who bestows faith.
[1662]- i.e., who observes, guards and protects.  Also, "the Criterion."
[1663]- Refer to footnote in 2:129.
[1664]- Whose irresistible force is without limitation; the one above all things who compels the creation to be as He wills it.  Also, "the Amender" or "the Rectifier" who repairs, restores, completes or sets something right once again, out of His mercy.
[1665]- Supreme, complete and perfect in His essence, attributes and actions.

data.price: (24) He is Allāh, the Creator,[1666] the Producer,[1667] the Fashioner;[1668] to Him belong the best names.[1669] Whatever is in the heavens and earth is exalting Him. And He is the Exalted in Might, the Wise.[1670]
data.arabic: هُوَ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡخَٰلِقُ ٱلۡبَارِئُ ٱلۡمُصَوِّرُۖ لَهُ ٱلۡأَسۡمَآءُ ٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰۚ يُسَبِّحُ لَهُۥ مَا فِي ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۖ وَهُوَ ٱلۡعَزِيزُ ٱلۡحَكِيمُ
data.footnotes:
[1666]- i.e., He who destined existence for His creation.
[1667]- i.e., He who brings His creation into existence.
[1668]- i.e., He who gives every creation its particular form.
[1669]- Refer to the final paragraphs of the "Introduction" for a brief discussion of these attributes.
[1670]- Refer to footnote in 6:18.
