data.arabic: قُلۡ أُوحِيَ إِلَيَّ أَنَّهُ ٱسۡتَمَعَ نَفَرٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَقَالُوٓاْ إِنَّا سَمِعۡنَا قُرۡءَانًا عَجَبٗا

data.price: (2) It guides to the right course, and we have believed in it. And we will never associate with our Lord anyone.
data.arabic: يَهۡدِيٓ إِلَى ٱلرُّشۡدِ فَـَٔامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ وَلَن نُّشۡرِكَ بِرَبِّنَآ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (3) And [it teaches] that exalted is the nobleness of our Lord; He has not taken a wife or a son
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ تَعَٰلَىٰ جَدُّ رَبِّنَا مَا ٱتَّخَذَ صَٰحِبَةٗ وَلَا وَلَدٗا

data.price: (4) And that our foolish one [i.e., Iblees][1766] has been saying about Allāh an excessive transgression.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ يَقُولُ سَفِيهُنَا عَلَى ٱللَّهِ شَطَطٗا
data.footnotes: [1766]- A plural form may also be understood, i.e., "the foolish ones among us."

data.price: (5) And we had thought that mankind and the jinn would never speak about Allāh a lie.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن تَقُولَ ٱلۡإِنسُ وَٱلۡجِنُّ عَلَى ٱللَّهِ كَذِبٗا

data.price: (6) And there were men from mankind who sought refuge in men from the jinn, so they [only] increased them in burden [i.e., sin].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ كَانَ رِجَالٞ مِّنَ ٱلۡإِنسِ يَعُوذُونَ بِرِجَالٖ مِّنَ ٱلۡجِنِّ فَزَادُوهُمۡ رَهَقٗا

data.price: (7) And they had thought, as you thought, that Allāh would never send anyone [as a messenger].
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُمۡ ظَنُّواْ كَمَا ظَنَنتُمۡ أَن لَّن يَبۡعَثَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (8) And we have sought [to reach] the heaven but found it filled with powerful guards and burning flames.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَسۡنَا ٱلسَّمَآءَ فَوَجَدۡنَٰهَا مُلِئَتۡ حَرَسٗا شَدِيدٗا وَشُهُبٗا

data.price: (9) And we used to sit therein in positions for hearing,[1767] but whoever listens now will find a burning flame lying in wait for him.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا كُنَّا نَقۡعُدُ مِنۡهَا مَقَٰعِدَ لِلسَّمۡعِۖ فَمَن يَسۡتَمِعِ ٱلۡأٓنَ يَجِدۡ لَهُۥ شِهَابٗا رَّصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1767]- Before the prophethood of Muḥammad (ﷺ) the jinn used to collect information by eavesdropping on the angels and then pass it on to fortunetellers and soothsayers.

data.price: (10) And we do not know [therefore] whether evil is intended for those on earth or whether their Lord intends for them a right course.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَا نَدۡرِيٓ أَشَرٌّ أُرِيدَ بِمَن فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ أَمۡ أَرَادَ بِهِمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ رَشَدٗا

data.price: (11) And among us are the righteous, and among us are [others] not so; we were [of] divided ways.[1768]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلصَّٰلِحُونَ وَمِنَّا دُونَ ذَٰلِكَۖ كُنَّا طَرَآئِقَ قِدَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1768]- In opinion, belief and religious practice.

data.price: (12) And we have become certain that we will never cause failure to Allāh upon earth, nor can we escape Him by flight.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا ظَنَنَّآ أَن لَّن نُّعۡجِزَ ٱللَّهَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَلَن نُّعۡجِزَهُۥ هَرَبٗا

data.price: (13) And when we heard the guidance [i.e., the Qur’ān], we believed in it. And whoever believes in his Lord will not fear deprivation or burden.[1769]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا لَمَّا سَمِعۡنَا ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ ءَامَنَّا بِهِۦۖ فَمَن يُؤۡمِنۢ بِرَبِّهِۦ فَلَا يَخَافُ بَخۡسٗا وَلَا رَهَقٗا
data.footnotes: [1769]- In regard to his account in the Hereafter.  Nothing of his good will be diminished, nor will the evil of another be placed upon him.

data.price: (14) And among us are Muslims [in submission to Allāh], and among us are the unjust.[1770] And whoever has become Muslim - those have sought out the right course.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّا مِنَّا ٱلۡمُسۡلِمُونَ وَمِنَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَۖ فَمَنۡ أَسۡلَمَ فَأُوْلَٰٓئِكَ تَحَرَّوۡاْ رَشَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1770]- i.e., those who deviate from the truth and act tyrannically.

data.price: (15) But as for the unjust, they will be, for Hell, firewood.'
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلۡقَٰسِطُونَ فَكَانُواْ لِجَهَنَّمَ حَطَبٗا

data.price: (16) And [Allāh revealed] that if they had remained straight on the way, We would have given them abundant rain [i.e., provision]
data.arabic: وَأَلَّوِ ٱسۡتَقَٰمُواْ عَلَى ٱلطَّرِيقَةِ لَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰهُم مَّآءً غَدَقٗا

data.price: (17) So We might test them therein. And whoever turns away from the remembrance of his Lord[1771] He will put into arduous punishment.
data.arabic: لِّنَفۡتِنَهُمۡ فِيهِۚ وَمَن يُعۡرِضۡ عَن ذِكۡرِ رَبِّهِۦ يَسۡلُكۡهُ عَذَابٗا صَعَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1771]- i.e., refuses obedience to Him.

data.price: (18) And [He revealed] that the masjids[1772] are for Allāh, so do not invoke[1773] with Allāh anyone.
data.arabic: وَأَنَّ ٱلۡمَسَٰجِدَ لِلَّهِ فَلَا تَدۡعُواْ مَعَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٗا
data.footnotes:
[1772]- The term "masjid" here includes every place of worship or the earth in general.
[1773]- Or "worship."

data.price: (19) And that when the Servant [i.e., Prophet] of Allāh stood up supplicating Him, they almost became about him a compacted mass."[1774]
data.arabic: وَأَنَّهُۥ لَمَّا قَامَ عَبۡدُ ٱللَّهِ يَدۡعُوهُ كَادُواْ يَكُونُونَ عَلَيۡهِ لِبَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1774]- Crowding on top of each other in the manner of locusts in order to hear him (ﷺ).  "They" may refer to the jinn or to the disbelievers among the Arabs.

data.price: (20) Say, [O Muḥammad], "I only invoke my Lord and do not associate with Him anyone."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنَّمَآ أَدۡعُواْ رَبِّي وَلَآ أُشۡرِكُ بِهِۦٓ أَحَدٗا

data.price: (21) Say, "Indeed, I do not possess for you [the power of] harm or right direction."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَآ أَمۡلِكُ لَكُمۡ ضَرّٗا وَلَا رَشَدٗا

data.price: (22) Say, "Indeed, there will never protect me from Allāh anyone [if I should disobey], nor will I find in other than Him a refuge.
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنِّي لَن يُجِيرَنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهِ أَحَدٞ وَلَنۡ أَجِدَ مِن دُونِهِۦ مُلۡتَحَدًا

data.price: (23) But [I have for you] only notification from Allāh, and His messages." And whoever disobeys Allāh and His Messenger - then indeed, for him is the fire of Hell; they will abide therein forever.
data.arabic: إِلَّا بَلَٰغٗا مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ وَرِسَٰلَٰتِهِۦۚ وَمَن يَعۡصِ ٱللَّهَ وَرَسُولَهُۥ فَإِنَّ لَهُۥ نَارَ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدًا

data.price: (24) [The disbelievers continue] until, when they see that which they are promised, then they will know who is weaker in helpers and less in number.
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ إِذَا رَأَوۡاْ مَا يُوعَدُونَ فَسَيَعۡلَمُونَ مَنۡ أَضۡعَفُ نَاصِرٗا وَأَقَلُّ عَدَدٗا

data.price: (25) Say, "I do not know if what you are promised is near or if my Lord will grant for it a [long] period."
data.arabic: قُلۡ إِنۡ أَدۡرِيٓ أَقَرِيبٞ مَّا تُوعَدُونَ أَمۡ يَجۡعَلُ لَهُۥ رَبِّيٓ أَمَدًا

data.price: (26) [He is] Knower of the unseen, and He does not disclose His [knowledge of the] unseen to anyone
data.arabic: عَٰلِمُ ٱلۡغَيۡبِ فَلَا يُظۡهِرُ عَلَىٰ غَيۡبِهِۦٓ أَحَدًا

data.price: (27) Except whom He has approved of messengers, and indeed, He sends before him [i.e., each messenger] and behind him observers[1775]
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَنِ ٱرۡتَضَىٰ مِن رَّسُولٖ فَإِنَّهُۥ يَسۡلُكُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ يَدَيۡهِ وَمِنۡ خَلۡفِهِۦ رَصَدٗا
data.footnotes: [1775]- Guardian angels to protect the messenger and the message.

data.price: (28) That he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] may know[1776] that they have conveyed the messages of their Lord; and He has encompassed whatever is with them and has enumerated all things in number.
data.arabic: لِّيَعۡلَمَ أَن قَدۡ أَبۡلَغُواْ رِسَٰلَٰتِ رَبِّهِمۡ وَأَحَاطَ بِمَا لَدَيۡهِمۡ وَأَحۡصَىٰ كُلَّ شَيۡءٍ عَدَدَۢا
data.footnotes: [1776]- This phrase may also be read:  "So He [i.e., Allāh] may make evident."

data.price: (1) O you who wraps himself [in clothing],[1778]
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُزَّمِّلُ
data.footnotes: [1778]- Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) addresses the Prophet (ﷺ), who was asleep, wrapped in his garments.

data.price: (2) Arise [to pray] the night, except for a little -
data.arabic: قُمِ ٱلَّيۡلَ إِلَّا قَلِيلٗا

data.price: (3) Half of it - or subtract from it a little
data.arabic: نِّصۡفَهُۥٓ أَوِ ٱنقُصۡ مِنۡهُ قَلِيلًا

data.price: (4) Or add to it, and recite the Qur’ān with measured recitation.
data.arabic: أَوۡ زِدۡ عَلَيۡهِ وَرَتِّلِ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَرۡتِيلًا

data.price: (5) Indeed, We will cast upon you a heavy word.[1779]
data.arabic: إِنَّا سَنُلۡقِي عَلَيۡكَ قَوۡلٗا ثَقِيلًا
data.footnotes: [1779]- i.e., the revelation, which when descending on the Prophet (ﷺ) bore down upon him with a great weight.  Another meaning is "important ordinances."

data.price: (6) Indeed, the hours of the night are more effective for concurrence [of heart and tongue][1780] and more suitable for words.[1781]
data.arabic: إِنَّ نَاشِئَةَ ٱلَّيۡلِ هِيَ أَشَدُّ وَطۡـٔٗا وَأَقۡوَمُ قِيلًا
data.footnotes:
[1780]- Another accepted interpretation of the same words is "Indeed, arising at night is more difficult...," meaning that it will only be done by sincere believers and not others.
[1781]- i.e., for recitation of the Qur’ān and for hearing and understanding it.

data.price: (7) Indeed, for you by day is prolonged occupation.
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَكَ فِي ٱلنَّهَارِ سَبۡحٗا طَوِيلٗا

data.price: (8) And remember the name of your Lord and devote yourself to Him with [complete] devotion.
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ وَتَبَتَّلۡ إِلَيۡهِ تَبۡتِيلٗا

data.price: (9) [He is] the Lord of the East and the West; there is no deity except Him, so take Him as Disposer of [your] affairs.[1782]
data.arabic: رَّبُّ ٱلۡمَشۡرِقِ وَٱلۡمَغۡرِبِ لَآ إِلَٰهَ إِلَّا هُوَ فَٱتَّخِذۡهُ وَكِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [1782]- i.e., trust in Allāh and rely upon Him.

data.price: (10) And be patient over what they say and avoid them with gracious avoidance.
data.arabic: وَٱصۡبِرۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَقُولُونَ وَٱهۡجُرۡهُمۡ هَجۡرٗا جَمِيلٗا

data.price: (11) And leave Me with [the matter of] the deniers, those of ease [in life], and allow them respite a little.
data.arabic: وَذَرۡنِي وَٱلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ أُوْلِي ٱلنَّعۡمَةِ وَمَهِّلۡهُمۡ قَلِيلًا

data.price: (12) Indeed, with Us [for them] are shackles and burning fire
data.arabic: إِنَّ لَدَيۡنَآ أَنكَالٗا وَجَحِيمٗا

data.price: (13) And food that chokes and a painful punishment -
data.arabic: وَطَعَامٗا ذَا غُصَّةٖ وَعَذَابًا أَلِيمٗا

data.price: (14) On the Day the earth and the mountains will convulse and the mountains will become a heap of sand pouring down.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ وَٱلۡجِبَالُ وَكَانَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَثِيبٗا مَّهِيلًا

data.price: (15) Indeed, We have sent to you a Messenger as a witness upon you just as We sent to Pharaoh a messenger.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَيۡكُمۡ رَسُولٗا شَٰهِدًا عَلَيۡكُمۡ كَمَآ أَرۡسَلۡنَآ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ رَسُولٗا

data.price: (16) But Pharaoh disobeyed the messenger, so We seized him with a ruinous seizure.
data.arabic: فَعَصَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنُ ٱلرَّسُولَ فَأَخَذۡنَٰهُ أَخۡذٗا وَبِيلٗا

data.price: (17) Then how can you fear, if you disbelieve, a Day that will make the children white-haired?[1783]
data.arabic: فَكَيۡفَ تَتَّقُونَ إِن كَفَرۡتُمۡ يَوۡمٗا يَجۡعَلُ ٱلۡوِلۡدَٰنَ شِيبًا
data.footnotes: [1783]- Another meaning is "How can you avoid [punishment]" on such a Day?

data.price: (18) The heaven will break apart therefrom;[1784] ever is His promise fulfilled.
data.arabic: ٱلسَّمَآءُ مُنفَطِرُۢ بِهِۦۚ كَانَ وَعۡدُهُۥ مَفۡعُولًا
data.footnotes: [1784]- From the terror of that Day.

data.price: (19) Indeed, this is a reminder, so whoever wills may take to his Lord a way.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلًا

data.price: (20) Indeed, your Lord knows, [O Muḥammad], that you stand [in prayer] almost two thirds of the night or half of it or a third of it, and [so do] a group of those with you. And Allāh determines [the extent of] the night and the day. He has known that you [Muslims] will not be able to do it[1785] and has turned to you in forgiveness, so recite what is easy [for you] of the Qur’ān. He has known that there will be among you those who are ill and others traveling throughout the land seeking [something] of the bounty of Allāh and others fighting for the cause of Allāh. So recite what is easy from it and establish prayer and give zakāh and loan Allāh a goodly loan.[1786] And whatever good you put forward for yourselves - you will find it with Allāh. It is better and greater in reward. And seek forgiveness of Allāh. Indeed, Allāh is Forgiving and Merciful.
data.arabic: ۞ إِنَّ رَبَّكَ يَعۡلَمُ أَنَّكَ تَقُومُ أَدۡنَىٰ مِن ثُلُثَيِ ٱلَّيۡلِ وَنِصۡفَهُۥ وَثُلُثَهُۥ وَطَآئِفَةٞ مِّنَ ٱلَّذِينَ مَعَكَۚ وَٱللَّهُ يُقَدِّرُ ٱلَّيۡلَ وَٱلنَّهَارَۚ عَلِمَ أَن لَّن تُحۡصُوهُ فَتَابَ عَلَيۡكُمۡۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانِۚ عَلِمَ أَن سَيَكُونُ مِنكُم مَّرۡضَىٰ وَءَاخَرُونَ يَضۡرِبُونَ فِي ٱلۡأَرۡضِ يَبۡتَغُونَ مِن فَضۡلِ ٱللَّهِ وَءَاخَرُونَ يُقَٰتِلُونَ فِي سَبِيلِ ٱللَّهِۖ فَٱقۡرَءُواْ مَا تَيَسَّرَ مِنۡهُۚ وَأَقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَءَاتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَ وَأَقۡرِضُواْ ٱللَّهَ قَرۡضًا حَسَنٗاۚ وَمَا تُقَدِّمُواْ لِأَنفُسِكُم مِّنۡ خَيۡرٖ تَجِدُوهُ عِندَ ٱللَّهِ هُوَ خَيۡرٗا وَأَعۡظَمَ أَجۡرٗاۚ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرُواْ ٱللَّهَۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ غَفُورٞ رَّحِيمُۢ
data.footnotes:
[1785]- Allāh has known that if they were to continue in such long periods of worship each night, the people would be caused much hardship.
[1786]- In the form of charities and contributions to His cause.

data.price: (1) O you who covers himself [with a garment],[1788]
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡمُدَّثِّرُ
data.footnotes: [1788]- Referring to the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (2) Arise and warn
data.arabic: قُمۡ فَأَنذِرۡ

data.price: (3) And your Lord glorify
data.arabic: وَرَبَّكَ فَكَبِّرۡ

data.price: (4) And your clothing purify
data.arabic: وَثِيَابَكَ فَطَهِّرۡ

data.price: (5) And uncleanliness[1789] avoid
data.arabic: وَٱلرُّجۡزَ فَٱهۡجُرۡ
data.footnotes: [1789]- Specifically, idols or generally, bad conduct and morals.

data.price: (6) And do not confer favor to acquire more[1790]
data.arabic: وَلَا تَمۡنُن تَسۡتَكۡثِرُ
data.footnotes: [1790]- An alternative meaning is "Do not consider any favor you have conferred to be great."

data.price: (7) But for your Lord be patient.
data.arabic: وَلِرَبِّكَ فَٱصۡبِرۡ

data.price: (8) And when the trumpet is blown,
data.arabic: فَإِذَا نُقِرَ فِي ٱلنَّاقُورِ

data.price: (9) That Day will be a difficult day
data.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَوۡمٌ عَسِيرٌ

data.price: (10) For the disbelievers - not easy.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ غَيۡرُ يَسِيرٖ

data.price: (11) Leave Me with the one I created alone[1791]
data.arabic: ذَرۡنِي وَمَنۡ خَلَقۡتُ وَحِيدٗا
data.footnotes: [1791]- i.e., without wealth or children.  The reference is to al-Waleed bin al-Mugheerah, who after inclining toward the Qur’ān, denied it publicly in order to win the approval of the Quraysh.

data.price: (12) And to whom I granted extensive wealth
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡتُ لَهُۥ مَالٗا مَّمۡدُودٗا

data.price: (13) And children present [with him]
data.arabic: وَبَنِينَ شُهُودٗا

data.price: (14) And spread [everything] before him, easing [his life].
data.arabic: وَمَهَّدتُّ لَهُۥ تَمۡهِيدٗا

data.price: (15) Then he desires that I should add more.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يَطۡمَعُ أَنۡ أَزِيدَ

data.price: (16) No! Indeed, he has been toward Our verses obstinate.
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ لِأٓيَٰتِنَا عَنِيدٗا

data.price: (17) I will cover him with arduous torment.
data.arabic: سَأُرۡهِقُهُۥ صَعُودًا

data.price: (18) Indeed, he thought and deliberated.[1792]
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ فَكَّرَ وَقَدَّرَ
data.footnotes: [1792]- About what he would say concerning the Qur’ān and how he might discredit the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (19) So may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
data.arabic: فَقُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: (20) Then may he be destroyed [for] how he deliberated.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ قُتِلَ كَيۡفَ قَدَّرَ

data.price: (21) Then he considered [again];
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نَظَرَ

data.price: (22) Then he frowned and scowled;
data.arabic: ثُمَّ عَبَسَ وَبَسَرَ

data.price: (23) Then he turned back and was arrogant
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ وَٱسۡتَكۡبَرَ

data.price: (24) And said, "This is not but magic imitated [from others].
data.arabic: فَقَالَ إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا سِحۡرٞ يُؤۡثَرُ

data.price: (25) This is not but the word of a human being."
data.arabic: إِنۡ هَٰذَآ إِلَّا قَوۡلُ ٱلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: (26) I will drive him into Saqar.[1793]
data.arabic: سَأُصۡلِيهِ سَقَرَ
data.footnotes: [1793]- One of the proper names of Hell.

data.price: (27) And what can make you know what is Saqar?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سَقَرُ

data.price: (28) It lets nothing remain and leaves nothing [unburned],
data.arabic: لَا تُبۡقِي وَلَا تَذَرُ

data.price: (29) Altering [i.e., blackening] the skins.
data.arabic: لَوَّاحَةٞ لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: (30) Over it are nineteen [angels].
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهَا تِسۡعَةَ عَشَرَ

data.price: (31) And We have not made the keepers of the Fire except angels. And We have not made their number except as a trial for those who disbelieve - that those who were given the Scripture will be convinced and those who have believed will increase in faith and those who were given the Scripture and the believers will not doubt and that those in whose hearts is disease [i.e., hypocrisy] and the disbelievers will say, "What does Allāh intend by this as an example?" Thus does Allāh send astray whom He wills and guide whom He wills. And none knows the soldiers of your Lord except Him. And it [i.e., mention of the Fire] is not but a reminder to humanity.
data.arabic: وَمَا جَعَلۡنَآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلنَّارِ إِلَّا مَلَٰٓئِكَةٗۖ وَمَا جَعَلۡنَا عِدَّتَهُمۡ إِلَّا فِتۡنَةٗ لِّلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ لِيَسۡتَيۡقِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَيَزۡدَادَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُوٓاْ إِيمَٰنٗا وَلَا يَرۡتَابَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنُونَ وَلِيَقُولَ ٱلَّذِينَ فِي قُلُوبِهِم مَّرَضٞ وَٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ مَاذَآ أَرَادَ ٱللَّهُ بِهَٰذَا مَثَلٗاۚ كَذَٰلِكَ يُضِلُّ ٱللَّهُ مَن يَشَآءُ وَيَهۡدِي مَن يَشَآءُۚ وَمَا يَعۡلَمُ جُنُودَ رَبِّكَ إِلَّا هُوَۚ وَمَا هِيَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرَىٰ لِلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: (32) No! By the moon
data.arabic: كَلَّا وَٱلۡقَمَرِ

data.price: (33) And [by] the night when it departs
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذۡ أَدۡبَرَ

data.price: (34) And [by] the morning when it brightens,
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَآ أَسۡفَرَ

data.price: (35) Indeed, it [i.e., the Fire] is of the greatest [afflictions]
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا لَإِحۡدَى ٱلۡكُبَرِ

data.price: (36) As a warning to humanity -
data.arabic: نَذِيرٗا لِّلۡبَشَرِ

data.price: (37) To whoever wills among you to proceed[1794] or stay behind.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَتَقَدَّمَ أَوۡ يَتَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes: [1794]- To righteousness by acceptance of the warning.

data.price: (38) Every soul, for what it has earned, will be retained[1795]
data.arabic: كُلُّ نَفۡسِۭ بِمَا كَسَبَتۡ رَهِينَةٌ
data.footnotes: [1795]- i.e., subject or held responsible.

data.price: (39) Except the companions of the right,[1796].
data.arabic: إِلَّآ أَصۡحَٰبَ ٱلۡيَمِينِ
data.footnotes: [1796]- i.e., the righteous who receive their records in their right hands.

data.price: (40) [Who will be] in gardens, questioning each other
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّٰتٖ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: (41) About the criminals,
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: (42) [And asking them], "What put you into Saqar?"
data.arabic: مَا سَلَكَكُمۡ فِي سَقَرَ

data.price: (43) They will say, "We were not of those who prayed,
data.arabic: قَالُواْ لَمۡ نَكُ مِنَ ٱلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: (44) Nor did we used to feed the poor.
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ نَكُ نُطۡعِمُ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينَ

data.price: (45) And we used to enter into vain discourse with those who engaged [in it],
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نَخُوضُ مَعَ ٱلۡخَآئِضِينَ

data.price: (46) And we used to deny the Day of Recompense
data.arabic: وَكُنَّا نُكَذِّبُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (47) Until there came to us the certainty [i.e., death]."
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰٓ أَتَىٰنَا ٱلۡيَقِينُ

data.price: (48) So there will not benefit them the intercession of [any] intercessors.
data.arabic: فَمَا تَنفَعُهُمۡ شَفَٰعَةُ ٱلشَّٰفِعِينَ

data.price: (49) Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ عَنِ ٱلتَّذۡكِرَةِ مُعۡرِضِينَ

data.price: (50) As if they were alarmed donkeys
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ حُمُرٞ مُّسۡتَنفِرَةٞ

data.price: (51) Fleeing from a lion?
data.arabic: فَرَّتۡ مِن قَسۡوَرَةِۭ

data.price: (52) Rather, every person among them desires that he[1797] would be given scriptures spread about.[1798]
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ كُلُّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ أَن يُؤۡتَىٰ صُحُفٗا مُّنَشَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes:
[1797]- Instead of Muḥammad (ﷺ).
[1798]- i.e., made public.  Much of their refusal of his message was due to envy and jealousy of the Prophet (ﷺ).

data.price: (53) No! But they do not fear the Hereafter.
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا يَخَافُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: (54) No! Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a reminder
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُۥ تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: (55) Then whoever wills will remember it.
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ

data.price: (56) And they will not remember except that Allāh wills. He is worthy of fear and adequate for [granting] forgiveness.
data.arabic: وَمَا يَذۡكُرُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ هُوَ أَهۡلُ ٱلتَّقۡوَىٰ وَأَهۡلُ ٱلۡمَغۡفِرَةِ

data.price: (1) I swear by the Day of Resurrection
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: (2) And I swear by the reproaching soul[1800] [to the certainty of resurrection].
data.arabic: وَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلنَّفۡسِ ٱللَّوَّامَةِ
data.footnotes: [1800]- i.e., that of the believer, which blames him when he falls into sin or error.

data.price: (3) Does man think that We will not assemble his bones?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَلَّن نَّجۡمَعَ عِظَامَهُۥ

data.price: (4) Yes. [We are] Able [even] to proportion his fingertips.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰ قَٰدِرِينَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن نُّسَوِّيَ بَنَانَهُۥ

data.price: (5) But man desires to continue in sin.[1801]
data.arabic: بَلۡ يُرِيدُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ لِيَفۡجُرَ أَمَامَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1801]- Literally, "to sin ahead of him."  This refers to the disbeliever, who denies the Day of Account.

data.price: (6) He asks, "When is the Day of Resurrection?"
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُ أَيَّانَ يَوۡمُ ٱلۡقِيَٰمَةِ

data.price: (7) So when vision is dazzled
data.arabic: فَإِذَا بَرِقَ ٱلۡبَصَرُ

data.price: (8) And the moon darkens
data.arabic: وَخَسَفَ ٱلۡقَمَرُ

data.price: (9) And the sun and the moon are joined,
data.arabic: وَجُمِعَ ٱلشَّمۡسُ وَٱلۡقَمَرُ

data.price: (10) Man will say on that Day, "Where is the [place of] escape?"
data.arabic: يَقُولُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذٍ أَيۡنَ ٱلۡمَفَرُّ

data.price: (11) No! There is no refuge.
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا وَزَرَ

data.price: (12) To your Lord, that Day, is the [place of] permanence.
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمُسۡتَقَرُّ

data.price: (13) Man will be informed that Day of what he sent ahead[1802] and kept back.[1803]
data.arabic: يُنَبَّؤُاْ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِمَا قَدَّمَ وَأَخَّرَ
data.footnotes:
[1802]- i.e., his deeds, which await him in the Hereafter.
[1803]- i.e., that which he did not do or which he delayed.

data.price: (14) Rather, man, against himself, will be a witness,[1804]
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ عَلَىٰ نَفۡسِهِۦ بَصِيرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1804]- As described in 36:65 and 41:20-23.

data.price: (15) Even if he presents his excuses.
data.arabic: وَلَوۡ أَلۡقَىٰ مَعَاذِيرَهُۥ

data.price: (16) Move not your tongue with it, [O Muḥammad], to hasten with it [i.e., recitation of the Qur’ān].
data.arabic: لَا تُحَرِّكۡ بِهِۦ لِسَانَكَ لِتَعۡجَلَ بِهِۦٓ

data.price: (17) Indeed, upon Us is its collection [in your heart] and [to make possible] its recitation.
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا جَمۡعَهُۥ وَقُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: (18) So when We have recited it [through Gabriel], then follow its recitation.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا قَرَأۡنَٰهُ فَٱتَّبِعۡ قُرۡءَانَهُۥ

data.price: (19) Then upon Us is its clarification [to you].
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا بَيَانَهُۥ

data.price: (20) No! But you [i.e., mankind] love the immediate
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ

data.price: (21) And leave [i.e., neglect] the Hereafter.
data.arabic: وَتَذَرُونَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةَ

data.price: (22) [Some] faces, that Day, will be radiant,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاضِرَةٌ

data.price: (23) Looking at their Lord.[1805]
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّهَا نَاظِرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1805]- The people of Paradise will actually see their Creator in the Hereafter.

data.price: (24) And [some] faces, that Day, will be contorted,
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بَاسِرَةٞ

data.price: (25) Expecting that there will be done to them [something] backbreaking.
data.arabic: تَظُنُّ أَن يُفۡعَلَ بِهَا فَاقِرَةٞ

data.price: (26) No! When it [i.e., the soul] has reached the collar bones[1806]
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِذَا بَلَغَتِ ٱلتَّرَاقِيَ
data.footnotes: [1806]- At the time it is about to leave the body when one is on the verge of death.

data.price: (27) And it is said, "Who will cure [him]?"
data.arabic: وَقِيلَ مَنۡۜ رَاقٖ

data.price: (28) And he [i.e., the dying one] is certain that it is the [time of] separation
data.arabic: وَظَنَّ أَنَّهُ ٱلۡفِرَاقُ

data.price: (29) And the leg is wound about the leg,[1807]
data.arabic: وَٱلۡتَفَّتِ ٱلسَّاقُ بِٱلسَّاقِ
data.footnotes: [1807]- From the difficulties the person faces at death or his sudden awareness of the realities of both this world and the Hereafter.  It may also refer to his shrouding after death.

data.price: (30) To your Lord, that Day, will be the procession.[1808]
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ يَوۡمَئِذٍ ٱلۡمَسَاقُ
data.footnotes: [1808]- Literally, "driving" or "herding" or "the place to which one is driven."

data.price: (31) And he [i.e., the disbeliever] had not believed, nor had he prayed.
data.arabic: فَلَا صَدَّقَ وَلَا صَلَّىٰ

data.price: (32) But [instead], he denied and turned away.
data.arabic: وَلَٰكِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: (33) And then he went to his people, swaggering [in pride].
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ذَهَبَ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ يَتَمَطَّىٰٓ

data.price: (34) Woe to you, and woe!
data.arabic: أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰ

data.price: (35) Then woe to you, and woe!
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَوۡلَىٰ لَكَ فَأَوۡلَىٰٓ

data.price: (36) Does man think that he will be left neglected?[1809]
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ أَن يُتۡرَكَ سُدًى
data.footnotes: [1809]- i.e., to no end, without responsibility, or without being returned to the Creator for judgement.

data.price: (37) Had he not been a sperm from semen emitted?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَكُ نُطۡفَةٗ مِّن مَّنِيّٖ يُمۡنَىٰ

data.price: (38) Then he was a clinging clot, and [Allāh] created [his form] and proportioned [him]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ عَلَقَةٗ فَخَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

data.price: (39) And made of him two mates, the male and the female.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَ مِنۡهُ ٱلزَّوۡجَيۡنِ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: (40) Is not that [Creator] Able to give life to the dead?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ذَٰلِكَ بِقَٰدِرٍ عَلَىٰٓ أَن يُحۡـِۧيَ ٱلۡمَوۡتَىٰ

data.price: (1) Has there [not] come upon man a period of time when he was not a thing [even] mentioned?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡإِنسَٰنِ حِينٞ مِّنَ ٱلدَّهۡرِ لَمۡ يَكُن شَيۡـٔٗا مَّذۡكُورًا

data.price: (2) Indeed, We created man from a sperm-drop mixture[1811] that We may try him; and We made him hearing and seeing.
data.arabic: إِنَّا خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ أَمۡشَاجٖ نَّبۡتَلِيهِ فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ سَمِيعَۢا بَصِيرًا
data.footnotes: [1811]- i.e., a combination of the male and female substance, within the womb.

data.price: (3) Indeed, We guided him to the way, be he grateful or be he ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّا هَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلسَّبِيلَ إِمَّا شَاكِرٗا وَإِمَّا كَفُورًا

data.price: (4) Indeed, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains and shackles and a blaze.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡتَدۡنَا لِلۡكَٰفِرِينَ سَلَٰسِلَاْ وَأَغۡلَٰلٗا وَسَعِيرًا

data.price: (5) Indeed, the righteous will drink from a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of Kāfūr,[1812]
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ يَشۡرَبُونَ مِن كَأۡسٖ كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا كَافُورًا
data.footnotes: [1812]- A sweet-smelling spring in Paradise.

data.price: (6) A spring of which the [righteous] servants of Allāh will drink; they will make it gush forth in force [and abundance].
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا عِبَادُ ٱللَّهِ يُفَجِّرُونَهَا تَفۡجِيرٗا

data.price: (7) They [are those who] fulfill [their] vows and fear a Day whose evil will be widespread.
data.arabic: يُوفُونَ بِٱلنَّذۡرِ وَيَخَافُونَ يَوۡمٗا كَانَ شَرُّهُۥ مُسۡتَطِيرٗا

data.price: (8) And they give food in spite of love for it[1813] to the needy, the orphan, and the captive,
data.arabic: وَيُطۡعِمُونَ ٱلطَّعَامَ عَلَىٰ حُبِّهِۦ مِسۡكِينٗا وَيَتِيمٗا وَأَسِيرًا
data.footnotes: [1813]- The meaning here may also be "out of love for Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā).

data.price: (9) [Saying], "We feed you only for the face [i.e., approval] of Allāh. We wish not from you reward or gratitude.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا نُطۡعِمُكُمۡ لِوَجۡهِ ٱللَّهِ لَا نُرِيدُ مِنكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَلَا شُكُورًا

data.price: (10) Indeed, We fear from our Lord a Day austere and distressful."
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَخَافُ مِن رَّبِّنَا يَوۡمًا عَبُوسٗا قَمۡطَرِيرٗا

data.price: (11) So Allāh will protect them from the evil of that Day and give them radiance and happiness
data.arabic: فَوَقَىٰهُمُ ٱللَّهُ شَرَّ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمِ وَلَقَّىٰهُمۡ نَضۡرَةٗ وَسُرُورٗا

data.price: (12) And will reward them for what they patiently endured [with] a garden [in Paradise] and silk [garments].
data.arabic: وَجَزَىٰهُم بِمَا صَبَرُواْ جَنَّةٗ وَحَرِيرٗا

data.price: (13) [They will be] reclining therein on adorned couches. They will not see therein any [burning] sun or [freezing] cold.
data.arabic: مُّتَّكِـِٔينَ فِيهَا عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِۖ لَا يَرَوۡنَ فِيهَا شَمۡسٗا وَلَا زَمۡهَرِيرٗا

data.price: (14) And near above them are its shades, and its [fruit] to be picked will be lowered in compliance.
data.arabic: وَدَانِيَةً عَلَيۡهِمۡ ظِلَٰلُهَا وَذُلِّلَتۡ قُطُوفُهَا تَذۡلِيلٗا

data.price: (15) And there will be circulated among them vessels of silver and cups having been [created] clear [as glass],
data.arabic: وَيُطَافُ عَلَيۡهِم بِـَٔانِيَةٖ مِّن فِضَّةٖ وَأَكۡوَابٖ كَانَتۡ قَوَارِيرَا۠

data.price: (16) Clear glasses [made] from silver of which they have determined the measure.
data.arabic: قَوَارِيرَاْ مِن فِضَّةٖ قَدَّرُوهَا تَقۡدِيرٗا

data.price: (17) And they will be given to drink a cup [of wine] whose mixture is of ginger
data.arabic: وَيُسۡقَوۡنَ فِيهَا كَأۡسٗا كَانَ مِزَاجُهَا زَنجَبِيلًا

data.price: (18) [From] a fountain within it [i.e., Paradise] named Salsabeel.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا فِيهَا تُسَمَّىٰ سَلۡسَبِيلٗا

data.price: (19) There will circulate among them young boys made eternal. When you see them, you would think them [as beautiful as] scattered pearls.
data.arabic: ۞ وَيَطُوفُ عَلَيۡهِمۡ وِلۡدَٰنٞ مُّخَلَّدُونَ إِذَا رَأَيۡتَهُمۡ حَسِبۡتَهُمۡ لُؤۡلُؤٗا مَّنثُورٗا

data.price: (20) And when you look there [in Paradise], you will see pleasure and great dominion.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَيۡتَ ثَمَّ رَأَيۡتَ نَعِيمٗا وَمُلۡكٗا كَبِيرًا

data.price: (21) Upon them [i.e., the inhabitants] will be green garments of fine silk and brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord will give them a purifying drink.
data.arabic: عَٰلِيَهُمۡ ثِيَابُ سُندُسٍ خُضۡرٞ وَإِسۡتَبۡرَقٞۖ وَحُلُّوٓاْ أَسَاوِرَ مِن فِضَّةٖ وَسَقَىٰهُمۡ رَبُّهُمۡ شَرَابٗا طَهُورًا

data.price: (22) [And it will be said], "Indeed, this is for you a reward, and your effort has been appreciated."
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا كَانَ لَكُمۡ جَزَآءٗ وَكَانَ سَعۡيُكُم مَّشۡكُورًا

data.price: (23) Indeed, it is We who have sent down to you, [O Muḥammad], the Qur’ān progressively.
data.arabic: إِنَّا نَحۡنُ نَزَّلۡنَا عَلَيۡكَ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانَ تَنزِيلٗا

data.price: (24) So be patient for the decision of your Lord and do not obey from among them a sinner or ungrateful [disbeliever].
data.arabic: فَٱصۡبِرۡ لِحُكۡمِ رَبِّكَ وَلَا تُطِعۡ مِنۡهُمۡ ءَاثِمًا أَوۡ كَفُورٗا

data.price: (25) And mention the name of your Lord [in prayer] morning and evening
data.arabic: وَٱذۡكُرِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ بُكۡرَةٗ وَأَصِيلٗا

data.price: (26) And during the night prostrate to Him and exalt [i.e., praise] Him a long [part of the] night.
data.arabic: وَمِنَ ٱلَّيۡلِ فَٱسۡجُدۡ لَهُۥ وَسَبِّحۡهُ لَيۡلٗا طَوِيلًا

data.price: (27) Indeed, these [disbelievers] love the immediate and leave behind them[1814] a grave Day.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ يُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡعَاجِلَةَ وَيَذَرُونَ وَرَآءَهُمۡ يَوۡمٗا ثَقِيلٗا
data.footnotes: [1814]- i.e., neglect.  The meaning may also be "leave ahead of them."

data.price: (28) We have created them and strengthened their forms, and when We will, We can change their likenesses with [complete] alteration.
data.arabic: نَّحۡنُ خَلَقۡنَٰهُمۡ وَشَدَدۡنَآ أَسۡرَهُمۡۖ وَإِذَا شِئۡنَا بَدَّلۡنَآ أَمۡثَٰلَهُمۡ تَبۡدِيلًا

data.price: (29) Indeed, this is a reminder, so he who wills may take to his Lord a way.
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذِهِۦ تَذۡكِرَةٞۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ سَبِيلٗا

data.price: (30) And you do not will except that Allāh wills. Indeed, Allāh is ever Knowing and Wise.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ كَانَ عَلِيمًا حَكِيمٗا

data.price: (31) He admits whom He wills into His mercy; but the wrongdoers - He has prepared for them a painful punishment.
data.arabic: يُدۡخِلُ مَن يَشَآءُ فِي رَحۡمَتِهِۦۚ وَٱلظَّٰلِمِينَ أَعَدَّ لَهُمۡ عَذَابًا أَلِيمَۢا

data.price: (1) By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
data.arabic: وَٱلۡمُرۡسَلَٰتِ عُرۡفٗا

data.price: (2) And the winds that blow violently
data.arabic: فَٱلۡعَٰصِفَٰتِ عَصۡفٗا

data.price: (3) And [by] the winds that spread [clouds]
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِرَٰتِ نَشۡرٗا

data.price: (4) And those [angels] who bring criterion[1816]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡفَٰرِقَٰتِ فَرۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [1816]- To Allāh's human messengers.

data.price: (5) And those [angels] who deliver a message
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُلۡقِيَٰتِ ذِكۡرًا

data.price: (6) As justification or warning,
data.arabic: عُذۡرًا أَوۡ نُذۡرًا

data.price: (7) Indeed, what you are promised is to occur.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَا تُوعَدُونَ لَوَٰقِعٞ

data.price: (8) So when the stars are obliterated
data.arabic: فَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ طُمِسَتۡ

data.price: (9) And when the heaven is opened
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ فُرِجَتۡ

data.price: (10) And when the mountains are blown away
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ نُسِفَتۡ

data.price: (11) And when the messengers' time has come...[1817]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلرُّسُلُ أُقِّتَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1817]- i.e., when they are gathered to witness concerning their nations.  The sentence's conclusion is understood to be "...the promised judgement will then take place."

data.price: (12) For what Day was it postponed?[1818]
data.arabic: لِأَيِّ يَوۡمٍ أُجِّلَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1818]- "It" may refer to either the aforementioned occurrences collectively or to the testimony of the messengers.

data.price: (13) For the Day of Judgement.
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمِ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: (14) And what can make you know what is the Day of Judgement?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ

data.price: (15) Woe,[1819] that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ
data.footnotes: [1819]- i.e., death and destruction.

data.price: (16) Did We not destroy the former peoples?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نُهۡلِكِ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (17) Then We will follow them with the later ones.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ نُتۡبِعُهُمُ ٱلۡأٓخِرِينَ

data.price: (18) Thus do We deal with the criminals.
data.arabic: كَذَٰلِكَ نَفۡعَلُ بِٱلۡمُجۡرِمِينَ

data.price: (19) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (20) Did We not create you from a liquid disdained?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَخۡلُقكُّم مِّن مَّآءٖ مَّهِينٖ

data.price: (21) And We placed it in a firm lodging [i.e., the womb]
data.arabic: فَجَعَلۡنَٰهُ فِي قَرَارٖ مَّكِينٍ

data.price: (22) For a known extent.
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ قَدَرٖ مَّعۡلُومٖ

data.price: (23) And We determined [it], and excellent [are We] to determine.
data.arabic: فَقَدَرۡنَا فَنِعۡمَ ٱلۡقَٰدِرُونَ

data.price: (24) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (25) Have We not made the earth a container
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ كِفَاتًا

data.price: (26) Of the living and the dead?
data.arabic: أَحۡيَآءٗ وَأَمۡوَٰتٗا

data.price: (27) And We placed therein lofty, firmly set mountains and have given you to drink sweet water.
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا فِيهَا رَوَٰسِيَ شَٰمِخَٰتٖ وَأَسۡقَيۡنَٰكُم مَّآءٗ فُرَاتٗا

data.price: (28) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (29) [They will be told], "Proceed to that which you used to deny.
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ مَا كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (30) Proceed to a shadow [of smoke] having three columns
data.arabic: ٱنطَلِقُوٓاْ إِلَىٰ ظِلّٖ ذِي ثَلَٰثِ شُعَبٖ

data.price: (31) [But having] no cool shade and availing not against the flame."
data.arabic: لَّا ظَلِيلٖ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِنَ ٱللَّهَبِ

data.price: (32) Indeed, it throws sparks [as huge] as a fortress,
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا تَرۡمِي بِشَرَرٖ كَٱلۡقَصۡرِ

data.price: (33) As if they were yellowish [black] camels.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُۥ جِمَٰلَتٞ صُفۡرٞ

data.price: (34) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (35) This is a Day they will not speak,
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ لَا يَنطِقُونَ

data.price: (36) Nor will it be permitted for them to make an excuse.
data.arabic: وَلَا يُؤۡذَنُ لَهُمۡ فَيَعۡتَذِرُونَ

data.price: (37) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (38) This is the Day of Judgement; We will have assembled you and the former peoples.
data.arabic: هَٰذَا يَوۡمُ ٱلۡفَصۡلِۖ جَمَعۡنَٰكُمۡ وَٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (39) So if you have a plan, then plan against Me.
data.arabic: فَإِن كَانَ لَكُمۡ كَيۡدٞ فَكِيدُونِ

data.price: (40) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (41) Indeed, the righteous will be among shades and springs
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡمُتَّقِينَ فِي ظِلَٰلٖ وَعُيُونٖ

data.price: (42) And fruits from whatever they desire,
data.arabic: وَفَوَٰكِهَ مِمَّا يَشۡتَهُونَ

data.price: (43) [Being told], "Eat and drink in satisfaction for what you used to do."
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَٱشۡرَبُواْ هَنِيٓـَٔۢا بِمَا كُنتُمۡ تَعۡمَلُونَ

data.price: (44) Indeed, We thus reward the doers of good.
data.arabic: إِنَّا كَذَٰلِكَ نَجۡزِي ٱلۡمُحۡسِنِينَ

data.price: (45) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (46) [O disbelievers], eat and enjoy yourselves a little; indeed, you are criminals.
data.arabic: كُلُواْ وَتَمَتَّعُواْ قَلِيلًا إِنَّكُم مُّجۡرِمُونَ

data.price: (47) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (48) And when it is said to them, "Bow [in prayer]," they do not bow.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱرۡكَعُواْ لَا يَرۡكَعُونَ

data.price: (49) Woe, that Day, to the deniers.
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (50) Then in what statement after it [i.e., the Qur’ān] will they believe?
data.arabic: فَبِأَيِّ حَدِيثِۭ بَعۡدَهُۥ يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (1) About what are they asking one another?
data.arabic: عَمَّ يَتَسَآءَلُونَ

data.price: (2) About the great news[1821] -
data.arabic: عَنِ ٱلنَّبَإِ ٱلۡعَظِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1821]- i.e., the Resurrection.

data.price: (3) That over which they are in disagreement.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي هُمۡ فِيهِ مُخۡتَلِفُونَ

data.price: (4) No! They are going to know.
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (5) Then, no! They are going to know.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَيَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (6) Have We not made the earth a resting place?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَلِ ٱلۡأَرۡضَ مِهَٰدٗا

data.price: (7) And the mountains as stakes?[1822]
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَوۡتَادٗا
data.footnotes: [1822]- To stabilize the land and balance the earth.

data.price: (8) And We created you in pairs
data.arabic: وَخَلَقۡنَٰكُمۡ أَزۡوَٰجٗا

data.price: (9) And made your sleep [a means for] rest
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا نَوۡمَكُمۡ سُبَاتٗا

data.price: (10) And made the night as clothing[1823]
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلَّيۡلَ لِبَاسٗا
data.footnotes: [1823]- Covering you in darkness and providing rest.

data.price: (11) And made the day for livelihood
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا ٱلنَّهَارَ مَعَاشٗا

data.price: (12) And constructed above you seven strong [heavens]
data.arabic: وَبَنَيۡنَا فَوۡقَكُمۡ سَبۡعٗا شِدَادٗا

data.price: (13) And made [therein] a burning lamp
data.arabic: وَجَعَلۡنَا سِرَاجٗا وَهَّاجٗا

data.price: (14) And sent down from the rain clouds pouring water
data.arabic: وَأَنزَلۡنَا مِنَ ٱلۡمُعۡصِرَٰتِ مَآءٗ ثَجَّاجٗا

data.price: (15) That We may bring forth thereby grain and vegetation
data.arabic: لِّنُخۡرِجَ بِهِۦ حَبّٗا وَنَبَاتٗا

data.price: (16) And gardens of entwined growth.
data.arabic: وَجَنَّٰتٍ أَلۡفَافًا

data.price: (17) Indeed, the Day of Judgement is an appointed time -
data.arabic: إِنَّ يَوۡمَ ٱلۡفَصۡلِ كَانَ مِيقَٰتٗا

data.price: (18) The Day the Horn is blown and you will come forth in multitudes
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يُنفَخُ فِي ٱلصُّورِ فَتَأۡتُونَ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: (19) And the heaven is opened and will become gateways
data.arabic: وَفُتِحَتِ ٱلسَّمَآءُ فَكَانَتۡ أَبۡوَٰبٗا

data.price: (20) And the mountains are removed and will be [but] a mirage.
data.arabic: وَسُيِّرَتِ ٱلۡجِبَالُ فَكَانَتۡ سَرَابًا

data.price: (21) Indeed, Hell has been lying in wait
data.arabic: إِنَّ جَهَنَّمَ كَانَتۡ مِرۡصَادٗا

data.price: (22) For the transgressors, a place of return,
data.arabic: لِّلطَّٰغِينَ مَـَٔابٗا

data.price: (23) In which they will remain for ages [unending].
data.arabic: لَّٰبِثِينَ فِيهَآ أَحۡقَابٗا

data.price: (24) They will not taste therein [any] coolness or drink.
data.arabic: لَّا يَذُوقُونَ فِيهَا بَرۡدٗا وَلَا شَرَابًا

data.price: (25) Except scalding water and [foul] purulence -
data.arabic: إِلَّا حَمِيمٗا وَغَسَّاقٗا

data.price: (26) An appropriate recompense.[1824]
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ وِفَاقًا
data.footnotes: [1824]- In proportion to and comparable with their crimes.

data.price: (27) Indeed, they were not expecting an account
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ كَانُواْ لَا يَرۡجُونَ حِسَابٗا

data.price: (28) And denied Our verses with [emphatic] denial.
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا كِذَّابٗا

data.price: (29) But all things We have enumerated in writing.
data.arabic: وَكُلَّ شَيۡءٍ أَحۡصَيۡنَٰهُ كِتَٰبٗا

data.price: (30) "So taste [the penalty], and never will We increase you except in torment."[1825]
data.arabic: فَذُوقُواْ فَلَن نَّزِيدَكُمۡ إِلَّا عَذَابًا
data.footnotes: [1825]- This announcement will be made to the companions of Hell.

data.price: (31) Indeed, for the righteous is attainment[1826] -
data.arabic: إِنَّ لِلۡمُتَّقِينَ مَفَازًا
data.footnotes: [1826]- Of security, success and reward, including escape and safety from Hell.

data.price: (32) Gardens and grapevines
data.arabic: حَدَآئِقَ وَأَعۡنَٰبٗا

data.price: (33) And young women [companions] of equal age.
data.arabic: وَكَوَاعِبَ أَتۡرَابٗا

data.price: (34) And a full cup.[1827]
data.arabic: وَكَأۡسٗا دِهَاقٗا
data.footnotes: [1827]- Of wine which is delicious and does not intoxicate.

data.price: (35) No ill speech will they hear therein or any falsehood -
data.arabic: لَّا يَسۡمَعُونَ فِيهَا لَغۡوٗا وَلَا كِذَّٰبٗا

data.price: (36) [As] reward from your Lord, [a generous] gift [made due by] account,[1828]
data.arabic: جَزَآءٗ مِّن رَّبِّكَ عَطَآءً حِسَابٗا
data.footnotes: [1828]- i.e., as a result of both their own righteous deeds and the limitless generosity of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) . Another meaning is "a gift calculated [to be adequate]."

data.price: (37) [From] the Lord of the heavens and the earth and whatever is between them, the Most Merciful. They possess not from Him [authority for] speech.[1829]
data.arabic: رَّبِّ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا بَيۡنَهُمَا ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنِۖ لَا يَمۡلِكُونَ مِنۡهُ خِطَابٗا
data.footnotes: [1829]- None of Allāh's creatures can plead with Him on the Day of Judgement except by His permission.

data.price: (38) The Day that the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] and the angels will stand in rows, they will not speak except for one whom the Most Merciful permits, and he will say what is correct.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلرُّوحُ وَٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ صَفّٗاۖ لَّا يَتَكَلَّمُونَ إِلَّا مَنۡ أَذِنَ لَهُ ٱلرَّحۡمَٰنُ وَقَالَ صَوَابٗا

data.price: (39) That is the True [i.e., certain] Day; so he who wills may take to his Lord a [way of] return.[1830]
data.arabic: ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡيَوۡمُ ٱلۡحَقُّۖ فَمَن شَآءَ ٱتَّخَذَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّهِۦ مَـَٔابًا
data.footnotes: [1830]- i.e., a direct route through correct beliefs and righteous deeds.

data.price: (40) Indeed, We have warned you of an impending punishment on the Day when a man will observe what his hands have put forth[1831] and the disbeliever will say, "Oh, I wish that I were dust!"
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنذَرۡنَٰكُمۡ عَذَابٗا قَرِيبٗا يَوۡمَ يَنظُرُ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مَا قَدَّمَتۡ يَدَاهُ وَيَقُولُ ٱلۡكَافِرُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي كُنتُ تُرَٰبَۢا
data.footnotes: [1831]- i.e., the deeds he did in this world, which await him in the Hereafter.

data.price: (1) By those [angels] who extract with violence[1833]
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰزِعَٰتِ غَرۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [1833]- i.e., those who tear out the souls of those destined for Hell.

data.price: (2) And [by] those who remove with ease[1834]
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّٰشِطَٰتِ نَشۡطٗا
data.footnotes: [1834]- i.e., those angels who ease out the souls of those destined for Paradise.

data.price: (3) And [by] those who glide [as if] swimming[1835]
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّٰبِحَٰتِ سَبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [1835]- Speeding to execute Allāh's commands.

data.price: (4) And those who race each other in a race[1836]
data.arabic: فَٱلسَّٰبِقَٰتِ سَبۡقٗا
data.footnotes: [1836]- Racing to deliver the souls of the believers to Paradise.

data.price: (5) And those who arrange [each] matter,[1837]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُدَبِّرَٰتِ أَمۡرٗا
data.footnotes: [1837]- According to Allāh's decree.

data.price: (6) On the Day the blast [of the Horn] will convulse [creation],
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تَرۡجُفُ ٱلرَّاجِفَةُ

data.price: (7) There will follow it the subsequent [one].
data.arabic: تَتۡبَعُهَا ٱلرَّادِفَةُ

data.price: (8) Hearts,[1838] that Day, will tremble,
data.arabic: قُلُوبٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ وَاجِفَةٌ
data.footnotes: [1838]- Those of the disbelievers who denied the Resurrection.

data.price: (9) Their eyes[1839] humbled.
data.arabic: أَبۡصَٰرُهَا خَٰشِعَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1839]- Those of the disbelievers.

data.price: (10) They are [presently] saying, "Will we indeed be returned to [our] former state [of life]?
data.arabic: يَقُولُونَ أَءِنَّا لَمَرۡدُودُونَ فِي ٱلۡحَافِرَةِ

data.price: (11) Even if we should be decayed bones?"[1840]
data.arabic: أَءِذَا كُنَّا عِظَٰمٗا نَّخِرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [1840]- The disbelievers say this in ridicule of the warning.

data.price: (12) They say, "That, then, would be a losing return."[1841]
data.arabic: قَالُواْ تِلۡكَ إِذٗا كَرَّةٌ خَاسِرَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1841]- i.e., "If that were so, we would not be able to escape punishment."

data.price: (13) Indeed, it will be but one shout,
data.arabic: فَإِنَّمَا هِيَ زَجۡرَةٞ وَٰحِدَةٞ

data.price: (14) And suddenly they will be [alert] upon the earth's surface.
data.arabic: فَإِذَا هُم بِٱلسَّاهِرَةِ

data.price: (15) Has there reached you the story of Moses? -
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ مُوسَىٰٓ

data.price: (16) When his Lord called to him in the sacred valley of Ṭuwā,
data.arabic: إِذۡ نَادَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ بِٱلۡوَادِ ٱلۡمُقَدَّسِ طُوًى

data.price: (17) "Go to Pharaoh. Indeed, he has transgressed.
data.arabic: ٱذۡهَبۡ إِلَىٰ فِرۡعَوۡنَ إِنَّهُۥ طَغَىٰ

data.price: (18) And say to him, 'Would you [be willing to] purify yourself
data.arabic: فَقُلۡ هَل لَّكَ إِلَىٰٓ أَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: (19) And let me guide you to your Lord so you would fear [Him]?'"
data.arabic: وَأَهۡدِيَكَ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَتَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: (20) And he showed him the greatest sign,[1842]
data.arabic: فَأَرَىٰهُ ٱلۡأٓيَةَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1842]- i.e., the miracle of his staff becoming a great snake.

data.price: (21) But he [i.e., Pharaoh] denied and disobeyed.
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبَ وَعَصَىٰ

data.price: (22) Then he turned his back, striving [i.e., plotting].[1843]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَدۡبَرَ يَسۡعَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1843]- An alternative meaning is "running [from the snake]."

data.price: (23) And he gathered [his people] and called out
data.arabic: فَحَشَرَ فَنَادَىٰ

data.price: (24) And said, "I am your most exalted lord."
data.arabic: فَقَالَ أَنَا۠ رَبُّكُمُ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: (25) So Allāh seized him in exemplary punishment for the last and the first [transgression].[1844].
data.arabic: فَأَخَذَهُ ٱللَّهُ نَكَالَ ٱلۡأٓخِرَةِ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [1844]- i.e., for Pharaoh's setting himself up as a deity and for his previous oppression of the people and denial of Moses.

data.price: (26) Indeed in that is a lesson [i.e., warning] for whoever would fear [Allāh].
data.arabic: إِنَّ فِي ذَٰلِكَ لَعِبۡرَةٗ لِّمَن يَخۡشَىٰٓ

data.price: (27) Are you a more difficult creation or is the heaven? He [i.e., Allāh] constructed it.
data.arabic: ءَأَنتُمۡ أَشَدُّ خَلۡقًا أَمِ ٱلسَّمَآءُۚ بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: (28) He raised its ceiling and proportioned it.
data.arabic: رَفَعَ سَمۡكَهَا فَسَوَّىٰهَا

data.price: (29) And He darkened its night and extracted its brightness.[1845]
data.arabic: وَأَغۡطَشَ لَيۡلَهَا وَأَخۡرَجَ ضُحَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1845]- i.e., created the day from within the surrounding darkness.

data.price: (30) And after that He spread the earth.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ بَعۡدَ ذَٰلِكَ دَحَىٰهَآ

data.price: (31) He extracted from it its water and its pasture,
data.arabic: أَخۡرَجَ مِنۡهَا مَآءَهَا وَمَرۡعَىٰهَا

data.price: (32) And the mountains He set firmly
data.arabic: وَٱلۡجِبَالَ أَرۡسَىٰهَا

data.price: (33) As enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
data.arabic: مَتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: (34) But when there comes the greatest Overwhelming Calamity[1846] -
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلطَّآمَّةُ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1846]- i.e., the Day of Resurrection.

data.price: (35) The Day when man will remember that for which he strove,
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا سَعَىٰ

data.price: (36) And Hellfire will be exposed for [all] those who see -
data.arabic: وَبُرِّزَتِ ٱلۡجَحِيمُ لِمَن يَرَىٰ

data.price: (37) So as for he who transgressed
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن طَغَىٰ

data.price: (38) And preferred the life of the world,
data.arabic: وَءَاثَرَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: (39) Then indeed, Hellfire will be [his] refuge.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: (40) But as for he who feared the position of his Lord[1847] and prevented the soul from [unlawful] inclination,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفۡسَ عَنِ ٱلۡهَوَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1847]- See footnote to 55:46.

data.price: (41) Then indeed, Paradise will be [his] refuge.
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ ٱلۡجَنَّةَ هِيَ ٱلۡمَأۡوَىٰ

data.price: (42) They ask you, [O Muḥammad], about the Hour: when is its arrival?[1848]
data.arabic: يَسۡـَٔلُونَكَ عَنِ ٱلسَّاعَةِ أَيَّانَ مُرۡسَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1848]- Literally, "resting" or "establishment."

data.price: (43) In what [position] are you that you should mention it?[1849]
data.arabic: فِيمَ أَنتَ مِن ذِكۡرَىٰهَآ
data.footnotes: [1849]- Meaning that Muḥammad (ﷺ) had no knowledge of it, so how could he inform them?

data.price: (44) To your Lord is its finality.[1850]
data.arabic: إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ مُنتَهَىٰهَآ
data.footnotes: [1850]- i.e., its destination and termination. And to Him belongs ultimate knowledge of it.

data.price: (45) You are only a warner for those who fear it.
data.arabic: إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُنذِرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰهَا

data.price: (46) It will be, on the Day they see it,[1851] as though they had not remained [in the world] except for an afternoon or a morning thereof.
data.arabic: كَأَنَّهُمۡ يَوۡمَ يَرَوۡنَهَا لَمۡ يَلۡبَثُوٓاْ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوۡ ضُحَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1851]- i.e., the Hour, the Resurrection.

data.price: (1) He [i.e., the Prophet (ﷺ) ] frowned and turned away
data.arabic: عَبَسَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: (2) Because there came to him the blind man,[1853] [interrupting].
data.arabic: أَن جَآءَهُ ٱلۡأَعۡمَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1853]- ʿAbdullāh, the son of Umm Maktūm.

data.price: (3) But what would make you perceive, [O Muḥammad], that perhaps he might be purified[1854]
data.arabic: وَمَا يُدۡرِيكَ لَعَلَّهُۥ يَزَّكَّىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [1854]- As a result of what he learns from you.

data.price: (4) Or be reminded and the remembrance would benefit him?
data.arabic: أَوۡ يَذَّكَّرُ فَتَنفَعَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰٓ

data.price: (5) As for he who thinks himself without need,[1855]
data.arabic: أَمَّا مَنِ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1855]- i.e., without need of faith or need of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) . Here it is in reference to a certain influential member of the Quraysh whom the Prophet (ﷺ) had hoped to bring to Islām.

data.price: (6) To him you give attention.
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ لَهُۥ تَصَدَّىٰ

data.price: (7) And not upon you [is any blame] if he will not be purified.[1856]
data.arabic: وَمَا عَلَيۡكَ أَلَّا يَزَّكَّىٰ
data.footnotes: [1856]- The Prophet (ﷺ) was responsible only for conveying the message, not for ultimate guidance.

data.price: (8) But as for he who came to you striving [for knowledge]
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَن جَآءَكَ يَسۡعَىٰ

data.price: (9) While he fears [Allāh],
data.arabic: وَهُوَ يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: (10) From him you are distracted.
data.arabic: فَأَنتَ عَنۡهُ تَلَهَّىٰ

data.price: (11) No! Indeed, they [i.e., these verses] are a reminder;
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهَا تَذۡكِرَةٞ

data.price: (12) So whoever wills may remember it.[1857]
data.arabic: فَمَن شَآءَ ذَكَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1857]- The revelation. Or "Him," i.e., Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

data.price: (13) [It is recorded] in honored sheets,
data.arabic: فِي صُحُفٖ مُّكَرَّمَةٖ

data.price: (14) Exalted and purified,
data.arabic: مَّرۡفُوعَةٖ مُّطَهَّرَةِۭ

data.price: (15) [Carried] by the hands of messenger-angels,
data.arabic: بِأَيۡدِي سَفَرَةٖ

data.price: (16) Noble and dutiful.
data.arabic: كِرَامِۭ بَرَرَةٖ

data.price: (17) Destroyed [i.e., cursed] is man;[1858] how disbelieving is he.
data.arabic: قُتِلَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَآ أَكۡفَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1858]- i.e., those who deny Allāh's message.

data.price: (18) From what thing [i.e., substance] did He create him?
data.arabic: مِنۡ أَيِّ شَيۡءٍ خَلَقَهُۥ

data.price: (19) From a sperm-drop He created him and destined for him;[1859]
data.arabic: مِن نُّطۡفَةٍ خَلَقَهُۥ فَقَدَّرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1859]- His proportions, provisions, life span, etc.

data.price: (20) Then He eased the way for him;[1860]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ ٱلسَّبِيلَ يَسَّرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1860]- Into this world (i.e., his birth) . It may also refer to life itself, which has been made easier by Allāh's guidance.

data.price: (21) Then He causes his death and provides a grave for him.[1861]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ أَمَاتَهُۥ فَأَقۡبَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1861]- To conceal his decaying body.

data.price: (22) Then when He wills, He will resurrect him.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِذَا شَآءَ أَنشَرَهُۥ

data.price: (23) No! He [i.e., man] has not yet accomplished what He commanded him.
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَمَّا يَقۡضِ مَآ أَمَرَهُۥ

data.price: (24) Then let mankind look at his food -
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِلَىٰ طَعَامِهِۦٓ

data.price: (25) How We poured down water in torrents,
data.arabic: أَنَّا صَبَبۡنَا ٱلۡمَآءَ صَبّٗا

data.price: (26) Then We broke open the earth, splitting [it with sprouts],
data.arabic: ثُمَّ شَقَقۡنَا ٱلۡأَرۡضَ شَقّٗا

data.price: (27) And caused to grow within it grain
data.arabic: فَأَنۢبَتۡنَا فِيهَا حَبّٗا

data.price: (28) And grapes and herbage
data.arabic: وَعِنَبٗا وَقَضۡبٗا

data.price: (29) And olive and palm trees
data.arabic: وَزَيۡتُونٗا وَنَخۡلٗا

data.price: (30) And gardens of dense shrubbery
data.arabic: وَحَدَآئِقَ غُلۡبٗا

data.price: (31) And fruit and grass -
data.arabic: وَفَٰكِهَةٗ وَأَبّٗا

data.price: (32) [As] enjoyment [i.e., provision] for you and your grazing livestock.
data.arabic: مَّتَٰعٗا لَّكُمۡ وَلِأَنۡعَٰمِكُمۡ

data.price: (33) But when there comes the Deafening Blast[1862]
data.arabic: فَإِذَا جَآءَتِ ٱلصَّآخَّةُ
data.footnotes: [1862]- The piercing blast of the Horn which signals resurrection. Aṣ-Ṣākhkhah is also a name for the Day of Resurrection.

data.price: (34) On the Day a man will flee from his brother
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَفِرُّ ٱلۡمَرۡءُ مِنۡ أَخِيهِ

data.price: (35) And his mother and his father
data.arabic: وَأُمِّهِۦ وَأَبِيهِ

data.price: (36) And his wife and his children,
data.arabic: وَصَٰحِبَتِهِۦ وَبَنِيهِ

data.price: (37) For every man, that Day, will be a matter adequate for him.[1863]
data.arabic: لِكُلِّ ٱمۡرِيٕٖ مِّنۡهُمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ شَأۡنٞ يُغۡنِيهِ
data.footnotes: [1863]- i.e., to occupy him. He will be concerned only with himself, thus forgetting all others.

data.price: (38) [Some] faces, that Day, will be bright -
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ مُّسۡفِرَةٞ

data.price: (39) Laughing, rejoicing at good news.
data.arabic: ضَاحِكَةٞ مُّسۡتَبۡشِرَةٞ

data.price: (40) And [other] faces, that Day, will have upon them dust.
data.arabic: وَوُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَلَيۡهَا غَبَرَةٞ

data.price: (41) Blackness will cover them.
data.arabic: تَرۡهَقُهَا قَتَرَةٌ

data.price: (42) Those are the disbelievers, the wicked ones.
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمُ ٱلۡكَفَرَةُ ٱلۡفَجَرَةُ

data.price: (1) When the sun is wrapped up [in darkness]
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلشَّمۡسُ كُوِّرَتۡ

data.price: (2) And when the stars fall, dispersing,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّجُومُ ٱنكَدَرَتۡ

data.price: (3) And when the mountains are removed
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجِبَالُ سُيِّرَتۡ

data.price: (4) And when full-term she-camels[1865] are neglected
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡعِشَارُ عُطِّلَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1865]- Those ten months pregnant and nearing delivery. This verse alludes to distraction from the most valued of possessions.

data.price: (5) And when the wild beasts are gathered
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡوُحُوشُ حُشِرَتۡ

data.price: (6) And when the seas are filled with flame[1866]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ سُجِّرَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1866]- Or "when the seas have overflowed [into each other]."

data.price: (7) And when the souls are paired[1867]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلنُّفُوسُ زُوِّجَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1867]- With another like soul. It can also mean "joined" (with their groups or sects) .

data.price: (8) And when the girl [who was] buried alive is asked
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡمَوۡءُۥدَةُ سُئِلَتۡ

data.price: (9) For what sin she was killed
data.arabic: بِأَيِّ ذَنۢبٖ قُتِلَتۡ

data.price: (10) And when the pages[1868] are spread [i.e., made public]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلصُّحُفُ نُشِرَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1868]- On which are recorded the deeds of all people.

data.price: (11) And when the sky is stripped away
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ كُشِطَتۡ

data.price: (12) And when Hellfire is set ablaze
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَحِيمُ سُعِّرَتۡ

data.price: (13) And when Paradise is brought near,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡجَنَّةُ أُزۡلِفَتۡ

data.price: (14) A soul will [then] know what it has brought [with it].[1869]
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّآ أَحۡضَرَتۡ
data.footnotes: [1869]- i.e., all of one's deeds from worldly life, which have accompanied the soul to the Hereafter.

data.price: (15) So I swear by the retreating stars -
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلۡخُنَّسِ

data.price: (16) Those that run [their courses] and disappear [i.e., set]
data.arabic: ٱلۡجَوَارِ ٱلۡكُنَّسِ

data.price: (17) And by the night as it closes in[1870]
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا عَسۡعَسَ
data.footnotes: [1870]- An alternative meaning is "as it departs."

data.price: (18) And by the dawn when it breathes [i.e., stirs]
data.arabic: وَٱلصُّبۡحِ إِذَا تَنَفَّسَ

data.price: (19) [That] indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a word [conveyed by] a noble messenger [i.e., Gabriel]
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلُ رَسُولٖ كَرِيمٖ

data.price: (20) [Who is] possessed of power and with the Owner of the Throne, secure [in position],
data.arabic: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ

data.price: (21) Obeyed there [in the heavens] and trustworthy.
data.arabic: مُّطَاعٖ ثَمَّ أَمِينٖ

data.price: (22) And your companion [i.e., Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) ] is not [at all] mad.[1871]
data.arabic: وَمَا صَاحِبُكُم بِمَجۡنُونٖ
data.footnotes: [1871]- Literally, "possessed by jinn."

data.price: (23) And he has already seen him [i.e., Gabriel] in the clear horizon.[1872]
data.arabic: وَلَقَدۡ رَءَاهُ بِٱلۡأُفُقِ ٱلۡمُبِينِ
data.footnotes: [1872]- i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote to 53:6.

data.price: (24) And he [i.e., Muḥammad (ﷺ)] is not a withholder of [knowledge of] the unseen.[1873]
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ عَلَى ٱلۡغَيۡبِ بِضَنِينٖ
data.footnotes: [1873]- Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) did not withhold that knowledge of the unseen which Allāh had revealed to him in the Qur’ān.

data.price: (25) And it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is not the word of a devil, expelled [from the heavens].
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِقَوۡلِ شَيۡطَٰنٖ رَّجِيمٖ

data.price: (26) So where are you going?[1874]
data.arabic: فَأَيۡنَ تَذۡهَبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1874]- In your denial of the Qur’ān and in your accusations against the Prophet (ﷺ) . The meaning is essentially "Surely, you have strayed far from Allāh's path."

data.price: (27) It is not except a reminder to the worlds
data.arabic: إِنۡ هُوَ إِلَّا ذِكۡرٞ لِّلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (28) For whoever wills among you to take a right course.
data.arabic: لِمَن شَآءَ مِنكُمۡ أَن يَسۡتَقِيمَ

data.price: (29) And you do not will except that Allāh wills - Lord of the worlds.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (1) When the sky breaks apart
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنفَطَرَتۡ

data.price: (2) And when the stars fall, scattering,
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡكَوَاكِبُ ٱنتَثَرَتۡ

data.price: (3) And when the seas are erupted
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡبِحَارُ فُجِّرَتۡ

data.price: (4) And when the [contents of] graves are scattered [i.e., exposed],
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡقُبُورُ بُعۡثِرَتۡ

data.price: (5) A soul will [then] know what it has put forth and kept back.
data.arabic: عَلِمَتۡ نَفۡسٞ مَّا قَدَّمَتۡ وَأَخَّرَتۡ

data.price: (6) O mankind, what has deceived you concerning your Lord, the Generous,
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا غَرَّكَ بِرَبِّكَ ٱلۡكَرِيمِ

data.price: (7) Who created you, proportioned you, and balanced you?
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَكَ فَسَوَّىٰكَ فَعَدَلَكَ

data.price: (8) In whatever form He willed has He assembled you.
data.arabic: فِيٓ أَيِّ صُورَةٖ مَّا شَآءَ رَكَّبَكَ

data.price: (9) No! But you deny the Recompense.
data.arabic: كَلَّا بَلۡ تُكَذِّبُونَ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (10) And indeed, [appointed] over you are keepers,[1876]
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ عَلَيۡكُمۡ لَحَٰفِظِينَ
data.footnotes: [1876]- Angels who preserve the deeds of men in records.

data.price: (11) Noble and recording;
data.arabic: كِرَامٗا كَٰتِبِينَ

data.price: (12) They know whatever you do.
data.arabic: يَعۡلَمُونَ مَا تَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: (13) Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٖ

data.price: (14) And indeed, the wicked will be in Hellfire.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ ٱلۡفُجَّارَ لَفِي جَحِيمٖ

data.price: (15) They will [enter to] burn therein on the Day of Recompense,
data.arabic: يَصۡلَوۡنَهَا يَوۡمَ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (16) And never therefrom will they be absent.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُمۡ عَنۡهَا بِغَآئِبِينَ

data.price: (17) And what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (18) Then, what can make you know what is the Day of Recompense?
data.arabic: ثُمَّ مَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا يَوۡمُ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (19) It is the Day when a soul will not possess for another soul [power to do] a thing; and the command, that Day, is [entirely] with Allāh.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ لَا تَمۡلِكُ نَفۡسٞ لِّنَفۡسٖ شَيۡـٔٗاۖ وَٱلۡأَمۡرُ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلَّهِ

data.price: (1) Woe to those who give less [than due],[1878]
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُطَفِّفِينَ
data.footnotes: [1878]- i.e., those who cheat people by giving them less than what they paid for when weighing or measuring - an amount so little as to hardly be noticed.

data.price: (2) Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ إِذَا ٱكۡتَالُواْ عَلَى ٱلنَّاسِ يَسۡتَوۡفُونَ

data.price: (3) But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا كَالُوهُمۡ أَو وَّزَنُوهُمۡ يُخۡسِرُونَ

data.price: (4) Do they not think that they will be resurrected
data.arabic: أَلَا يَظُنُّ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَنَّهُم مَّبۡعُوثُونَ

data.price: (5) For a tremendous Day -
data.arabic: لِيَوۡمٍ عَظِيمٖ

data.price: (6) The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَقُومُ ٱلنَّاسُ لِرَبِّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ

data.price: (7) No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡفُجَّارِ لَفِي سِجِّينٖ

data.price: (8) And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا سِجِّينٞ

data.price: (9) It is [their destination[1879] recorded in] a register inscribed.
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ
data.footnotes: [1879]- The lowest depths of Hell.

data.price: (10) Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لِّلۡمُكَذِّبِينَ

data.price: (11) Who deny the Day of Recompense.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ يُكَذِّبُونَ بِيَوۡمِ ٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (12) And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
data.arabic: وَمَا يُكَذِّبُ بِهِۦٓ إِلَّا كُلُّ مُعۡتَدٍ أَثِيمٍ

data.price: (13) When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
data.arabic: إِذَا تُتۡلَىٰ عَلَيۡهِ ءَايَٰتُنَا قَالَ أَسَٰطِيرُ ٱلۡأَوَّلِينَ

data.price: (14) No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.[1880]
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَلۡۜ رَانَ عَلَىٰ قُلُوبِهِم مَّا كَانُواْ يَكۡسِبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1880]- i.e., their sins.

data.price: (15) No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.[1881]
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّهُمۡ عَن رَّبِّهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّمَحۡجُوبُونَ
data.footnotes: [1881]- i.e., they will not be able to see Him.

data.price: (16) Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّهُمۡ لَصَالُواْ ٱلۡجَحِيمِ

data.price: (17) Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
data.arabic: ثُمَّ يُقَالُ هَٰذَا ٱلَّذِي كُنتُم بِهِۦ تُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (18) No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in ʿilliyyūn.
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ كِتَٰبَ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارِ لَفِي عِلِّيِّينَ

data.price: (19) And what can make you know what is ʿilliyyūn?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا عِلِّيُّونَ

data.price: (20) It is [their destination[1882] recorded in] a register inscribed
data.arabic: كِتَٰبٞ مَّرۡقُومٞ
data.footnotes: [1882]- The highest elevations of Paradise.

data.price: (21) Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allāh].
data.arabic: يَشۡهَدُهُ ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: (22) Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡأَبۡرَارَ لَفِي نَعِيمٍ

data.price: (23) On adorned couches, observing.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: (24) You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
data.arabic: تَعۡرِفُ فِي وُجُوهِهِمۡ نَضۡرَةَ ٱلنَّعِيمِ

data.price: (25) They will be given to drink [pure] wine[1883] [which was] sealed.
data.arabic: يُسۡقَوۡنَ مِن رَّحِيقٖ مَّخۡتُومٍ
data.footnotes: [1883]- Which is delicious and does not intoxicate.

data.price: (26) The last of it[1884] is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
data.arabic: خِتَٰمُهُۥ مِسۡكٞۚ وَفِي ذَٰلِكَ فَلۡيَتَنَافَسِ ٱلۡمُتَنَٰفِسُونَ
data.footnotes: [1884]- i.e., its lingering odor.

data.price: (27) And its mixture is of Tasneem,[1885]
data.arabic: وَمِزَاجُهُۥ مِن تَسۡنِيمٍ
data.footnotes: [1885]- The highest spring in Paradise and the most favored drink of its inhabitants.

data.price: (28) A spring from which those near [to Allāh] drink.
data.arabic: عَيۡنٗا يَشۡرَبُ بِهَا ٱلۡمُقَرَّبُونَ

data.price: (29) Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ أَجۡرَمُواْ كَانُواْ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ يَضۡحَكُونَ

data.price: (30) And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا مَرُّواْ بِهِمۡ يَتَغَامَزُونَ

data.price: (31) And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱنقَلَبُوٓاْ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِمُ ٱنقَلَبُواْ فَكِهِينَ

data.price: (32) And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
data.arabic: وَإِذَا رَأَوۡهُمۡ قَالُوٓاْ إِنَّ هَٰٓؤُلَآءِ لَضَآلُّونَ

data.price: (33) But they had not been sent as guardians over them.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُرۡسِلُواْ عَلَيۡهِمۡ حَٰفِظِينَ

data.price: (34) So Today[1886] those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
data.arabic: فَٱلۡيَوۡمَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ مِنَ ٱلۡكُفَّارِ يَضۡحَكُونَ
data.footnotes: [1886]- On the Day of Judgement.

data.price: (35) On adorned couches, observing.
data.arabic: عَلَى ٱلۡأَرَآئِكِ يَنظُرُونَ

data.price: (36) Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
data.arabic: هَلۡ ثُوِّبَ ٱلۡكُفَّارُ مَا كَانُواْ يَفۡعَلُونَ

data.price: (1) When the sky has split [open]
data.arabic: إِذَا ٱلسَّمَآءُ ٱنشَقَّتۡ

data.price: (2) And has listened [i.e., responded][1888] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so]
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [1888]- It will have heard Allāh's command and will have inclined immediately to compliance and willing obedience.

data.price: (3) And when the earth has been extended[1889]
data.arabic: وَإِذَا ٱلۡأَرۡضُ مُدَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [1889]- i.e., stretched flat and spread out.

data.price: (4) And has cast out that within it[1890] and relinquished [it]
data.arabic: وَأَلۡقَتۡ مَا فِيهَا وَتَخَلَّتۡ
data.footnotes: [1890]- Of the dead and all else buried therein.

data.price: (5) And has listened [i.e., responded] to its Lord and was obligated [to do so] –
data.arabic: وَأَذِنَتۡ لِرَبِّهَا وَحُقَّتۡ

data.price: (6) O mankind, indeed you are laboring toward your Lord with [great] exertion[1891] and will meet it.[1892]
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِنَّكَ كَادِحٌ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ كَدۡحٗا فَمُلَٰقِيهِ
data.footnotes:
[1891]- i.e., striving throughout your life until you meet your Lord, hastening toward death.
[1892]- i.e., you will find all that you intended and accomplished awaiting you in the Hereafter. Another meaning is "And will meet Him [i.e., your Lord]" and be recompensed in full by Him.

data.price: (7) Then as for he who is given his record in his right hand,
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ بِيَمِينِهِۦ

data.price: (8) He will be judged with an easy account
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يُحَاسَبُ حِسَابٗا يَسِيرٗا

data.price: (9) And return to his people in happiness.
data.arabic: وَيَنقَلِبُ إِلَىٰٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورٗا

data.price: (10) But as for he who is given his record behind his back,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ أُوتِيَ كِتَٰبَهُۥ وَرَآءَ ظَهۡرِهِۦ

data.price: (11) He will cry out for destruction
data.arabic: فَسَوۡفَ يَدۡعُواْ ثُبُورٗا

data.price: (12) And [enter to] burn in a Blaze.
data.arabic: وَيَصۡلَىٰ سَعِيرًا

data.price: (13) Indeed, he had [once] been among his people in happiness;
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ فِيٓ أَهۡلِهِۦ مَسۡرُورًا

data.price: (14) Indeed, he had thought he would never return [to Allāh].
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ ظَنَّ أَن لَّن يَحُورَ

data.price: (15) But yes! Indeed, his Lord was ever, of him, Seeing.
data.arabic: بَلَىٰٓۚ إِنَّ رَبَّهُۥ كَانَ بِهِۦ بَصِيرٗا

data.price: (16) So I swear by the twilight glow
data.arabic: فَلَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِٱلشَّفَقِ

data.price: (17) And [by] the night and what it envelops
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ وَمَا وَسَقَ

data.price: (18) And [by] the moon when it becomes full
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا ٱتَّسَقَ

data.price: (19) [That] you will surely embark upon [i.e., experience] state after state.[1893]
data.arabic: لَتَرۡكَبُنَّ طَبَقًا عَن طَبَقٖ
data.footnotes: [1893]- i.e., various stages, both in this life and in the Hereafter.

data.price: (20) So what is [the matter] with them [that] they do not believe,
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُمۡ لَا يُؤۡمِنُونَ

data.price: (21) And when the Qur’ān is recited to them, they do not prostrate [to Allāh]?
data.arabic: وَإِذَا قُرِئَ عَلَيۡهِمُ ٱلۡقُرۡءَانُ لَا يَسۡجُدُونَۤ۩

data.price: (22) But those who have disbelieved deny,
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ يُكَذِّبُونَ

data.price: (23) And Allāh is most knowing of what they keep within themselves.
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ أَعۡلَمُ بِمَا يُوعُونَ

data.price: (24) So give them tidings of a painful punishment,
data.arabic: فَبَشِّرۡهُم بِعَذَابٍ أَلِيمٍ

data.price: (25) Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds. For them is a reward uninterrupted.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونِۭ

data.price: (1) By the sky containing great stars
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡبُرُوجِ

data.price: (2) And [by] the promised Day
data.arabic: وَٱلۡيَوۡمِ ٱلۡمَوۡعُودِ

data.price: (3) And [by] the witness and what is witnessed,
data.arabic: وَشَاهِدٖ وَمَشۡهُودٖ

data.price: (4) Destroyed [i.e., cursed] were the companions of the trench[1895]
data.arabic: قُتِلَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡأُخۡدُودِ
data.footnotes: [1895]- Or "May they be destroyed" or "cursed." The "companions of the trench" (or ditch) were agents of a tyrannical king who refused to allow his people to believe in Allāh. Their evil deed in obedience to their ruler earned for them the curse of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

data.price: (5) [Containing] the fire full of fuel,
data.arabic: ٱلنَّارِ ذَاتِ ٱلۡوَقُودِ

data.price: (6) When they were sitting near it.
data.arabic: إِذۡ هُمۡ عَلَيۡهَا قُعُودٞ

data.price: (7) And they, to what they were doing against the believers, were witnesses. [1896]
data.arabic: وَهُمۡ عَلَىٰ مَا يَفۡعَلُونَ بِٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ شُهُودٞ
data.footnotes: [1896]- After casting the believers into a trench filled with fire, they sat at its edge, watching them burn to death. This event occurred before the time of Prophet Muḥammad (ﷺ) .

data.price: (8) And they resented them not except because they believed in Allāh, the Exalted in Might, the Praiseworthy,
data.arabic: وَمَا نَقَمُواْ مِنۡهُمۡ إِلَّآ أَن يُؤۡمِنُواْ بِٱللَّهِ ٱلۡعَزِيزِ ٱلۡحَمِيدِ

data.price: (9) To whom belongs the dominion of the heavens and the earth. And Allāh, over all things, is Witness.[1897]
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي لَهُۥ مُلۡكُ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضِۚ وَٱللَّهُ عَلَىٰ كُلِّ شَيۡءٖ شَهِيدٌ
data.footnotes: [1897]- See footnote to 4:79.

data.price: (10) Indeed, those who have tortured[1898] the believing men and believing women and then have not repented will have the punishment of Hell, and they will have the punishment of the Burning Fire.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ فَتَنُواْ ٱلۡمُؤۡمِنِينَ وَٱلۡمُؤۡمِنَٰتِ ثُمَّ لَمۡ يَتُوبُواْ فَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ جَهَنَّمَ وَلَهُمۡ عَذَابُ ٱلۡحَرِيقِ
data.footnotes: [1898]- Or, in this instance, the literal meaning of "burned" is also appropriate.

data.price: (11) Indeed, those who have believed and done righteous deeds will have gardens beneath which rivers flow. That is the great attainment.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ لَهُمۡ جَنَّٰتٞ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُۚ ذَٰلِكَ ٱلۡفَوۡزُ ٱلۡكَبِيرُ

data.price: (12) Indeed, the assault [i.e., vengeance] of your Lord is severe.
data.arabic: إِنَّ بَطۡشَ رَبِّكَ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: (13) Indeed, it is He who originates [creation] and repeats.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ هُوَ يُبۡدِئُ وَيُعِيدُ

data.price: (14) And He is the Forgiving, the Affectionate,
data.arabic: وَهُوَ ٱلۡغَفُورُ ٱلۡوَدُودُ

data.price: (15) Honorable Owner of the Throne,
data.arabic: ذُو ٱلۡعَرۡشِ ٱلۡمَجِيدُ

data.price: (16) Effecter of what He intends.
data.arabic: فَعَّالٞ لِّمَا يُرِيدُ

data.price: (17) Has there reached you the story of the soldiers -
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡجُنُودِ

data.price: (18) [Those of] Pharaoh and Thamūd?
data.arabic: فِرۡعَوۡنَ وَثَمُودَ

data.price: (19) But they who disbelieve are in [persistent] denial,
data.arabic: بَلِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ فِي تَكۡذِيبٖ

data.price: (20) While Allāh encompasses them from behind.[1899]
data.arabic: وَٱللَّهُ مِن وَرَآئِهِم مُّحِيطُۢ
data.footnotes: [1899]- See footnote to 2:19

data.price: (21) But this is an honored Qur’ān
data.arabic: بَلۡ هُوَ قُرۡءَانٞ مَّجِيدٞ

data.price: (22) [Inscribed] in a Preserved Slate.
data.arabic: فِي لَوۡحٖ مَّحۡفُوظِۭ

data.price: (1) By the sky and the knocker
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَٱلطَّارِقِ

data.price: (2) And what can make you know what is the knocker?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلطَّارِقُ

data.price: (3) It is the piercing star[1901].
data.arabic: ٱلنَّجۡمُ ٱلثَّاقِبُ
data.footnotes: [1901]- Whose light pierces through the darkness.

data.price: (4) There is no soul but that it has over it a protector.
data.arabic: إِن كُلُّ نَفۡسٖ لَّمَّا عَلَيۡهَا حَافِظٞ

data.price: (5) So let man observe from what he was created.
data.arabic: فَلۡيَنظُرِ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مِمَّ خُلِقَ

data.price: (6) He was created from a fluid, ejected,
data.arabic: خُلِقَ مِن مَّآءٖ دَافِقٖ

data.price: (7) Emerging from between the backbone and the ribs.
data.arabic: يَخۡرُجُ مِنۢ بَيۡنِ ٱلصُّلۡبِ وَٱلتَّرَآئِبِ

data.price: (8) Indeed, He [i.e., Allāh], to return him [to life], is Able.
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ رَجۡعِهِۦ لَقَادِرٞ

data.price: (9) The Day when secrets will be put on trial,[1902]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ تُبۡلَى ٱلسَّرَآئِرُ
data.footnotes: [1902]- i.e., exposed, examined and judged.

data.price: (10) Then he [i.e., man] will have no power or any helper.
data.arabic: فَمَا لَهُۥ مِن قُوَّةٖ وَلَا نَاصِرٖ

data.price: (11) By the sky which sends back[1903]
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ ذَاتِ ٱلرَّجۡعِ
data.footnotes: [1903]- Rain, heat, sound waves, etc.

data.price: (12) And [by] the earth which splits,[1904]
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ ذَاتِ ٱلصَّدۡعِ
data.footnotes: [1904]- With plant growth or from geological rifts.

data.price: (13) Indeed, it [i.e., the Qur’ān] is a decisive statement,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُۥ لَقَوۡلٞ فَصۡلٞ

data.price: (14) And it is not amusement.
data.arabic: وَمَا هُوَ بِٱلۡهَزۡلِ

data.price: (15) Indeed, they are planning a plan,
data.arabic: إِنَّهُمۡ يَكِيدُونَ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: (16) But I am planning a plan.
data.arabic: وَأَكِيدُ كَيۡدٗا

data.price: (17) So allow time for the disbelievers. Leave them awhile.[1905]
data.arabic: فَمَهِّلِ ٱلۡكَٰفِرِينَ أَمۡهِلۡهُمۡ رُوَيۡدَۢا
data.footnotes: [1905]- i.e., Do not be in haste for revenge, for you will see what will become of them.

data.price: (1) Exalt the name of your Lord, the Most High,
data.arabic: سَبِّحِ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّكَ ٱلۡأَعۡلَى

data.price: (2) Who created and proportioned
