data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ فَسَوَّىٰ

data.price: (3) And who destined and [then] guided
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِي قَدَّرَ فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: (4) And who brings out the pasture
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِيٓ أَخۡرَجَ ٱلۡمَرۡعَىٰ

data.price: (5) And [then] makes it black stubble.
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُۥ غُثَآءً أَحۡوَىٰ

data.price: (6) We will make you recite, [O Muḥammad], and you will not forget,
data.arabic: سَنُقۡرِئُكَ فَلَا تَنسَىٰٓ

data.price: (7) Except what Allāh should will. Indeed, He knows what is declared and what is hidden.
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَا شَآءَ ٱللَّهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ يَعۡلَمُ ٱلۡجَهۡرَ وَمَا يَخۡفَىٰ

data.price: (8) And We will ease you toward ease.[1907]
data.arabic: وَنُيَسِّرُكَ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1907]- To the path of Allāh's religion, which is easy and natural, or toward Paradise, by giving opportunities for righteous deeds.

data.price: (9) So remind, if the reminder should benefit;[1908]
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِن نَّفَعَتِ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1908]- i.e., wherever it will be heard and understood.

data.price: (10) He who fears [Allāh] will be reminded.
data.arabic: سَيَذَّكَّرُ مَن يَخۡشَىٰ

data.price: (11) But the wretched one will avoid it –
data.arabic: وَيَتَجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: (12) [He] who will [enter and] burn in the greatest Fire,
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يَصۡلَى ٱلنَّارَ ٱلۡكُبۡرَىٰ

data.price: (13) Neither dying therein nor living.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَا يَمُوتُ فِيهَا وَلَا يَحۡيَىٰ

data.price: (14) He has certainly succeeded who purifies himself
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن تَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: (15) And mentions the name of his Lord and prays.
data.arabic: وَذَكَرَ ٱسۡمَ رَبِّهِۦ فَصَلَّىٰ

data.price: (16) But you prefer the worldly life,
data.arabic: بَلۡ تُؤۡثِرُونَ ٱلۡحَيَوٰةَ ٱلدُّنۡيَا

data.price: (17) While the Hereafter is better and more enduring.
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ وَأَبۡقَىٰٓ

data.price: (18) Indeed, this is in the former scriptures,
data.arabic: إِنَّ هَٰذَا لَفِي ٱلصُّحُفِ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: (19) The scriptures of Abraham and Moses.
data.arabic: صُحُفِ إِبۡرَٰهِيمَ وَمُوسَىٰ

data.price: (1) Has there reached you the report of the Overwhelming [event]?
data.arabic: هَلۡ أَتَىٰكَ حَدِيثُ ٱلۡغَٰشِيَةِ

data.price: (2) [Some] faces, that Day, will be humbled,
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٍ خَٰشِعَةٌ

data.price: (3) Working [hard] and exhausted.[1910]
data.arabic: عَامِلَةٞ نَّاصِبَةٞ
data.footnotes: [1910]- Another accepted meaning is "They were working hard and exhausted," i.e., doing deeds during worldly life which did not benefit them since they were not accompanied by faith or done for the acceptance of Allāh (subḥānahu wa taʿālā) .

data.price: (4) They will [enter to] burn in an intensely hot Fire.
data.arabic: تَصۡلَىٰ نَارًا حَامِيَةٗ

data.price: (5) They will be given drink from a boiling spring.
data.arabic: تُسۡقَىٰ مِنۡ عَيۡنٍ ءَانِيَةٖ

data.price: (6) For them there will be no food except from a poisonous, thorny plant
data.arabic: لَّيۡسَ لَهُمۡ طَعَامٌ إِلَّا مِن ضَرِيعٖ

data.price: (7) Which neither nourishes nor avails against hunger.
data.arabic: لَّا يُسۡمِنُ وَلَا يُغۡنِي مِن جُوعٖ

data.price: (8) [Other] faces, that Day, will show pleasure.
data.arabic: وُجُوهٞ يَوۡمَئِذٖ نَّاعِمَةٞ

data.price: (9) With their effort [they are] satisfied
data.arabic: لِّسَعۡيِهَا رَاضِيَةٞ

data.price: (10) In an elevated garden,
data.arabic: فِي جَنَّةٍ عَالِيَةٖ

data.price: (11) Wherein they will hear no unsuitable speech.[1911]
data.arabic: لَّا تَسۡمَعُ فِيهَا لَٰغِيَةٗ
data.footnotes: [1911]- i.e., any insult, falsehood, immorality, idle or vain talk, etc.

data.price: (12) Within it is a flowing spring.
data.arabic: فِيهَا عَيۡنٞ جَارِيَةٞ

data.price: (13) Within it are couches raised high
data.arabic: فِيهَا سُرُرٞ مَّرۡفُوعَةٞ

data.price: (14) And cups put in place
data.arabic: وَأَكۡوَابٞ مَّوۡضُوعَةٞ

data.price: (15) And cushions lined up
data.arabic: وَنَمَارِقُ مَصۡفُوفَةٞ

data.price: (16) And carpets spread around.
data.arabic: وَزَرَابِيُّ مَبۡثُوثَةٌ

data.price: (17) Then do they not look at the camels - how they are created?
data.arabic: أَفَلَا يَنظُرُونَ إِلَى ٱلۡإِبِلِ كَيۡفَ خُلِقَتۡ

data.price: (18) And at the sky - how it is raised?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلسَّمَآءِ كَيۡفَ رُفِعَتۡ

data.price: (19) And at the mountains - how they are erected?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡجِبَالِ كَيۡفَ نُصِبَتۡ

data.price: (20) And at the earth - how it is spread out?
data.arabic: وَإِلَى ٱلۡأَرۡضِ كَيۡفَ سُطِحَتۡ

data.price: (21) So remind, [O Muḥammad]; you are only a reminder.
data.arabic: فَذَكِّرۡ إِنَّمَآ أَنتَ مُذَكِّرٞ

data.price: (22) You are not over them a controller.
data.arabic: لَّسۡتَ عَلَيۡهِم بِمُصَيۡطِرٍ

data.price: (23) However, he who turns away and disbelieves –
data.arabic: إِلَّا مَن تَوَلَّىٰ وَكَفَرَ

data.price: (24) Then Allāh will punish him with the greatest punishment.
data.arabic: فَيُعَذِّبُهُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلۡعَذَابَ ٱلۡأَكۡبَرَ

data.price: (25) Indeed, to Us is their return.
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَيۡنَآ إِيَابَهُمۡ

data.price: (26) Then indeed, upon Us is their account.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا حِسَابَهُم

data.price: (1) By the dawn
data.arabic: وَٱلۡفَجۡرِ

data.price: (2) And [by] ten nights[1913]
data.arabic: وَلَيَالٍ عَشۡرٖ
data.footnotes: [1913]- Usually interpreted as the first ten nights of the month of Dhul-Ḥijjah.

data.price: (3) And [by] the even [number] and the odd
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّفۡعِ وَٱلۡوَتۡرِ

data.price: (4) And [by] the night when it passes,
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَسۡرِ

data.price: (5) Is there [not] in [all] that an oath [sufficient] for one of perception?[1914]
data.arabic: هَلۡ فِي ذَٰلِكَ قَسَمٞ لِّذِي حِجۡرٍ
data.footnotes: [1914]- Based upon the following verses, what has been sworn to by Allāh is that He will certainly punish the disbelievers.

data.price: (6) Have you not considered how your Lord dealt with ʿAad -
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِعَادٍ

data.price: (7) [With] Iram[1915] - who had lofty pillars,[1916]
data.arabic: إِرَمَ ذَاتِ ٱلۡعِمَادِ
data.footnotes:
[1915]- Another name for the first people of ʿAad, to whom Prophet Hūd was sent.
[1916]- Supporting their tents or buildings.

data.price: (8) The likes of whom had never been created in the land?
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي لَمۡ يُخۡلَقۡ مِثۡلُهَا فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: (9) And [with] Thamūd, who carved out the rocks in the valley?
data.arabic: وَثَمُودَ ٱلَّذِينَ جَابُواْ ٱلصَّخۡرَ بِٱلۡوَادِ

data.price: (10) And [with] Pharaoh, owner of the stakes?[1917]
data.arabic: وَفِرۡعَوۡنَ ذِي ٱلۡأَوۡتَادِ
data.footnotes: [1917]- By which he tortured people.

data.price: (11) [All of] whom oppressed within the lands
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ طَغَوۡاْ فِي ٱلۡبِلَٰدِ

data.price: (12) And increased therein the corruption.
data.arabic: فَأَكۡثَرُواْ فِيهَا ٱلۡفَسَادَ

data.price: (13) So your Lord poured upon them a scourge of punishment.
data.arabic: فَصَبَّ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّكَ سَوۡطَ عَذَابٍ

data.price: (14) Indeed, your Lord is in observation.
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكَ لَبِٱلۡمِرۡصَادِ

data.price: (15) And as for man, when his Lord tries him and [thus] is generous to him and favors him, he says, "My Lord has honored me."[1918]
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ رَبُّهُۥ فَأَكۡرَمَهُۥ وَنَعَّمَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَكۡرَمَنِ
data.footnotes: [1918]- He is proud rather than grateful, attributing the favor to his own merit.

data.price: (16) But when He tries him and restricts his provision, he says, "My Lord has humiliated me."
data.arabic: وَأَمَّآ إِذَا مَا ٱبۡتَلَىٰهُ فَقَدَرَ عَلَيۡهِ رِزۡقَهُۥ فَيَقُولُ رَبِّيٓ أَهَٰنَنِ

data.price: (17) No![1919] But you do not honor the orphan
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ بَل لَّا تُكۡرِمُونَ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ
data.footnotes: [1919]- It is not like you imagine. Rather, Allāh tries people through prosperity and hardship and rewards both gratitude and patience with honor in the Hereafter.

data.price: (18) And you do not encourage one another to feed the poor.
data.arabic: وَلَا تَحَٰٓضُّونَ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: (19) And you consume inheritance, devouring [it] altogether,[1920]
data.arabic: وَتَأۡكُلُونَ ٱلتُّرَاثَ أَكۡلٗا لَّمّٗا
data.footnotes: [1920]- Not caring whether it is lawful or unlawful.

data.price: (20) And you love wealth with immense love.
data.arabic: وَتُحِبُّونَ ٱلۡمَالَ حُبّٗا جَمّٗا

data.price: (21) No! When the earth has been leveled - pounded and crushed
data.arabic: كَلَّآۖ إِذَا دُكَّتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ دَكّٗا دَكّٗا

data.price: (22) And your Lord has come[1921] and the angels, rank upon rank,
data.arabic: وَجَآءَ رَبُّكَ وَٱلۡمَلَكُ صَفّٗا صَفّٗا
data.footnotes: [1921]- To pass judgement. See footnote to 2:19.

data.price: (23) And brought [within view], that Day, is Hell - that Day, man will remember, but how [i.e., what good] to him will be the remembrance?
data.arabic: وَجِاْيٓءَ يَوۡمَئِذِۭ بِجَهَنَّمَۚ يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَتَذَكَّرُ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ وَأَنَّىٰ لَهُ ٱلذِّكۡرَىٰ

data.price: (24) He will say, "Oh, I wish I had sent ahead [some good] for my life."[1922]
data.arabic: يَقُولُ يَٰلَيۡتَنِي قَدَّمۡتُ لِحَيَاتِي
data.footnotes: [1922]- The everlasting life of the Hereafter.

data.price: (25) So on that Day, none will punish [as severely] as His punishment,
data.arabic: فَيَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّا يُعَذِّبُ عَذَابَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: (26) And none will bind [as severely] as His binding [of the evildoers].
data.arabic: وَلَا يُوثِقُ وَثَاقَهُۥٓ أَحَدٞ

data.price: (27) [To the righteous it will be said], "O reassured soul,
data.arabic: يَٰٓأَيَّتُهَا ٱلنَّفۡسُ ٱلۡمُطۡمَئِنَّةُ

data.price: (28) Return to your Lord, well-pleased and pleasing [to Him],
data.arabic: ٱرۡجِعِيٓ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكِ رَاضِيَةٗ مَّرۡضِيَّةٗ

data.price: (29) And enter among My [righteous] servants
data.arabic: فَٱدۡخُلِي فِي عِبَٰدِي

data.price: (30) And enter My Paradise."
data.arabic: وَٱدۡخُلِي جَنَّتِي

data.price: (1) I swear by this city [i.e., Makkah] –
data.arabic: لَآ أُقۡسِمُ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

data.price: (2) And you, [O Muḥammad], are free of restriction in this city –
data.arabic: وَأَنتَ حِلُّۢ بِهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ

data.price: (3) And [by] the father[1924] and that which was born [of him],
data.arabic: وَوَالِدٖ وَمَا وَلَدَ
data.footnotes: [1924]- Said to be Adam (upon him be peace) .

data.price: (4) We have certainly created man into hardship.
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِي كَبَدٍ

data.price: (5) Does he think that never will anyone overcome him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّن يَقۡدِرَ عَلَيۡهِ أَحَدٞ

data.price: (6) He says, "I have spent wealth in abundance."
data.arabic: يَقُولُ أَهۡلَكۡتُ مَالٗا لُّبَدًا

data.price: (7) Does he think that no one has seen him?
data.arabic: أَيَحۡسَبُ أَن لَّمۡ يَرَهُۥٓ أَحَدٌ

data.price: (8) Have We not made for him two eyes?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَجۡعَل لَّهُۥ عَيۡنَيۡنِ

data.price: (9) And a tongue and two lips?
data.arabic: وَلِسَانٗا وَشَفَتَيۡنِ

data.price: (10) And have shown him the two ways?[1925]
data.arabic: وَهَدَيۡنَٰهُ ٱلنَّجۡدَيۡنِ
data.footnotes: [1925]- Of good and evil.

data.price: (11) But he has not broken through the difficult pass.[1926]
data.arabic: فَلَا ٱقۡتَحَمَ ٱلۡعَقَبَةَ
data.footnotes: [1926]- i.e., the steep incline or obstacle. In other words, he has not spent in the cause of Allāh but only boasts of spending in front of others.

data.price: (12) And what can make you know what is [breaking through] the difficult pass?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡعَقَبَةُ

data.price: (13) It is the freeing of a slave
data.arabic: فَكُّ رَقَبَةٍ

data.price: (14) Or feeding on a day of severe hunger
data.arabic: أَوۡ إِطۡعَٰمٞ فِي يَوۡمٖ ذِي مَسۡغَبَةٖ

data.price: (15) An orphan of near relationship
data.arabic: يَتِيمٗا ذَا مَقۡرَبَةٍ

data.price: (16) Or a needy person in misery
data.arabic: أَوۡ مِسۡكِينٗا ذَا مَتۡرَبَةٖ

data.price: (17) And then being among those who believed and advised one another to patience and advised one another to compassion.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَانَ مِنَ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡمَرۡحَمَةِ

data.price: (18) Those are the companions of the right.[1927]
data.arabic: أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَيۡمَنَةِ
data.footnotes: [1927]- Or "the companions of good fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their right hands and proceed to Paradise.

data.price: (19) But they who disbelieved in Our signs - those are the companions of the left.[1928]
data.arabic: وَٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ بِـَٔايَٰتِنَا هُمۡ أَصۡحَٰبُ ٱلۡمَشۡـَٔمَةِ
data.footnotes: [1928]- Or "the companions of ill fortune," i.e., those who receive their records in their left hands and proceed to Hell.

data.price: (20) Over them will be fire closed in.[1929]
data.arabic: عَلَيۡهِمۡ نَارٞ مُّؤۡصَدَةُۢ
data.footnotes: [1929]- The cover over Hell will be sealed and locked, containing its fire and its inhabitants.

data.price: (1) By the sun and its brightness
data.arabic: وَٱلشَّمۡسِ وَضُحَىٰهَا

data.price: (2) And [by] the moon when it follows it
data.arabic: وَٱلۡقَمَرِ إِذَا تَلَىٰهَا

data.price: (3) And [by] the day when it displays it[1931]
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا جَلَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1931]- The earth. Also interpreted as the sun. The same applies to the following verse.

data.price: (4) And [by] the night when it covers [i.e., conceals] it
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰهَا

data.price: (5) And [by] the sky and He who constructed it
data.arabic: وَٱلسَّمَآءِ وَمَا بَنَىٰهَا

data.price: (6) And [by] the earth and He who spread it
data.arabic: وَٱلۡأَرۡضِ وَمَا طَحَىٰهَا

data.price: (7) And [by] the soul and He who proportioned it[1932]
data.arabic: وَنَفۡسٖ وَمَا سَوَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1932]- i.e., balanced and refined it, creating in it sound tendencies and consciousness.

data.price: (8) And inspired it [with discernment of] its wickedness and its righteousness,
data.arabic: فَأَلۡهَمَهَا فُجُورَهَا وَتَقۡوَىٰهَا

data.price: (9) He has succeeded who purifies it,
data.arabic: قَدۡ أَفۡلَحَ مَن زَكَّىٰهَا

data.price: (10) And he has failed who instills it [with corruption].
data.arabic: وَقَدۡ خَابَ مَن دَسَّىٰهَا

data.price: (11) Thamūd denied [their prophet] by reason of their transgression,
data.arabic: كَذَّبَتۡ ثَمُودُ بِطَغۡوَىٰهَآ

data.price: (12) When the most wretched of them was sent forth.[1933]
data.arabic: إِذِ ٱنۢبَعَثَ أَشۡقَىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1933]- To hamstring the she-camel which had been sent by Allāh as a sign to them.

data.price: (13) And the messenger of Allāh [i.e., Ṣāliḥ] said to them, "[Do not harm] the she-camel of Allāh or [prevent her from] her drink."
data.arabic: فَقَالَ لَهُمۡ رَسُولُ ٱللَّهِ نَاقَةَ ٱللَّهِ وَسُقۡيَٰهَا

data.price: (14) But they denied him and hamstrung[1934] her. So their Lord brought down upon them destruction for their sin and made it equal [upon all of them].
data.arabic: فَكَذَّبُوهُ فَعَقَرُوهَا فَدَمۡدَمَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ رَبُّهُم بِذَنۢبِهِمۡ فَسَوَّىٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1934]- And then killed.

data.price: (15) And He does not fear the consequence thereof.[1935]
data.arabic: وَلَا يَخَافُ عُقۡبَٰهَا
data.footnotes: [1935]- Allāh is not asked about what He does, but His servants will be asked. See 21:23.

data.price: (1) By the night when it covers[1937]
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا يَغۡشَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1937]- With darkness.

data.price: (2) And [by] the day when it appears
data.arabic: وَٱلنَّهَارِ إِذَا تَجَلَّىٰ

data.price: (3) And [by] He who created the male and female,
data.arabic: وَمَا خَلَقَ ٱلذَّكَرَ وَٱلۡأُنثَىٰٓ

data.price: (4) Indeed, your efforts are diverse.
data.arabic: إِنَّ سَعۡيَكُمۡ لَشَتَّىٰ

data.price: (5) As for he who gives and fears Allāh
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَنۡ أَعۡطَىٰ وَٱتَّقَىٰ

data.price: (6) And believes in the best [reward].
data.arabic: وَصَدَّقَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

data.price: (7) We will ease him toward ease.
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡيُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: (8) But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۢ بَخِلَ وَٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: (9) And denies the best [reward],
data.arabic: وَكَذَّبَ بِٱلۡحُسۡنَىٰ

data.price: (10) We will ease him toward difficulty.
data.arabic: فَسَنُيَسِّرُهُۥ لِلۡعُسۡرَىٰ

data.price: (11) And what will his wealth avail him when he falls?[1938]
data.arabic: وَمَا يُغۡنِي عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥٓ إِذَا تَرَدَّىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [1938]- i.e., when he dies or is destroyed. It can also mean when he falls into the Hellfire.

data.price: (12) Indeed, [incumbent] upon Us is guidance.
data.arabic: إِنَّ عَلَيۡنَا لَلۡهُدَىٰ

data.price: (13) And indeed, to us belongs the Hereafter and the first [life].
data.arabic: وَإِنَّ لَنَا لَلۡأٓخِرَةَ وَٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: (14) So I have warned you of a Fire which is blazing.
data.arabic: فَأَنذَرۡتُكُمۡ نَارٗا تَلَظَّىٰ

data.price: (15) None will [enter to] burn therein except the most wretched one
data.arabic: لَا يَصۡلَىٰهَآ إِلَّا ٱلۡأَشۡقَى

data.price: (16) Who had denied and turned away.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰ

data.price: (17) But the righteous one will avoid it –
data.arabic: وَسَيُجَنَّبُهَا ٱلۡأَتۡقَى

data.price: (18) [He] who gives [from] his wealth to purify himself
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُؤۡتِي مَالَهُۥ يَتَزَكَّىٰ

data.price: (19) And not [giving] for anyone who has [done him] a favor to be rewarded[1939] –
data.arabic: وَمَا لِأَحَدٍ عِندَهُۥ مِن نِّعۡمَةٖ تُجۡزَىٰٓ
data.footnotes: [1939]- i.e., without intending reciprocation for some benefit to himself.

data.price: (20) But only seeking the face [i.e., acceptance] of his Lord, Most High.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱبۡتِغَآءَ وَجۡهِ رَبِّهِ ٱلۡأَعۡلَىٰ

data.price: (21) And he is going to be satisfied.
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يَرۡضَىٰ

data.price: (1) By the morning brightness
data.arabic: وَٱلضُّحَىٰ

data.price: (2) And [by] the night when it covers with darkness,[1941]
data.arabic: وَٱلَّيۡلِ إِذَا سَجَىٰ
data.footnotes: [1941]- And becomes still.

data.price: (3) Your Lord has not taken leave of you, [O Muḥammad], nor has He detested [you].
data.arabic: مَا وَدَّعَكَ رَبُّكَ وَمَا قَلَىٰ

data.price: (4) And the Hereafter is better for you than the first [life].
data.arabic: وَلَلۡأٓخِرَةُ خَيۡرٞ لَّكَ مِنَ ٱلۡأُولَىٰ

data.price: (5) And your Lord is going to give you, and you will be satisfied.
data.arabic: وَلَسَوۡفَ يُعۡطِيكَ رَبُّكَ فَتَرۡضَىٰٓ

data.price: (6) Did He not find you an orphan and give [you] refuge?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجِدۡكَ يَتِيمٗا فَـَٔاوَىٰ

data.price: (7) And He found you lost and guided [you],
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ ضَآلّٗا فَهَدَىٰ

data.price: (8) And He found you poor and made [you] self-sufficient.
data.arabic: وَوَجَدَكَ عَآئِلٗا فَأَغۡنَىٰ

data.price: (9) So as for the orphan, do not oppress [him].
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا ٱلۡيَتِيمَ فَلَا تَقۡهَرۡ

data.price: (10) And as for the petitioner,[1942] do not repel [him].
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا ٱلسَّآئِلَ فَلَا تَنۡهَرۡ
data.footnotes: [1942]- Anyone who seeks aid or knowledge.

data.price: (11) But as for the favor of your Lord, report [it].
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا بِنِعۡمَةِ رَبِّكَ فَحَدِّثۡ

data.price: (1) Did We not expand for you, [O Muḥammad], your breast?[1944]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ نَشۡرَحۡ لَكَ صَدۡرَكَ
data.footnotes: [1944]- i.e., enlighten, assure and gladden your heart with guidance.

data.price: (2) And We removed from you your burden[1945]
data.arabic: وَوَضَعۡنَا عَنكَ وِزۡرَكَ
data.footnotes: [1945]- By forgiving any errors which you may have committed previously or might commit consequently. "Burden" can also refer to the anxiety experienced by the Prophet (ﷺ) at the beginning of his mission.

data.price: (3) Which had weighed upon your back
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَنقَضَ ظَهۡرَكَ

data.price: (4) And raised high for you your repute.
data.arabic: وَرَفَعۡنَا لَكَ ذِكۡرَكَ

data.price: (5) For indeed, with hardship [will be] ease [i.e., relief].
data.arabic: فَإِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرًا

data.price: (6) Indeed, with hardship [will be] ease.
data.arabic: إِنَّ مَعَ ٱلۡعُسۡرِ يُسۡرٗا

data.price: (7) So when you have finished [your duties], then stand up [for worship].
data.arabic: فَإِذَا فَرَغۡتَ فَٱنصَبۡ

data.price: (8) And to your Lord direct [your] longing.
data.arabic: وَإِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ فَٱرۡغَب

data.price: (1) By the fig and the olive[1947]
data.arabic: وَٱلتِّينِ وَٱلزَّيۡتُونِ
data.footnotes: [1947]- Referring to the places known for their production, i.e., Damascus and Jerusalem, respectively. It could also refer to the fig and olive trees or to the fruits themselves.

data.price: (2) And [by] Mount Sinai
data.arabic: وَطُورِ سِينِينَ

data.price: (3) And [by] this secure city [i.e., Makkah],
data.arabic: وَهَٰذَا ٱلۡبَلَدِ ٱلۡأَمِينِ

data.price: (4) We have certainly created man in the best of stature;[1948]
data.arabic: لَقَدۡ خَلَقۡنَا ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ فِيٓ أَحۡسَنِ تَقۡوِيمٖ
data.footnotes: [1948]- i.e., upright, symmetrical, and balanced in form and nature.

data.price: (5) Then We return him to the lowest of the low,[1949]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ رَدَدۡنَٰهُ أَسۡفَلَ سَٰفِلِينَ
data.footnotes: [1949]- This can refer to the depths of Hell, to decrepit old age or to immorality.

data.price: (6) Except for those who believe and do righteous deeds, for they will have a reward uninterrupted.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ فَلَهُمۡ أَجۡرٌ غَيۡرُ مَمۡنُونٖ

data.price: (7) So what yet causes you to deny the Recompense?[1950]
data.arabic: فَمَا يُكَذِّبُكَ بَعۡدُ بِٱلدِّينِ
data.footnotes: [1950]- More literally, "What makes you lie concerning it?"

data.price: (8) Is not Allāh the most just of judges?
data.arabic: أَلَيۡسَ ٱللَّهُ بِأَحۡكَمِ ٱلۡحَٰكِمِينَ

data.price: (1) Recite in the name of your Lord who created –
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ بِٱسۡمِ رَبِّكَ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ

data.price: (2) Created man from a clinging substance.
data.arabic: خَلَقَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مِنۡ عَلَقٍ

data.price: (3) Recite, and your Lord is the most Generous -
data.arabic: ٱقۡرَأۡ وَرَبُّكَ ٱلۡأَكۡرَمُ

data.price: (4) Who taught by the pen –
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي عَلَّمَ بِٱلۡقَلَمِ

data.price: (5) Taught man that which he knew not.
data.arabic: عَلَّمَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ مَا لَمۡ يَعۡلَمۡ

data.price: (6) No! [But] indeed, man transgresses
data.arabic: كَلَّآ إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَيَطۡغَىٰٓ

data.price: (7) Because he sees himself self-sufficient.
data.arabic: أَن رَّءَاهُ ٱسۡتَغۡنَىٰٓ

data.price: (8) Indeed, to your Lord is the return.
data.arabic: إِنَّ إِلَىٰ رَبِّكَ ٱلرُّجۡعَىٰٓ

data.price: (9) Have you seen the one who forbids
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يَنۡهَىٰ

data.price: (10) A servant when he prays?
data.arabic: عَبۡدًا إِذَا صَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: (11) Have you seen if he is upon guidance
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَانَ عَلَى ٱلۡهُدَىٰٓ

data.price: (12) Or enjoins righteousness?
data.arabic: أَوۡ أَمَرَ بِٱلتَّقۡوَىٰٓ

data.price: (13) Have you seen if he denies and turns away -
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ إِن كَذَّبَ وَتَوَلَّىٰٓ

data.price: (14) Does he not know that Allāh sees?
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَعۡلَم بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يَرَىٰ

data.price: (15) No! If he does not desist, We will surely drag him by the forelock[1952] –
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَئِن لَّمۡ يَنتَهِ لَنَسۡفَعَۢا بِٱلنَّاصِيَةِ
data.footnotes: [1952]- It may also mean "slap him" or "blacken his face at the forelock."

data.price: (16) A lying, sinning forelock.
data.arabic: نَاصِيَةٖ كَٰذِبَةٍ خَاطِئَةٖ

data.price: (17) Then let him call his associates;
data.arabic: فَلۡيَدۡعُ نَادِيَهُۥ

data.price: (18) We will call the angels of Hell.[1953]
data.arabic: سَنَدۡعُ ٱلزَّبَانِيَةَ
data.footnotes: [1953]- Those who push the wicked into the Fire.

data.price: (19) No! Do not obey him. But prostrate and draw near [to Allāh].
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَا تُطِعۡهُ وَٱسۡجُدۡۤ وَٱقۡتَرِب۩

data.price: (1) Indeed, We sent it [i.e., the Qur’ān] down during the Night of Decree.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَنزَلۡنَٰهُ فِي لَيۡلَةِ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ

data.price: (2) And what can make you know what is the Night of Decree?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ

data.price: (3) The Night of Decree is better than a thousand months.
data.arabic: لَيۡلَةُ ٱلۡقَدۡرِ خَيۡرٞ مِّنۡ أَلۡفِ شَهۡرٖ

data.price: (4) The angels and the Spirit [i.e., Gabriel] descend therein by permission of their Lord for every matter.[1955]
data.arabic: تَنَزَّلُ ٱلۡمَلَٰٓئِكَةُ وَٱلرُّوحُ فِيهَا بِإِذۡنِ رَبِّهِم مِّن كُلِّ أَمۡرٖ
data.footnotes: [1955]- Bringing the exact measures apportioned for everything by Allāh in the course of the coming year.

data.price: (5) Peace it is[1956] until the emergence of dawn.
data.arabic: سَلَٰمٌ هِيَ حَتَّىٰ مَطۡلَعِ ٱلۡفَجۡرِ
data.footnotes: [1956]- Upon the believers.

data.price: (1) Those who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists were not to be parted [from misbelief][1958] until there came to them clear evidence –
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَكُنِ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ مُنفَكِّينَ حَتَّىٰ تَأۡتِيَهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
data.footnotes: [1958]- i.e., from their erroneous beliefs and superstitions.

data.price: (2) A Messenger from Allāh, reciting purified[1959] scriptures
data.arabic: رَسُولٞ مِّنَ ٱللَّهِ يَتۡلُواْ صُحُفٗا مُّطَهَّرَةٗ
data.footnotes: [1959]- i.e., containing no falsehood.

data.price: (3) Within which are correct writings [i.e., rulings and laws].
data.arabic: فِيهَا كُتُبٞ قَيِّمَةٞ

data.price: (4) Nor did those who were given the Scripture become divided[1960] until after there had come to them clear evidence.
data.arabic: وَمَا تَفَرَّقَ ٱلَّذِينَ أُوتُواْ ٱلۡكِتَٰبَ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ مَا جَآءَتۡهُمُ ٱلۡبَيِّنَةُ
data.footnotes: [1960]- Into sects and denominations.

data.price: (5) And they were not commanded except to worship Allāh, [being] sincere to Him in religion, inclining to truth, and to establish prayer and to give zakāh. And that is the correct religion.
data.arabic: وَمَآ أُمِرُوٓاْ إِلَّا لِيَعۡبُدُواْ ٱللَّهَ مُخۡلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ حُنَفَآءَ وَيُقِيمُواْ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَيُؤۡتُواْ ٱلزَّكَوٰةَۚ وَذَٰلِكَ دِينُ ٱلۡقَيِّمَةِ

data.price: (6) Indeed, they who disbelieved among the People of the Scripture and the polytheists will be in the fire of Hell, abiding eternally therein. Those are the worst of creatures.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ كَفَرُواْ مِنۡ أَهۡلِ ٱلۡكِتَٰبِ وَٱلۡمُشۡرِكِينَ فِي نَارِ جَهَنَّمَ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآۚ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ شَرُّ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ

data.price: (7) Indeed, they who have believed and done righteous deeds - those are the best of creatures.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ أُوْلَٰٓئِكَ هُمۡ خَيۡرُ ٱلۡبَرِيَّةِ

data.price: (8) Their reward with their Lord will be gardens of perpetual residence beneath which rivers flow, wherein they will abide forever, Allāh being pleased with them and they with Him. That is for whoever has feared his Lord.
data.arabic: جَزَآؤُهُمۡ عِندَ رَبِّهِمۡ جَنَّٰتُ عَدۡنٖ تَجۡرِي مِن تَحۡتِهَا ٱلۡأَنۡهَٰرُ خَٰلِدِينَ فِيهَآ أَبَدٗاۖ رَّضِيَ ٱللَّهُ عَنۡهُمۡ وَرَضُواْ عَنۡهُۚ ذَٰلِكَ لِمَنۡ خَشِيَ رَبَّهُۥ

data.price: (1) When the earth is shaken with its [final] earthquake
data.arabic: إِذَا زُلۡزِلَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ زِلۡزَالَهَا

data.price: (2) And the earth discharges its burdens[1962]
data.arabic: وَأَخۡرَجَتِ ٱلۡأَرۡضُ أَثۡقَالَهَا
data.footnotes: [1962]- See verse 84:4.

data.price: (3) And man says,[1963] "What is [wrong] with it?" -
data.arabic: وَقَالَ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنُ مَا لَهَا
data.footnotes: [1963]- In terror and amazement.

data.price: (4) That Day, it will report its news
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ تُحَدِّثُ أَخۡبَارَهَا

data.price: (5) Because your Lord has inspired [i.e., commanded] it.
data.arabic: بِأَنَّ رَبَّكَ أَوۡحَىٰ لَهَا

data.price: (6) That Day, the people will depart[1964] separated [into categories] to be shown [the result of] their deeds.
data.arabic: يَوۡمَئِذٖ يَصۡدُرُ ٱلنَّاسُ أَشۡتَاتٗا لِّيُرَوۡاْ أَعۡمَٰلَهُمۡ
data.footnotes: [1964]- From the place of Judgement to their final abode. Another interpretation is "emerge separately" (from the graves) .

data.price: (7) So whoever does an atom's weight[1965] of good will see it,
data.arabic: فَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٍ خَيۡرٗا يَرَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1965]- Or "the weight of a small ant."

data.price: (8) And whoever does an atom's weight of evil will see it.
data.arabic: وَمَن يَعۡمَلۡ مِثۡقَالَ ذَرَّةٖ شَرّٗا يَرَهُۥ

data.price: (1) By the racers, panting,[1967]
data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَٰدِيَٰتِ ضَبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [1967]- i.e., the horses bearing riders as they race to attack the enemy.

data.price: (2) And the producers of sparks [when] striking[1968]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُورِيَٰتِ قَدۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [1968]- Their hoofs while galloping over rocky terrain.

data.price: (3) And the chargers at dawn,[1969]
data.arabic: فَٱلۡمُغِيرَٰتِ صُبۡحٗا
data.footnotes: [1969]- While the enemy is unaware.

data.price: (4) Stirring up thereby [clouds of] dust,
data.arabic: فَأَثَرۡنَ بِهِۦ نَقۡعٗا

data.price: (5) Arriving thereby in the center[1970] collectively,
data.arabic: فَوَسَطۡنَ بِهِۦ جَمۡعًا
data.footnotes: [1970]- i.e., penetrating into the enemy ranks during a surprise attack.

data.price: (6) Indeed mankind, to his Lord, is ungrateful.
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لِرَبِّهِۦ لَكَنُودٞ

data.price: (7) And indeed, he is to that a witness.[1971]
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ عَلَىٰ ذَٰلِكَ لَشَهِيدٞ
data.footnotes: [1971]- Through his speech and his actions.

data.price: (8) And indeed he is, in love of wealth, intense.
data.arabic: وَإِنَّهُۥ لِحُبِّ ٱلۡخَيۡرِ لَشَدِيدٌ

data.price: (9) But does he not know that when the contents of the graves are scattered
data.arabic: ۞ أَفَلَا يَعۡلَمُ إِذَا بُعۡثِرَ مَا فِي ٱلۡقُبُورِ

data.price: (10) And that within the breasts is obtained,[1972]
data.arabic: وَحُصِّلَ مَا فِي ٱلصُّدُورِ
data.footnotes: [1972]- i.e., when all secrets are made known.

data.price: (11) Indeed, their Lord with them, that Day, is [fully] Aware.[1973]
data.arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّهُم بِهِمۡ يَوۡمَئِذٖ لَّخَبِيرُۢ
data.footnotes: [1973]- Fully acquainted and familiar with everything about each one of them.

data.price: (1) The Striking Calamity -
data.arabic: ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: (2) What is the Striking Calamity?
data.arabic: مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: (3) And what can make you know what is the Striking Calamity?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡقَارِعَةُ

data.price: (4) It is the Day when people will be like moths, dispersed,[1975]
data.arabic: يَوۡمَ يَكُونُ ٱلنَّاسُ كَٱلۡفَرَاشِ ٱلۡمَبۡثُوثِ
data.footnotes: [1975]- The people will be as such after having been expelled from their graves.

data.price: (5) And the mountains will be like wool, fluffed up.[1976]
data.arabic: وَتَكُونُ ٱلۡجِبَالُ كَٱلۡعِهۡنِ ٱلۡمَنفُوشِ
data.footnotes: [1976]- i.e., beginning to disintegrate.

data.price: (6) Then as for one whose scales are heavy [with good deeds],
data.arabic: فَأَمَّا مَن ثَقُلَتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ

data.price: (7) He will be in a pleasant life.
data.arabic: فَهُوَ فِي عِيشَةٖ رَّاضِيَةٖ

data.price: (8) But as for one whose scales are light,
data.arabic: وَأَمَّا مَنۡ خَفَّتۡ مَوَٰزِينُهُۥ

data.price: (9) His refuge[1977] will be an abyss.[1978]
data.arabic: فَأُمُّهُۥ هَاوِيَةٞ
data.footnotes:
[1977]- Literally, "mother" (a man's original refuge) , which will envelop him as in an embrace.
[1978]- i.e., the pit of Hellfire.

data.price: (10) And what can make you know what that is?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا هِيَهۡ

data.price: (11) It is a Fire, intensely hot.
data.arabic: نَارٌ حَامِيَةُۢ

data.price: (1) Competition in [worldly] increase diverts you
data.arabic: أَلۡهَىٰكُمُ ٱلتَّكَاثُرُ

data.price: (2) Until you visit the graveyards.[1980]
data.arabic: حَتَّىٰ زُرۡتُمُ ٱلۡمَقَابِرَ
data.footnotes: [1980]- i.e., remain in them temporarily, meaning until the Day of Resurrection.

data.price: (3) No! You are going to know.
data.arabic: كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (4) Then, no! You are going to know.
data.arabic: ثُمَّ كَلَّا سَوۡفَ تَعۡلَمُونَ

data.price: (5) No! If you only knew with knowledge of certainty...[1981]
data.arabic: كَلَّا لَوۡ تَعۡلَمُونَ عِلۡمَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
data.footnotes: [1981]- The conclusion of this verse is estimated to be "...you would not have been distracted from preparing for the Hereafter."

data.price: (6) You will surely see the Hellfire.
data.arabic: لَتَرَوُنَّ ٱلۡجَحِيمَ

data.price: (7) Then you will surely see it with the eye of certainty.[1982]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتَرَوُنَّهَا عَيۡنَ ٱلۡيَقِينِ
data.footnotes: [1982]- i.e., with actual eyesight.

data.price: (8) Then you will surely be asked that Day about pleasure.[1983]
data.arabic: ثُمَّ لَتُسۡـَٔلُنَّ يَوۡمَئِذٍ عَنِ ٱلنَّعِيمِ
data.footnotes: [1983]- i.e., the comforts of worldly life and whether you were grateful to Allāh for His blessings.

data.arabic: وَٱلۡعَصۡرِ
data.footnotes: [1985]- An oath in which Allāh swears by time throughout the ages.

data.price: (2) Indeed, mankind is in loss,
data.arabic: إِنَّ ٱلۡإِنسَٰنَ لَفِي خُسۡرٍ

data.price: (3) Except for those who have believed and done righteous deeds and advised each other to truth and advised each other to patience.
data.arabic: إِلَّا ٱلَّذِينَ ءَامَنُواْ وَعَمِلُواْ ٱلصَّٰلِحَٰتِ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلۡحَقِّ وَتَوَاصَوۡاْ بِٱلصَّبۡرِ

data.price: (1) Woe to every scorner and mocker
data.arabic: وَيۡلٞ لِّكُلِّ هُمَزَةٖ لُّمَزَةٍ

data.price: (2) Who collects wealth and [continuously] counts it.[1987]
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي جَمَعَ مَالٗا وَعَدَّدَهُۥ
data.footnotes: [1987]- Rather than spending in the way of Allāh.

data.price: (3) He thinks that his wealth will make him immortal.
data.arabic: يَحۡسَبُ أَنَّ مَالَهُۥٓ أَخۡلَدَهُۥ

data.price: (4) No! He will surely be thrown into the Crusher.[1988]
data.arabic: كَلَّاۖ لَيُنۢبَذَنَّ فِي ٱلۡحُطَمَةِ
data.footnotes: [1988]- i.e., Hellfire, which crushes and destroys all that enters it.

data.price: (5) And what can make you know what is the Crusher?
data.arabic: وَمَآ أَدۡرَىٰكَ مَا ٱلۡحُطَمَةُ

data.price: (6) It is the fire of Allāh, [eternally] fueled,
data.arabic: نَارُ ٱللَّهِ ٱلۡمُوقَدَةُ

data.price: (7) Which mounts directed at the hearts.[1989]
data.arabic: ٱلَّتِي تَطَّلِعُ عَلَى ٱلۡأَفۡـِٔدَةِ
data.footnotes: [1989]- Covering them and penetrating them.

data.price: (8) Indeed, it [i.e., Hellfire] will be closed down upon them
data.arabic: إِنَّهَا عَلَيۡهِم مُّؤۡصَدَةٞ

data.price: (9) In extended columns.[1990]
data.arabic: فِي عَمَدٖ مُّمَدَّدَةِۭ
data.footnotes: [1990]- Interpreted to be either columns of fire or columns of iron to which are chained the inmates of Hell.

data.price: (1) Have you not considered, [O Muḥammad], how your Lord dealt with the companions of the elephant?[1992]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ تَرَ كَيۡفَ فَعَلَ رَبُّكَ بِأَصۡحَٰبِ ٱلۡفِيلِ
data.footnotes: [1992]- i.e., the army under the command of Abrahah al-Ashram which was accompanied by a huge elephant and came with the intention of destroying the Kaʿbah at Makkah.

data.price: (2) Did He not make their plan into misguidance?[1993]
data.arabic: أَلَمۡ يَجۡعَلۡ كَيۡدَهُمۡ فِي تَضۡلِيلٖ
data.footnotes: [1993]- Causing them to perish.

data.price: (3) And He sent against them birds in flocks,
data.arabic: وَأَرۡسَلَ عَلَيۡهِمۡ طَيۡرًا أَبَابِيلَ

data.price: (4) Striking them with stones of hard clay,
data.arabic: تَرۡمِيهِم بِحِجَارَةٖ مِّن سِجِّيلٖ

data.price: (5) And He made them like eaten straw.[1994]
data.arabic: فَجَعَلَهُمۡ كَعَصۡفٖ مَّأۡكُولِۭ
data.footnotes: [1994]- i.e., husks which have been chewed by cattle. This event took place in the year of the Prophet's birth.

data.price: (1) For the accustomed security of the Quraysh[1996] -
data.arabic: لِإِيلَٰفِ قُرَيۡشٍ
data.footnotes: [1996]- i.e., the honor and reputation Allāh had given them as guardians of the Holy Kaʿbah, which allowed them to travel without fear of being harmed.

data.price: (2) Their accustomed security [in] the caravan of winter and summer[1997] -
data.arabic: إِۦلَٰفِهِمۡ رِحۡلَةَ ٱلشِّتَآءِ وَٱلصَّيۡفِ
data.footnotes: [1997]- i.e., the trading caravans that traveled south in winter and north in summer.

data.price: (3) Let them worship the Lord of this House,[1998]
data.arabic: فَلۡيَعۡبُدُواْ رَبَّ هَٰذَا ٱلۡبَيۡتِ
data.footnotes: [1998]- i.e., the Kaʿbah.

data.price: (4) Who has fed them, [saving them] from hunger and made them safe, [saving them] from fear.
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِيٓ أَطۡعَمَهُم مِّن جُوعٖ وَءَامَنَهُم مِّنۡ خَوۡفِۭ

data.price: (1) Have you seen the one who denies the Recompense?
data.arabic: أَرَءَيۡتَ ٱلَّذِي يُكَذِّبُ بِٱلدِّينِ

data.price: (2) For that is the one who drives away the orphan
data.arabic: فَذَٰلِكَ ٱلَّذِي يَدُعُّ ٱلۡيَتِيمَ

data.price: (3) And does not encourage the feeding of the poor.
data.arabic: وَلَا يَحُضُّ عَلَىٰ طَعَامِ ٱلۡمِسۡكِينِ

data.price: (4) So woe to those who pray
data.arabic: فَوَيۡلٞ لِّلۡمُصَلِّينَ

data.price: (5) [But] who are heedless of their prayer[2000] -
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ عَن صَلَاتِهِمۡ سَاهُونَ
data.footnotes: [2000]- i.e., the hypocrites who are unconcerned if they miss prayers when no one sees them.

data.price: (6) Those who make show [of their deeds]
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِينَ هُمۡ يُرَآءُونَ

data.price: (7) And withhold [simple] assistance.
data.arabic: وَيَمۡنَعُونَ ٱلۡمَاعُونَ

data.price: (1) Indeed, We have granted you, [O Muḥammad], al-Kawthar.
data.arabic: إِنَّآ أَعۡطَيۡنَٰكَ ٱلۡكَوۡثَرَ

data.price: (2) So pray to your Lord and offer sacrifice [to Him alone].
data.arabic: فَصَلِّ لِرَبِّكَ وَٱنۡحَرۡ

data.price: (3) Indeed, your enemy is the one cut off.[2002]
data.arabic: إِنَّ شَانِئَكَ هُوَ ٱلۡأَبۡتَرُ
data.footnotes: [2002]- From all good in this world and the Hereafter.

data.price: (1) Say, "O disbelievers,
data.arabic: قُلۡ يَٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلۡكَٰفِرُونَ

data.price: (2) I do not worship what you worship.
data.arabic: لَآ أَعۡبُدُ مَا تَعۡبُدُونَ

data.price: (3) Nor are you worshippers of what I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: (4) Nor will I be a worshipper of what you worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنَا۠ عَابِدٞ مَّا عَبَدتُّمۡ

data.price: (5) Nor will you be worshippers of what I worship.
data.arabic: وَلَآ أَنتُمۡ عَٰبِدُونَ مَآ أَعۡبُدُ

data.price: (6) For you is your religion, and for me is my religion."
data.arabic: لَكُمۡ دِينُكُمۡ وَلِيَ دِينِ

data.price: (1) When the victory of Allāh has come and the conquest,[2005]
data.arabic: إِذَا جَآءَ نَصۡرُ ٱللَّهِ وَٱلۡفَتۡحُ
data.footnotes: [2005]- The conquest of Makkah.

data.price: (2) And you see the people entering into the religion of Allāh in multitudes,
data.arabic: وَرَأَيۡتَ ٱلنَّاسَ يَدۡخُلُونَ فِي دِينِ ٱللَّهِ أَفۡوَاجٗا

data.price: (3) Then exalt [Him] with praise of your Lord and ask forgiveness of Him. Indeed, He is ever Accepting of Repentance.[2006]
data.arabic: فَسَبِّحۡ بِحَمۡدِ رَبِّكَ وَٱسۡتَغۡفِرۡهُۚ إِنَّهُۥ كَانَ تَوَّابَۢا
data.footnotes: [2006]- Refer to footnote of 2:37.

data.price: (1) May the hands of Abū Lahab be ruined, and ruined is he.[2008]
data.arabic: تَبَّتۡ يَدَآ أَبِي لَهَبٖ وَتَبَّ
data.footnotes: [2008]- Abū Lahab (the Prophet's uncle) , who was an enemy of Islām.

data.price: (2) His wealth will not avail him or that which he gained.
data.arabic: مَآ أَغۡنَىٰ عَنۡهُ مَالُهُۥ وَمَا كَسَبَ

data.price: (3) He will [enter to] burn in a Fire of [blazing] flame
data.arabic: سَيَصۡلَىٰ نَارٗا ذَاتَ لَهَبٖ

data.price: (4) And his wife [as well] - the carrier of firewood.[2009]
data.arabic: وَٱمۡرَأَتُهُۥ حَمَّالَةَ ٱلۡحَطَبِ
data.footnotes: [2009]- She used to put thorns in the Prophet's path and slander him (ﷺ) . The word "firewood" was used by the Arabs to allude to slander and backbiting.

data.price: (5) Around her neck is a rope of [twisted] fiber.
data.arabic: فِي جِيدِهَا حَبۡلٞ مِّن مَّسَدِۭ

data.price: (1) Say, "He is Allāh, [who is] One,[2011]
data.arabic: قُلۡ هُوَ ٱللَّهُ أَحَدٌ
data.footnotes: [2011]- Alone, without another, indivisible with absolute and permanent unity and distinct from all else. The one and only true deity, unique in His essence, attributes and deeds.

data.price: (2) Allāh, the Eternal Refuge.[2012]
data.arabic: ٱللَّهُ ٱلصَّمَدُ
data.footnotes: [2012]- He who is absolute, perfect, complete, essential, self-sufficient and sufficient to meet the needs of all creation; the one eternally and constantly required and sought, depended upon by all existence and to whom all matters will ultimately return.

data.price: (3) He neither begets nor is born,
data.arabic: لَمۡ يَلِدۡ وَلَمۡ يُولَدۡ

data.price: (4) Nor is there to Him any equivalent."
data.arabic: وَلَمۡ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَدُۢ

data.price: (1) Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of daybreak
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلۡفَلَقِ

data.price: (2) From the evil of that which He created
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ

data.price: (3) And from the evil of darkness when it settles
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ

data.price: (4) And from the evil of the blowers in knots[2014]
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ ٱلنَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِي ٱلۡعُقَدِ
data.footnotes: [2014]- i.e., those who practice magic.

data.price: (5) And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
data.arabic: وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ

data.price: (1) Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind,
data.arabic: قُلۡ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: (2) The Sovereign of mankind,
data.arabic: مَلِكِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: (3) The God of mankind,
data.arabic: إِلَٰهِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: (4) From the evil of the retreating whisperer[2016] -
data.arabic: مِن شَرِّ ٱلۡوَسۡوَاسِ ٱلۡخَنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: [2016]- i.e., a devil who makes evil suggestions to man but disappears when one remembers Allāh.

data.price: (5) Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind -
data.arabic: ٱلَّذِي يُوَسۡوِسُ فِي صُدُورِ ٱلنَّاسِ

data.price: (6) From among the jinn and mankind."[2017]
data.arabic: مِنَ ٱلۡجِنَّةِ وَٱلنَّاسِ
data.footnotes: [2017]- Evil prompters may be from men as well as from jinn.

chapters: She that is to be Examined
